" It must be , if [you]120-lord henry say it . And now [I]117-dorian gray am off . [Imogen]174-imogen is waiting for [me]117-dorian gray . Don t forget about to - morrow . Good - bye . "[117-dorian gray]

As [he]117-dorian gray left [the room]386-the room , [Lord Henry]120-lord henry s heavy eyelids drooped , and [he]120-lord henry began to think . Certainly [few people]614-few people had ever interested [him]120-lord henry so much as [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray , and yet [the lad]427-the lad s mad adoration of [some one else]616-some one else caused [him]120-lord henry not the slightest pang of annoyance or jealousy . [He]120-lord henry was pleased by it . It made [him]120-lord henry a more interesting study . [He]120-lord henry had been always enthralled by the methods of natural science , but the ordinary subject - matter of that science had seemed to [him]120-lord henry trivial and of no import . And so [he]120-lord henry had begun by vivisecting [himself]120-lord henry , as [he]120-lord henry had ended by vivisecting [others]1931-others . Human life that appeared to [him]120-lord henry the one thing worth investigating . Compared to it there was nothing else of any value . It was true that as one watched life in its curious crucible of pain and pleasure , one could not wear over one s face a mask of glass , nor keep the sulphurous fumes from troubling the brain and making the imagination turbid with monstrous fancies and misshapen dreams . There were poisons so subtle that to know their properties one had to sicken of them . There were maladies so strange that one had to pass through [them]618-them if one sought to understand [their]618-them nature . And , yet , what a great reward [one]619-one received ! How wonderful [the whole world]2139-the whole world became to [one]381-one ! To note the curious hard logic of passion , and the emotional coloured life of the intellect to observe where [they]622-they met , and where [they]622-they separated , at what point [they]622-they were in unison , and at what point [they]622-they were at discord there was a delight in that ! What matter what the cost was ? [One]381-one could never pay too high a price for any sensation .

[He]120-lord henry was conscious and the thought brought a gleam of pleasure into [his]120-lord henry brown agate eyes that it was through certain words of [his]120-lord henry , musical words said with musical utterance , that [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray s soul had turned to [this white girl]624-this white girl and bowed in worship before [her]624-this white girl . To a large extent [the lad]427-the lad was [his]120-lord henry own creation . [He]120-lord henry had made [him]427-the lad premature . That was something . [Ordinary people]626-ordinary people waited till life disclosed to [them]626-ordinary people its secrets , but to [the few]627-the few , to [the elect]628-the elect , the mysteries of life were revealed before the veil was drawn away . Sometimes this was the effect of art , and chiefly of the art of literature , which dealt immediately with the passions and the intellect . But now and then a complex personality took the place and assumed the office of art , was indeed , in its way , a real work of art , life having its elaborate masterpieces , just as poetry has , or sculpture , or painting .

Yes , [the lad]427-the lad was premature . [He]427-the lad was gathering [his]427-the lad harvest while it was yet spring . The pulse and passion of [youth]630-youth were in [him]427-the lad , but [he]427-the lad was becoming self - conscious . It was delightful to watch [him]427-the lad . With [his]427-the lad beautiful face , and [his]427-the lad beautiful soul , [he]427-the lad was a thing to wonder at . It was no matter how it all ended , or was destined to end . [He]427-the lad was like one of [those gracious figures in a pageant or a play , whose joys seem to be remote from one , but whose sorrows stir one s sense of beauty , and whose wounds are like red roses]631-those gracious figures in a pageant or a play , whose joys seem to be remote from one , but whose sorrows stir one s sense of beauty , and whose wounds are like red roses .

Soul and body , body and soul how mysterious they were ! There was animalism in the soul , and the body had its moments of spirituality . The senses could refine , and the intellect could degrade . Who could say where the fleshly impulse ceased , or the psychical impulse began ? How shallow were the arbitrary definitions of [ordinary psychologists]632-ordinary psychologists ! And yet how difficult to decide between the claims of the various schools ! Was the soul a shadow seated in [the house of sin]633-the house of sin ? Or was the body really in the soul , as [Giordano Bruno]180-giordano bruno thought ? The separation of spirit from matter was a mystery , and the union of spirit with matter was a mystery also .

[He]180-giordano bruno began to wonder whether [we]634-we could ever make psychology so absolute a science that each little spring of life would be revealed to [us]634-we . As it was , [we]634-we always misunderstood [ourselves]634-we and rarely understood [others]1931-others . Experience was of no ethical value . It was merely the name [men]2041-men gave to [their]2041-men mistakes . [Moralists]637-moralists had , as a rule , regarded it as a mode of warning , had claimed for it a certain ethical efficacy in the formation of character , had praised it as something that taught [us]634-we what to follow and showed [us]634-we what to avoid . But there was no motive power in experience . It was as little of an active cause as conscience itself . All that it really demonstrated was that [our]634-we future would be the same as [our]634-we past , and that the sin [we]634-we had done once , and with loathing , [we]634-we would do many times , and with joy .

It was clear to [him]180-giordano bruno that the experimental method was the only method by which one could arrive at any scientific analysis of the passions ; and certainly [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray was a subject made to [his]180-giordano bruno hand , and seemed to promise rich and fruitful results . [His]180-giordano bruno sudden mad love for [Sibyl Vane]168-sibyl was a psychological phenomenon of no small interest . There was no doubt that curiosity had much to do with it , curiosity and the desire for new experiences , yet it was not a simple , but rather a very complex passion . What there was in it of the purely sensuous instinct of boyhood had been transformed by the workings of the imagination , changed into something that seemed to [the lad]427-the lad [himself]427-the lad to be remote from sense , and was for that very reason all the more dangerous . It was the passions about whose origin [we]634-we deceived [ourselves]634-we that tyrannized most strongly over [us]634-we . [Our]634-we weakest motives were those of whose nature [we]634-we were conscious . It often happened that when [we]634-we thought [we]634-we were experimenting on [others]1931-others [we]634-we were really experimenting on [ourselves]634-we .

While [Lord Henry]120-lord henry sat dreaming on these things , a knock came to the door , and [[his]120-lord henry valet]509-his valet entered and reminded [him]120-lord henry it was time to dress for dinner . [He]120-lord henry got up and looked out into [the street]641-the street . The sunset had smitten into scarlet gold the upper windows of [the houses]545-the houses opposite . The panes glowed like plates of heated metal . The sky above was like a faded rose . [He]120-lord henry thought of [[his]120-lord henry friend]643-his friend s young fiery - coloured life and wondered how it was all going to end .

When [he]120-lord henry arrived [home]2087-home , about half - past twelve o clock , [he]120-lord henry saw a telegram lying on the hall table . [He]120-lord henry opened it and found it was from [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray . It was to tell [him]117-dorian gray that [he]117-dorian gray was engaged to be married to [Sibyl Vane]168-sibyl .

CHAPTER V.

" [Mother]2491-mother , [Mother]2491-mother , [I]2212-the girl am so happy ! " [I]652-the elder woman don t know how [we]647-us could manage without [him]182-mr. isaacs , "[652-the elder woman] answered [the elder woman]652-the elder woman querulously .

[Sibyl Vane]168-sibyl tossed [her]168-sibyl head and laughed . " [We]647-us don t want [him]182-mr. isaacs any more , [Mother]2491-mother . [Prince Charming]2453-prince charming rules life for [us]647-us now . "[168-sibyl] Then [she]168-sibyl paused . A rose shook in [her]168-sibyl blood and shadowed [her]168-sibyl cheeks . Quick breath parted the petals of [her]168-sibyl lips . They trembled . Some southern wind of passion swept over [her]168-sibyl and stirred the dainty folds of [her]168-sibyl dress . " [I]168-sibyl love [him]182-mr. isaacs , "[168-sibyl] [she]168-sibyl said simply .

" [Foolish child]2497-foolish child ! [foolish child]2497-foolish child ! "[168-sibyl] was the parrot - phrase flung in answer . The waving of crooked , false - jewelled fingers gave grotesqueness to the words .

[The girl]2212-the girl laughed again . The joy of a caged bird was in [her]2212-the girl voice . [Her]2212-the girl eyes caught the melody and echoed it in radiance , then closed for a moment , as though to hide [their]654-their secret . When [they]654-their opened , the mist of a dream had passed across [them]654-their .

[Thin - lipped wisdom]655-thin - lipped wisdom spoke at [her]2212-the girl from the worn chair , hinted at prudence , quoted from that book of [cowardice whose author apes the name of common sense]656-cowardice whose author apes the name of common sense . [She]2212-the girl did not listen . [She]2212-the girl was free in [her]2212-the girl prison of passion . [[Her]2212-the girl prince]657-her prince , [Prince Charming]185-prince charming , was with [her]2212-the girl . [She]2212-the girl had called on memory to remake [him]185-prince charming . [She]2212-the girl had sent [her]2212-the girl soul to search for [him]185-prince charming , and it had brought [him]185-prince charming back . [His]185-prince charming kiss burned again upon [her]2212-the girl mouth . [Her]2212-the girl eyelids were warm with [his]185-prince charming breath .

Then wisdom altered its method and spoke of espial and discovery . [This young man]658-this young man might be rich . If so , marriage should be thought of . Against the shell of [her]2212-the girl ear broke the waves of worldly cunning . The arrows of craft shot by [her]2212-the girl . [She]2212-the girl saw the thin lips moving , and smiled .

Suddenly [she]2212-the girl felt the need to speak . The wordy silence troubled [her]2212-the girl . " [Mother]184-mother , [Mother]184-mother , "[2212-the girl] [she]2212-the girl cried , " why does [he]185-prince charming love [me]2212-the girl so much ? [I]2212-the girl know why [I]2212-the girl love [him]185-prince charming . [I]2212-the girl love [him]185-prince charming because [he]185-prince charming is like what love [himself]185-prince charming should be . But what does [he]185-prince charming see in [me]2212-the girl ? [I]2212-the girl am not worthy of [him]185-prince charming . And yet why , [I]2212-the girl can not tell though [I]2212-the girl feel so much beneath [him]185-prince charming , [I]2212-the girl don t feel humble . [I]2212-the girl feel proud , terribly proud . [Mother]2491-mother , did [you]2491-mother love [[my]2212-the girl father]2500-my father as [I]2212-the girl love [Prince Charming]185-prince charming ? "[2212-the girl]

[The elder woman]652-the elder woman grew pale beneath the coarse powder that daubed [her]652-the elder woman cheeks , and [her]652-the elder woman dry lips twitched with a spasm of pain . [Sybil]168-sibyl rushed to [her]652-the elder woman , flung [her]168-sibyl arms round [her]168-sibyl neck , and kissed [her]652-the elder woman . " Forgive [me]168-sibyl , [Mother]2491-mother . [I]168-sibyl know it pains [you]2491-mother to talk about [[our]2502-our father]2503-our father . But it only pains [you]2491-mother because [you]2491-mother loved [him]2503-our father so much . [Jim]183-jim frowned from time to time when [he]183-jim caught the inquisitive glance of [some stranger]696-some stranger . [He]183-jim had that dislike of being stared at , which comes on [geniuses]697-geniuses late in life and never leaves the commonplace . [Sibyl]168-sibyl , however , was quite unconscious of the effect [she]168-sibyl was producing . [Her]168-sibyl love was trembling in laughter on [her]168-sibyl lips . [She]168-sibyl was thinking of [Prince Charming]185-prince charming , and , that [she]168-sibyl might think of [him]185-prince charming all the more , [she]168-sibyl did not talk of [him]185-prince charming , but prattled on about [the ship in which [Jim]183-jim was going to sail]698-the ship in which jim was going to sail , about the gold [he]183-jim was certain to find , about [the wonderful heiress whose life [he]183-jim was to save from [the wicked , red - shirted bushrangers]700-the wicked , red - shirted bushrangers]699-the wonderful heiress whose life he was to save from the wicked , red - shirted bushrangers . For [he]183-jim was not to remain [a sailor]701-a sailor , or [a supercargo]702-a supercargo , or whatever [he]183-jim was going to be . Oh , no ! [A sailor]701-a sailor s existence was dreadful . Fancy being cooped up in [a horrid ship]704-a horrid ship , with the hoarse , hump - backed waves trying to get in , and a black wind blowing the masts down and tearing the sails into long screaming ribands ! [He]183-jim was to leave [the vessel]705-the vessel at [Melbourne]32-melbourne , bid a polite good - bye to [the captain]706-the captain , and go off at once to [the gold - fields]707-the gold - fields . [He]183-jim was not to go to [the gold - fields]707-the gold - fields at all . They were [horrid places]712-horrid places , where [men]2041-men got intoxicated , and shot [each other]1942-each other in [bar - rooms]715-bar - rooms , and used bad language . [He]183-jim was to be [a nice sheep - farmer]716-a nice sheep - farmer , and one evening , as [he]183-jim was riding [home]2087-home , [he]183-jim was to see [the beautiful heiress]718-the beautiful heiress being carried off by [a robber on a black horse]719-a robber on a black horse , and give chase , and rescue [her]718-the beautiful heiress . [The lad]427-the lad listened sulkily to [her]718-the beautiful heiress and made no answer . [He]427-the lad was heart - sick at leaving [home]2087-home .

[[His]427-the lad mother]2191-his mother ! [They]735-they took [their]735-they seats amidst [a crowd of watchers]736-a crowd of watchers . The tulip - beds across [the road]737-the road flamed like throbbing rings of fire . A white dust tremulous cloud of orris - root it seemed hung in the panting air . The brightly coloured parasols danced and dipped like monstrous butterflies .

[She]738-she made [[her]738-she brother]688-her brother talk of [himself]688-her brother , [his]688-her brother hopes , [his]688-her brother prospects . [He]688-her brother spoke slowly and with effort . [They]735-they passed words to [each other]1942-each other as [players at a game pass counters]741-players at a game pass counters . [Sibyl]168-sibyl felt oppressed . [She]168-sibyl could not communicate [her]168-sibyl joy . A faint smile curving that sullen mouth was all the echo [she]168-sibyl could win . After some time [she]168-sibyl became silent . Suddenly [she]168-sibyl caught a glimpse of golden hair and laughing lips , and in an open carriage with [two ladies [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray]742-two ladies dorian gray drove past .

[She]168-sibyl started to [her]168-sibyl feet . " There [he]183-jim is ! "[168-sibyl] [she]168-sibyl cried .

" Who ? "[183-jim] said [Jim Vane]183-jim .

" [Prince Charming]185-prince charming , "[168-sibyl] [she]168-sibyl answered , looking after [the victoria]743-the victoria .

[He]183-jim jumped up and seized [her]168-sibyl roughly by the arm . " Show [him]183-jim to [me]183-jim . Which is [he]183-jim ? Point [him]183-jim out . [I]183-jim must see [him]183-jim ! "[183-jim] [he]183-jim exclaimed ; but at that moment [the Duke of Berwick]744-the duke of berwick s four - in - hand came between , and when it had left [the space]745-the space clear , [the carriage]746-the carriage had swept out of [the park]2309-the park .

" [He]183-jim is gone , "[168-sibyl] murmured [Sibyl]168-sibyl sadly . " [I]168-sibyl wish [you]168-sibyl had seen [him]183-jim . "[168-sibyl]

" [I]183-jim wish [I]183-jim had , for as sure as there is [a God]2561-a god in [heaven]2562-heaven , if [he]183-jim ever does [you]168-sibyl any wrong , [I]183-jim shall kill [him]183-jim . "[183-jim]

[She]168-sibyl looked at [him]183-jim in horror . [He]183-jim repeated [his]183-jim words . They cut the air like a dagger . [The people]1905-the people round began to gape . [A lady standing close to [her]749-a lady standing close to her]749-a lady standing close to her tittered .

" Come away , [Jim]183-jim ; come away , "[749-a lady standing close to her] [she]749-a lady standing close to her whispered . [He]183-jim followed [her]749-a lady standing close to her doggedly as [she]749-a lady standing close to her passed through [the crowd]750-the crowd . [He]183-jim felt glad at what [he]183-jim had said .

When [they]751-they reached [the Achilles Statue]33-the achilles statue , [she]168-sibyl turned round . There was pity in [her]168-sibyl eyes that became laughter on [her]168-sibyl lips . [She]168-sibyl shook [her]168-sibyl head at [him]183-jim . " [You]183-jim are foolish , [Jim]183-jim , utterly foolish ; [a bad - tempered boy]2563-a bad - tempered boy , that is all . How can [you]183-jim say such horrible things ? [You]183-jim don t know what [you]183-jim are talking about . [You]183-jim are simply jealous and unkind . Ah ! [I]168-sibyl wish [you]183-jim would fall in love . Love makes [people]1933-people good , and what [you]183-jim said was wicked . "[168-sibyl]

" [I]183-jim am sixteen , "[183-jim] [he]183-jim answered , " and [I]183-jim know what [I]183-jim am about . [Mother]2491-mother is no help to [you]183-jim . [She]2491-mother doesn t understand how to look after [you]183-jim . [I]183-jim wish now that [I]183-jim was not going to [Australia]31-australia at all . [I]183-jim have a great mind to chuck the whole thing up . [I]183-jim would , if [my]183-jim articles hadn t been signed . "[183-jim]

" Oh , don t be so serious , [Jim]183-jim . [You]183-jim are like one of the heroes of those silly melodramas [Mother]184-mother used to be so fond of acting in . [I]753-i am not going to quarrel with [you]183-jim . [I]753-i have seen [him]183-jim , and oh ! to see [him]183-jim is perfect happiness . [We]2566-we won t quarrel . [I]753-i know [you]183-jim would never harm [any one [I]753-i love]2567-any one i love , would [you]183-jim ? "[753-i]

" Not as long as [you]183-jim love [him]183-jim , [I]753-i suppose , "[753-i] was the sullen answer .

" [I]752-she shall love [him]183-jim for ever ! "[752-she] [she]752-she cried .

" And [he]183-jim ? "[753-i]

" For ever , too ! "[753-i]

" [He]183-jim had better . "[753-i]

[She]752-she shrank from [him]753-i . Then [she]752-she laughed and put [her]752-she hand on [his]753-i arm . [He]753-i was merely [a boy]754-a boy .

At [the Marble Arch]755-the marble arch [they]756-they hailed [an omnibus]757-an omnibus , which left [them]756-they close to [[their]756-they shabby home in [the Euston Road]34-the euston road]758-their shabby home in the euston road . It was after five o clock , and [Sibyl]168-sibyl had to lie down for a couple of hours before acting . [Jim]183-jim insisted that [she]752-she should do so . [He]183-jim said that [he]183-jim would sooner part with [her]752-she when [[their]756-they mother]759-their mother was not present . [She]752-she would be sure to make a scene , and [he]183-jim detested scenes of every kind .

In [[Sybil]168-sibyl s own room]760-sybil s own room [they]756-they parted . There was jealousy in [the lad]427-the lad s heart , and a fierce murderous hatred of [the stranger who , as it seemed to [him]183-jim , had come between [them]756-they]762-the stranger who , as it seemed to him , had come between them . Yet , when [her]752-she arms were flung round [his]183-jim neck , and [her]752-she fingers strayed through [his]183-jim hair , [he]183-jim softened and kissed [her]752-she with real affection . There were tears in [his]183-jim eyes as [he]183-jim went [downstairs]763-downstairs .

[[His]183-jim mother]2191-his mother was waiting for [him]183-jim below . [She]2191-his mother grumbled at [his]183-jim unpunctuality , as [he]183-jim entered . [He]183-jim made no answer , but sat down to [his]183-jim meagre meal . The flies buzzed round the table and crawled over the stained cloth . Through the rumble of omnibuses , and the clatter of [street - cabs]765-street - cabs , [he]183-jim could hear the droning voice devouring each minute that was left to [him]183-jim .

After some time , [he]183-jim thrust away [his]183-jim plate and put [his]183-jim head in [his]183-jim hands . [He]183-jim felt that [he]183-jim had a right to know . It should have been told to [him]183-jim before , if it was as [he]183-jim suspected . Leaden with fear , [[his]183-jim mother]2191-his mother watched [him]183-jim . Words dropped mechanically from [her]2191-his mother lips . A tattered lace handkerchief twitched in [her]2191-his mother fingers . When the clock struck six , [he]183-jim got up and went to the door . Then [he]183-jim turned back and looked at [her]2191-his mother . [Their]767-their eyes met . In [hers]2191-his mother [he]183-jim saw a wild appeal for mercy . It enraged [him]183-jim .

" [Mother]184-mother , [I]183-jim have something to ask [you]2191-his mother , "[183-jim] [he]183-jim said . [Her]2191-his mother eyes wandered vaguely about [the room]386-the room . [She]2191-his mother made no answer . " Tell [me]2191-his mother the truth . [I]2191-his mother have a right to know . Were [you]183-jim married to [[my]2191-his mother father]2500-my father ? "[2191-his mother]

[She]2191-his mother heaved a deep sigh . It was a sigh of relief . The terrible moment , the moment that night and day , for weeks and months , [she]2191-his mother had dreaded , had come at last , and yet [she]2191-his mother felt no terror . Indeed , in some measure it was a disappointment to [her]2191-his mother . The vulgar directness of the question called for a direct answer . The situation had not been gradually led up to . It was crude . It reminded [her]2191-his mother of a bad rehearsal .

" No , "[2191-his mother] [she]2191-his mother answered , wondering at the harsh simplicity of life .

" [[My]427-the lad father]2500-my father was [a scoundrel]2570-a scoundrel then ! "[427-the lad] cried [the lad]427-the lad , clenching [his]427-the lad fists .

[She]2191-his mother shook [her]2191-his mother head . " [I]2191-his mother knew [he]2500-my father was not free . [We]2571-we loved [each other]1942-each other very much . If [he]2500-my father had lived , [he]2500-my father would have made provision for [us]2571-we . Don t speak against [him]2500-my father , [[my]2191-his mother son]2507-my son . [He]2500-my father was [[your]2507-my son father]2234-your father , and [a gentleman]504-a gentleman . Indeed , [he]2500-my father was highly connected . "[2191-his mother]

An oath broke from [his]427-the lad lips . " [I]427-the lad don t care for [myself]427-the lad , "[427-the lad] [he]427-the lad exclaimed , " but don t let [Sibyl]168-sibyl .... It is [a gentleman]504-a gentleman , isn t it , who is in love with [her]168-sibyl , or says [he]504-a gentleman is ? Highly connected , too , [I]427-the lad suppose . "[427-the lad]

For a moment a hideous sense of humiliation came over [the woman]770-the woman . [Her]770-the woman head drooped . [She]770-the woman wiped [her]770-the woman eyes with shaking hands . " [Sibyl]168-sibyl has [a mother]2577-a mother , "[770-the woman] [she]770-the woman murmured ; " [I]770-the woman had none . "[770-the woman]

[The lad]427-the lad was touched . [He]427-the lad went towards [her]770-the woman , and stooping down , [he]427-the lad kissed [her]770-the woman . " [I]427-the lad am sorry if [I]427-the lad have pained [you]770-the woman by asking about [[my]427-the lad father]2500-my father , "[427-the lad] [he]427-the lad said , " but [I]427-the lad could not help it . [I]427-the lad must go now . Good - bye . Don t forget that [you]770-the woman will have only [one child]2579-one child now to look after , and believe [me]427-the lad that if [this man]2580-this man wrongs [[my]427-the lad sister]2581-my sister , [I]427-the lad will find out who [he]2580-this man is , track [him]2580-this man down , and kill [him]2580-this man like a dog . [I]427-the lad swear it . "[427-the lad]

The exaggerated folly of the threat , the passionate gesture that accompanied it , the mad melodramatic words , made life seem more vivid to [her]770-the woman . [She]770-the woman was familiar with the atmosphere . [She]770-the woman breathed more freely , and for the first time for many months [she]770-the woman really admired [[her]770-the woman son]666-her son . [She]770-the woman would have liked to have continued the scene on the same emotional scale , but [he]666-her son cut [her]770-the woman short . Trunks had to be carried down and mufflers looked for . [The lodging - house drudge]773-the lodging - house drudge bustled in and out . There was the bargaining with [the cabman]774-the cabman . The moment was lost in vulgar details . It was with a renewed feeling of disappointment that [she]770-the woman waved the tattered lace handkerchief from the window , as [[her]770-the woman son]666-her son drove away . [She]770-the woman was conscious that a great opportunity had been wasted . [She]770-the woman consoled [herself]770-the woman by telling [Sibyl]168-sibyl how desolate [she]770-the woman felt [her]770-the woman life would be , now that [she]770-the woman had [only one child]776-only one child to look after . [She]770-the woman remembered the phrase . It had pleased [her]770-the woman . Of the threat [she]770-the woman said nothing . It was vividly and dramatically expressed . [She]770-the woman felt that [they]777-they would all laugh at it some day .

CHAPTER VI .

" [I]120-lord henry suppose [you]121-basil have heard the news , [Basil]121-basil ? "[357-the artist]

" [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray is engaged to be married , "[120-lord henry] said [Lord Henry]120-lord henry , watching [him]121-basil as [he]121-basil spoke .

" [I]121-basil hope [the girl]2212-the girl is good , [Harry]120-lord henry . [I]121-basil don t want to see [Dorian]117-dorian gray tied to some vile creature , who might degrade [his]2588-dorian nature and ruin [his]2588-dorian intellect . "[121-basil]

"[120-lord henry]

" Are [you]389-the painter serious ? "[121-basil]

" But do [you]389-the painter approve of it , [Harry]120-lord henry ? " [I]120-lord henry never approve , or disapprove , of anything now . It is an absurd attitude to take towards life . [We]2595-we are not sent into [the world]1908-the world to air [our]2595-we moral prejudices . [I]120-lord henry never take any notice of what [common people]2598-common people say , and [I]120-lord henry never interfere with what [charming people]2599-charming people do . If a personality fascinates [me]120-lord henry , whatever mode of expression that personality selects is absolutely delightful to [me]120-lord henry . [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray falls in love with [a beautiful girl who acts [Juliet]171-juliet , and proposes to marry [her]2600-a beautiful girl who acts juliet , and proposes to marry her]2600-a beautiful girl who acts juliet , and proposes to marry her . Why not ? If [he]117-dorian gray wedded [Messalina]188-messalina , [he]117-dorian gray would be none the less interesting . [You]389-the painter know [I]120-lord henry am not [a champion of marriage]2601-a champion of marriage . The real drawback to marriage is that it makes one unselfish . [And unselfish people]2602-and unselfish people are colourless . [They]2602-and unselfish people lack individuality . Still , there are certain temperaments that marriage makes more complex . [They]2602-and unselfish people retain [their]2602-and unselfish people egotism , and add to it many other egos . [They]2602-and unselfish people are forced to have more than one life . [They]2602-and unselfish people become more highly organized , and to be highly organized is , [I]120-lord henry should fancy , the object of [man]364-man s existence . Besides , every experience is of value , and whatever [one]381-one may say against marriage , it is certainly an experience . [I]120-lord henry hope that [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray will make [this girl]2406-this girl [[his]117-dorian gray wife]2313-his wife , passionately adore [her]2406-this girl for six months , and then suddenly become fascinated by [some one else]616-some one else . [He]117-dorian gray would be [a wonderful study]2608-a wonderful study . "[120-lord henry]

" [You]2609-you don t mean a single word of all that , [Harry]120-lord henry ; [you]2609-you know [you]2609-you don t. If [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray s life were spoiled , [no one]2310-no one would be sorrier than [yourself]2609-you . [You]2609-you are much better than [you]2609-you pretend to be . "[389-the painter]

[Lord Henry]120-lord henry laughed . " The reason [we]2611-we all like to think so well of [others]1931-others is that [we]2611-we are all afraid for [ourselves]2611-we . The basis of optimism is sheer terror . [We]2611-we think that [we]2611-we are generous because [we]2611-we credit [[our]2611-we neighbour]2613-our neighbour with the possession of those virtues that are likely to be a benefit to [us]2611-we . [We]2611-we praise [the banker]2614-the banker that [we]2611-we may overdraw [our]2611-we account , and find good qualities in [the highwayman]2615-the highwayman in the hope that [he]2615-the highwayman may spare [our]2611-we pockets . [I]120-lord henry mean everything that [I]120-lord henry have said . [I]120-lord henry have the greatest contempt for optimism . As for a spoiled life , no life is spoiled but one whose growth is arrested . If [you]2616-you want to mar a nature , [you]2616-you have merely to reform it . As for marriage , of course that would be silly , but there are other and more interesting bonds between [men]2041-men and [women]2058-women . [I]120-lord henry will certainly encourage [them]2619-them . [They]2619-them have the charm of being fashionable . But here is [Dorian]2620-dorian [himself]2620-dorian . [He]2620-dorian will tell [you]2616-you more than [I]120-lord henry can . "[120-lord henry]

" [[My]427-the lad dear]1914-my dear [Harry]120-lord henry , [[my]427-the lad dear]1914-my dear [Basil]121-basil , [you]2616-you must both congratulate [me]427-the lad ! "[427-the lad] said [the lad]427-the lad , throwing off [his]427-the lad evening cape with its satin - lined wings and shaking each of [[his]427-the lad friends]390-his friends by the hand in turn . " [I]427-the lad have never been so happy . Of course , it is sudden all really delightful things are . "[427-the lad] [He]427-the lad was flushed with excitement and pleasure , and looked extraordinarily handsome .

" [I]121-basil hope [you]2616-you will always be very happy , [Dorian]2623-dorian , "[121-basil] said [Hallward]121-basil , " but [I]121-basil don t quite forgive [you]2616-you for not having let [me]121-basil know of [your]2616-you engagement . " And [I]120-lord henry don t forgive [you]2616-you for being late for dinner , "[120-lord henry] broke in [Lord Henry]120-lord henry , putting [his]120-lord henry hand on [the lad]427-the lad s shoulder and smiling as [he]120-lord henry spoke . " Come , let [us]787-us sit down and try what [the new _ chef]2624-the new _ chef _ [here]2327-here is like , and then [you]2616-you will tell [us]787-us how it all came about . "[120-lord henry]

" There is really not much to tell , "[786-dorian] cried [Dorian]786-dorian as [they]787-us took [their]787-us seats at the small round table . " What happened was simply this . After [I]786-dorian left [you]120-lord henry yesterday evening , [Harry]120-lord henry , [I]786-dorian dressed , had some dinner at [that little Italian restaurant in [Rupert Street]36-rupert street [you]120-lord henry introduced [me]786-dorian to]2626-that little italian restaurant in rupert street you introduced me to , and went down at eight o clock to [the theatre]2164-the theatre . [Sibyl]168-sibyl was playing [Rosalind]177-rosalind . Of course , the scenery was dreadful and the Orlando absurd . But [Sibyl]168-sibyl ! [You]120-lord henry should have seen [her]168-sibyl ! When [she]168-sibyl came on in [her]168-sibyl boy s clothes , [she]168-sibyl was perfectly wonderful . [She]168-sibyl wore a moss - coloured velvet jerkin with cinnamon sleeves , slim , brown , cross - gartered hose , a dainty little green cap with a hawk s feather caught in a jewel , and a hooded cloak lined with dull red . [She]168-sibyl had never seemed to [me]786-dorian more exquisite . [She]168-sibyl had all the delicate grace of that Tanagra figurine that [you]120-lord henry have in [[your]120-lord henry studio]2628-your studio , [Basil]121-basil . [Her]168-sibyl hair clustered round [her]168-sibyl face like dark leaves round a pale rose . As for [her]168-sibyl acting well , [you]120-lord henry shall see [her]168-sibyl to - night . [She]168-sibyl is simply [a born artist]2629-a born artist . [I]786-dorian sat in the dingy box absolutely enthralled . [I]786-dorian forgot that [I]786-dorian was in [London]2-london and in the nineteenth century . [I]786-dorian was away with [my]786-dorian love in [a forest]2630-a forest that [no man]2631-no man had ever seen . After the performance was over , [I]786-dorian went behind and spoke to [her]168-sibyl . As [we]2632-we were sitting together , suddenly there came into [her]168-sibyl eyes a look that [I]786-dorian had never seen there before . [My]786-dorian lips moved towards [hers]168-sibyl . [We]2632-we kissed [each other]1942-each other . [I]786-dorian can t describe to [you]2634-you what [I]786-dorian felt at that moment . It seemed to [me]786-dorian that all [my]786-dorian life had been narrowed to one perfect point of rose - coloured joy . [She]168-sibyl trembled all over and shook like a white narcissus . Then [she]168-sibyl flung [herself]168-sibyl on [her]168-sibyl knees and kissed [my]786-dorian hands . [I]786-dorian feel that [I]786-dorian should not tell [you]2634-you all this , but [I]786-dorian can t help it . Of course , [our]2632-we engagement is a dead secret . [She]168-sibyl has not even told [[her]168-sibyl own mother]2635-her own mother . [I]786-dorian don t know what [[my]786-dorian guardians]2636-my guardians will say . [Lord Radley]189-lord radley is sure to be furious . [I]786-dorian don t care . [I]786-dorian shall be of age in less than a year , and then [I]786-dorian can do what [I]786-dorian like . [I]786-dorian have been right , [Basil]121-basil , haven t [I]786-dorian , to take [my]786-dorian love out of poetry and to find [[my]786-dorian wife]1939-my wife in Shakespeare s plays ? Lips that [Shakespeare]172-shakespeare taught to speak have whispered their secret in [my]786-dorian ear . [I]786-dorian have had the arms of [Rosalind]177-rosalind around [me]786-dorian , and kissed [Juliet]171-juliet on the mouth . "[786-dorian]

" Yes , [Dorian]117-dorian gray , [I]121-basil suppose [you]117-dorian gray were right , "[121-basil] said [Hallward]121-basil slowly .

" Have [you]117-dorian gray seen [her]1939-my wife to - day ? "[120-lord henry] asked [Lord Henry]120-lord henry .

" [[My]117-dorian gray dear]1914-my dear [Harry]120-lord henry , [I]117-dorian gray did not treat it as a business transaction , and [I]117-dorian gray did not make any formal proposal . " [Women]2058-women are wonderfully practical , "[120-lord henry] murmured [Lord Henry]120-lord henry , " much more practical than [we]2058-women are . " [I]120-lord henry asked the question for the best reason possible , for the only reason , indeed , that excuses one for asking any question simple curiosity . "[117-dorian gray]

" To be good is to be in harmony with one s self , "[120-lord henry] [he]120-lord henry replied , touching the thin stem of [his]120-lord henry glass with [his]120-lord henry pale , fine - pointed fingers . " Discord is to be forced to be in harmony with [others]1931-others . One s own life that is the important thing . As for the lives of [one s neighbours]2658-one s neighbours , if [one]381-one wishes to be [a prig]2660-a prig or [a Puritan]2661-a puritan , [one]381-one can flaunt one s moral views about [them]2658-one s neighbours , but they are not one s concern . " But , surely , if [one]381-one lives merely for one s self , [Harry]120-lord henry , [one]381-one pays a terrible price for doing so ? "[389-the painter] suggested [the painter]389-the painter .

" Yes , [we]2664-we are overcharged for everything nowadays . [Lord Henry]120-lord henry shrugged [his]120-lord henry shoulders . " [[My]120-lord henry dear fellow]1907-my dear fellow , medi val art is charming , but medi val emotions are out of date . [They]792-their got up and put on [their]792-their coats , sipping [their]792-their coffee standing . [The painter]389-the painter was silent and preoccupied . [He]389-the painter could not bear this marriage , and yet it seemed to [him]389-the painter to be better than many other things that might have happened . When [the cab]797-the cab drew up at [the theatre]2164-the theatre , it seemed to [him]389-the painter that [he]389-the painter had grown years older .

CHAPTER VII .

For some reason or other , [the house]425-the house was crowded that night , and [the fat Jew manager who met [them]792-their at the door]800-the fat jew manager who met them at the door was beaming from ear to ear with an oily tremulous smile . [He]800-the fat jew manager who met them at the door escorted [them]792-their to [[their]792-their box]801-their box with a sort of pompous humility , waving [his]800-the fat jew manager who met them at the door fat jewelled hands and talking at the top of [his]800-the fat jew manager who met them at the door voice . [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray loathed [him]117-dorian gray more than ever . [He]117-dorian gray felt as if [he]117-dorian gray had come to look for [Miranda]191-miranda and had been met by [Caliban]119-caliban . [Lord Henry]120-lord henry , upon the other hand , rather liked [him]117-dorian gray . At least [he]800-the fat jew manager who met them at the door declared [he]800-the fat jew manager who met them at the door did , and insisted on shaking [him]117-dorian gray by the hand and assuring [him]117-dorian gray that [he]800-the fat jew manager who met them at the door was proud to meet [a man who had discovered a real genius and gone bankrupt over [a poet]803-a poet]802-a man who had discovered a real genius and gone bankrupt over a poet . [Hallward]121-basil amused [himself]121-basil with watching the faces in [the pit]2402-the pit . The heat was terribly oppressive , and the huge sunlight flamed like a monstrous dahlia with petals of yellow fire . [The youths in [the gallery]2387-the gallery]805-the youths in the gallery had taken off [their]805-the youths in the gallery coats and waistcoats and hung [them]805-the youths in the gallery over the side . [They]805-the youths in the gallery talked to [each other]1942-each other across [the theatre]2164-the theatre and shared [their]805-the youths in the gallery oranges with [the tawdry girls who sat beside [them]805-the youths in the gallery]809-the tawdry girls who sat beside them . [Some women]810-some women were laughing in [the pit]2402-the pit . [Their]810-some women voices were horribly shrill and discordant . The sound of the popping of corks came from [the bar]812-the bar .

" What a place to find [one s divinity]2693-one s divinity in ! "[120-lord henry] said [Lord Henry]120-lord henry .

" Yes ! "[117-dorian gray] answered [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray . " It was [here]2327-here [I]117-dorian gray found [her]2695-she , and [she]2695-she is divine beyond all living things . When [she]2695-she acts , [you]2696-you will forget everything . [These common rough people]2697-these common rough people , with [their]2697-these common rough people coarse faces and brutal gestures , become quite different when [she]2695-she is on the stage . [They]2697-these common rough people sit silently and watch [her]2695-she . [They]2697-these common rough people weep and laugh as [she]2695-she wills [them]2697-these common rough people to do . [She]2695-she makes [them]2697-these common rough people as responsive as a violin . [She]2695-she spiritualizes [them]2697-these common rough people , and [one]381-one feels that [they]2697-these common rough people are of the same flesh and blood as one s self . "[117-dorian gray]

" The same flesh and blood as [one s self]2100-one s self ! Oh , [I]120-lord henry hope not ! "[120-lord henry] exclaimed [Lord Henry]120-lord henry , who was scanning [the occupants of [the gallery]2387-the gallery]813-the occupants of the gallery through [his]120-lord henry opera - glass .

" Don t pay any attention to [him]2695-she , [Dorian]2700-dorian , "[389-the painter] said [the painter]389-the painter . " [I]389-the painter understand what [you]2700-dorian mean , and [I]389-the painter believe in [this girl]2406-this girl . [Any one [you]2700-dorian love]2702-any one you love must be marvellous , and [any girl who has the effect [you]2700-dorian describe]2703-any girl who has the effect you describe must be fine and noble . To spiritualize [one]381-one [s]381-one age that is something worth doing . If [this girl]2406-this girl can give a soul to [those who have lived without one]2706-those who have lived without one , if [she]2406-this girl can create the sense of beauty in [people whose lives have been sordid and ugly]2707-people whose lives have been sordid and ugly , if [she]2406-this girl can strip [them]2707-people whose lives have been sordid and ugly of [their]2707-people whose lives have been sordid and ugly selfishness and lend [them]2707-people whose lives have been sordid and ugly tears for sorrows that are not [their]2707-people whose lives have been sordid and ugly own , [she]2406-this girl is worthy of all [your]2700-dorian adoration , worthy of the adoration of [the world]1908-the world . This marriage is quite right . [I]389-the painter did not think so at first , but [I]389-the painter admit it now . [The gods]1932-the gods made [Sibyl Vane]168-sibyl for [you]2700-dorian . Without [her]168-sibyl [you]2700-dorian would have been incomplete . "[389-the painter]

" Thanks , [Basil]121-basil , "[117-dorian gray] answered [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray , pressing [his]117-dorian gray hand . " [I]117-dorian gray knew that [you]121-basil would understand [me]117-dorian gray . [Harry]120-lord henry is so cynical , [he]120-lord henry terrifies [me]117-dorian gray . But here is the orchestra . It is quite dreadful , but it only lasts for about five minutes . Then the curtain rises , and [you]121-basil will see [the girl to whom [I]117-dorian gray am going to give all [my]117-dorian gray life , to whom [I]117-dorian gray have given everything that is good in [me]117-dorian gray]2710-the girl to whom i am going to give all my life , to whom i have given everything that is good in me . "[117-dorian gray]

A quarter of an hour afterwards , amidst an extraordinary turmoil of applause , [Sibyl Vane]168-sibyl stepped on to [the stage]816-the stage . Yes , [she]168-sibyl was certainly lovely to look at one of the loveliest creatures , [Lord Henry]120-lord henry thought , that [he]120-lord henry had ever seen . There was something of the fawn in [her]168-sibyl shy grace and startled eyes . A faint blush , like the shadow of a rose in a mirror of silver , came to [her]168-sibyl cheeks as [she]168-sibyl glanced at [the crowded enthusiastic house]817-the crowded enthusiastic house . [She]168-sibyl stepped back a few paces and [her]168-sibyl lips seemed to tremble . [Basil Hallward]121-basil leaped to [his]121-basil feet and began to applaud . Motionless , and as [one in a dream]818-one in a dream , sat [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray , gazing at [her]168-sibyl . [Lord Henry]120-lord henry peered through [his]120-lord henry glasses , murmuring , " Charming ! charming ! "[120-lord henry]

The scene was [the hall of [[Capulet]178-lady capulet s house]820-capulet s house]819-the hall of capulet s house , and [Romeo]170-romeo in [his]821-his pilgrim s dress had entered with [Mercutio]173-mercutio and [[his]821-his other friends]822-his other friends . [The band]823-the band , such as it was , struck up a few bars of music , and the dance began . Through the crowd of [ungainly , shabbily dressed actors]824-ungainly , shabbily dressed actors , [Sibyl Vane]168-sibyl moved like a creature from a finer world . [Her]168-sibyl body swayed , while [she]168-sibyl danced , as a plant sways in the water . The curves of [her]168-sibyl throat were the curves of a white lily . [Her]168-sibyl hands seemed to be made of cool ivory .

Yet [she]168-sibyl was curiously listless . [She]168-sibyl showed no sign of joy when [her]168-sibyl eyes rested on [Romeo]170-romeo . The few words [she]168-sibyl had to speak

[Good pilgrim]825-good pilgrim , [you]826-you do wrong [your]826-you hand too much , Which mannerly devotion shows in this ; For [saints]827-saints have hands that [pilgrims hands]828-pilgrims hands do touch , And palm to palm is holy palmers kiss

with the brief dialogue that follows , were spoken in a thoroughly artificial manner . The voice was exquisite , but from the point of view of tone it was absolutely false . It was wrong in colour . It took away all the life from the verse . It made the passion unreal .

[Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray grew pale as [he]117-dorian gray watched [her]168-sibyl . [He]117-dorian gray was puzzled and anxious . [Neither of [[his]117-dorian gray friends]390-his friends]829-neither of his friends dared to say anything to [him]117-dorian gray . [She]168-sibyl seemed to [them]390-his friends to be absolutely incompetent . [They]390-his friends were horribly disappointed .

Yet [they]390-his friends felt that the true test of any [Juliet]171-juliet is the balcony scene of the second act . [They]390-his friends waited for that . If [she]168-sibyl failed there , there was nothing in [her]168-sibyl .

[She]168-sibyl looked charming as [she]168-sibyl came out in the moonlight . That could not be denied . But the staginess of [her]168-sibyl acting was unbearable , and grew worse as [she]168-sibyl went on . [Her]168-sibyl gestures became absurdly artificial . [She]168-sibyl overemphasized everything that [she]168-sibyl had to say . The beautiful passage

[Thou]831-thou knowest the mask of night is on [my]0-perles ruisselant face , Else would [a maiden]832-a maiden blush bepaint [my]0-perles ruisselant cheek For that which [thou]831-thou hast heard [me]0-perles ruisselant speak to - night

was declaimed with the painful precision of [a schoolgirl who has been taught to recite by some second - rate professor of elocution]833-a schoolgirl who has been taught to recite by some second - rate professor of elocution . When [she]168-sibyl leaned over [the balcony]834-the balcony and came to those wonderful lines

Although [I]0-perles ruisselant joy in [thee]835-thee , [I]0-perles ruisselant have no joy of this contract to - night : It is too rash , too unadvised , too sudden ; Too like the lightning , which doth cease to be Ere [one]381-one can say , " It lightens . "[381-one] Sweet , good - night ! This bud of love by summer s ripening breath May prove a beauteous flower when next [we]837-we meet

[she]168-sibyl spoke the words as though they conveyed no meaning to [her]168-sibyl . It was not nervousness . Indeed , so far from being nervous , [she]168-sibyl was absolutely self - contained . It was simply bad art . [She]168-sibyl was a complete failure .

Even [the common uneducated audience of the pit and gallery]838-the common uneducated audience of the pit and gallery lost [their]838-the common uneducated audience of the pit and gallery interest in the play . [They]838-the common uneducated audience of the pit and gallery got restless , and began to talk loudly and to whistle . [The Jew manager , who was standing at the back of the dress - circle]839-the jew manager , who was standing at the back of the dress - circle , stamped and swore with rage . [The only person unmoved]840-the only person unmoved was [the girl]2212-the girl [herself]2212-the girl .

When the second act was over , there came a storm of hisses , and [Lord Henry]120-lord henry got up from [his]120-lord henry chair and put on [his]120-lord henry coat . " [She]2212-the girl is quite beautiful , [Dorian]2711-dorian , "[120-lord henry] [he]120-lord henry said , " but [she]2212-the girl can t act . Let [us]837-we go . "[120-lord henry]

" [I]427-the lad am going to see the play through , "[427-the lad] answered [the lad]427-the lad , in a hard bitter voice . " [I]427-the lad am awfully sorry that [I]427-the lad have made [you]120-lord henry waste an evening , [Harry]120-lord henry . [I]427-the lad apologize to [you]120-lord henry both . "[427-the lad]

" [[My]121-basil dear]1914-my dear [Dorian]117-dorian gray , [I]121-basil should think [Miss Vane]168-sibyl was ill , "[121-basil] interrupted [Hallward]121-basil . " [We]837-we will come some other night . "[121-basil]

" [I]121-basil wish [she]2212-the girl were ill , "[121-basil] [he]121-basil rejoined . " But [she]2212-the girl seems to [me]121-basil to be simply callous and cold . [She]2212-the girl has entirely altered . Last night [she]2212-the girl was [a great artist]2713-a great artist . This evening [she]2212-the girl is merely [a commonplace mediocre actress]2714-a commonplace mediocre actress . "[121-basil]

" Don t talk like that about [any one [you]117-dorian gray love]2702-any one you love , [Dorian]2716-dorian . Love is a more wonderful thing than art . "[121-basil]

" They are both simply forms of imitation , "[120-lord henry] remarked [Lord Henry]120-lord henry . " But do let [us]837-we go . [Dorian]2717-dorian , [you]2717-dorian must not stay [here]2327-here any longer . It is not good for [one]381-one s morals to see bad acting . Besides , [I]120-lord henry don t suppose [you]2717-dorian will want [[your]2717-dorian wife]2720-your wife to act , so what does it matter if [she]2720-your wife plays [Juliet]171-juliet like a wooden doll ? [She]2720-your wife is very lovely , and if [she]2720-your wife knows as little about life as [she]2720-your wife does about acting , [she]2720-your wife will be a delightful experience . Good heavens , [[my]120-lord henry dear boy]2346-my dear boy , don t look so tragic ! The secret of [remaining young]2724-remaining young is never to have an emotion that is unbecoming . What more can [you]2346-my dear boy want ? "[120-lord henry]

" Go away , [Harry]120-lord henry , "[427-the lad] cried [the lad]427-the lad . " [I]427-the lad want to be alone . [Basil]121-basil , [you]121-basil must go . [His]427-the lad lips trembled , and rushing to the back of the box , [he]427-the lad leaned up against the wall , hiding [his]427-the lad face in [his]427-the lad hands .

" Let [us]394-the two young men go , [Basil]121-basil , "[120-lord henry] said [Lord Henry]120-lord henry with a strange tenderness in [his]120-lord henry voice , and [the two young men]394-the two young men passed out together .

A few moments afterwards the footlights flared up and the curtain rose on the third act . [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray went back to [his]117-dorian gray seat . [He]117-dorian gray looked pale , and proud , and indifferent . The play dragged on , and seemed interminable . [Half of [the audience]2080-the audience]845-half of the audience went out , tramping in heavy boots and laughing . The whole thing was a _ fiasco _ . The last act was played to almost [empty benches]847-empty benches . The curtain went down on a titter and some groans .

As soon as it was over , [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray rushed behind the scenes into [the greenroom]848-the greenroom . [The girl]2212-the girl was standing there alone , with a look of triumph on [her]2212-the girl face . [Her]2212-the girl eyes were lit with an exquisite fire . There was a radiance about [her]2212-the girl . [Her]2212-the girl parted lips were smiling over some secret of their own .

When [he]117-dorian gray entered , [she]2212-the girl looked at [him]117-dorian gray , and an expression of infinite joy came over [her]2212-the girl . " How badly [I]2212-the girl acted to - night , [Dorian]2727-dorian ! "[2212-the girl] [she]2212-the girl cried .

[The girl]2212-the girl smiled . " Why [I]2212-the girl was so bad to - night . Why [I]2212-the girl shall always be bad . Why [I]2212-the girl shall never act well again . "[2212-the girl]

[He]117-dorian gray shrugged [his]117-dorian gray shoulders . " [You]2212-the girl are ill , [I]117-dorian gray suppose . When [you]2212-the girl are ill [you]2212-the girl shouldn t act . [She]2212-the girl seemed not to listen to [him]117-dorian gray . [She]2212-the girl was transfigured with joy . An ecstasy of happiness dominated [her]2212-the girl .

" [Dorian]2731-dorian , [Dorian]2732-dorian , "[2212-the girl] [she]2212-the girl cried , " before [I]2212-the girl knew [you]2732-dorian , acting was the one reality of [my]2212-the girl life . It was only in the theatre that [I]2212-the girl lived . [I]2212-the girl thought that it was all true . [I]2212-the girl was [Rosalind]2733-rosalind one night and [Portia]192-portia the other . The joy of [Beatrice]193-beatrice was [my]2212-the girl joy , and the sorrows of [Cordelia]194-cordelia were [mine]2212-the girl also . [I]2212-the girl believed in everything . [The common people]2734-the common people who acted with [me]2212-the girl seemed to [me]2212-the girl to be godlike . The painted scenes were [[my]2212-the girl world]2735-my world . [I]2212-the girl knew nothing but shadows , and [I]2212-the girl thought them real . [You]2732-dorian came oh , [my]2212-the girl beautiful love ! and [you]2732-dorian freed [my]2212-the girl soul from prison . [You]2732-dorian taught [me]2212-the girl what reality really is . To - night , for the first time in [my]2212-the girl life , [I]2212-the girl saw through the hollowness , the sham , the silliness of the empty pageant in which [I]2212-the girl had always played . To - night , for the first time , [I]2212-the girl became conscious that [the Romeo]170-romeo was hideous , and old , and painted , that the moonlight in [the orchard]2736-the orchard was false , that the scenery was vulgar , and that the words [I]2212-the girl had to speak were unreal , were not [my]2212-the girl words , were not what [I]2212-the girl wanted to say . [You]2732-dorian had brought [me]2212-the girl something higher , something of which all art is but a reflection . [You]2732-dorian had made [me]2212-the girl understand what love really is . [My]2212-the girl love ! [My]2212-the girl love ! [Prince Charming]185-prince charming ! [Prince of life]2737-prince of life ! [I]2212-the girl have grown sick of shadows . [You]2732-dorian are more to [me]2212-the girl than all art can ever be . What have [I]2212-the girl to do with the puppets of a play ? When [I]2212-the girl came on to - night , [I]2212-the girl could not understand how it was that everything had gone from [me]2212-the girl . [I]2212-the girl thought that [I]2212-the girl was going to be wonderful . [I]2212-the girl found that [I]2212-the girl could do nothing . Suddenly it dawned on [my]2212-the girl soul what it all meant . The knowledge was exquisite to [me]2212-the girl . [I]2212-the girl heard [them]2738-them hissing , and [I]2212-the girl smiled . What could [they]2738-them know of love such as [ours]2739-ours ? [He]851-i flung [himself]851-i down on the sofa and turned away [his]851-i face . " [You]852-you have killed [my]851-i love , "[851-i] [he]851-i muttered .

[She]852-you looked at [him]851-i in wonder and laughed . [He]851-i made no answer . [She]852-you came across to [him]851-i , and with [her]852-you little fingers stroked [his]851-i hair . [She]852-you knelt down and pressed [his]851-i hands to [her]852-you lips . [He]851-i drew them away , and a shudder ran through [him]851-i .

Then [he]851-i leaped up and went to the door . " Yes , "[851-i] [he]851-i cried , " [you]852-you have killed [my]851-i love . [You]852-you used to stir [my]851-i imagination . Now [you]852-you don t even stir [my]851-i curiosity . [You]852-you simply produce no effect . [I]851-i loved [you]852-you because [you]852-you were marvellous , because [you]852-you had genius and intellect , because [you]852-you realized the dreams of [great poets]2743-great poets and gave shape and substance to the shadows of art . [You]852-you have thrown it all away . [You]852-you are shallow and stupid . [[My]851-i God]2467-my god ! how mad [I]851-i was to love [you]852-you ! What [a fool]1997-a fool [I]851-i have been ! [You]852-you are nothing to [me]851-i now . [I]851-i will never see [you]852-you again . [I]851-i will never think of [you]852-you . [I]851-i will never mention [your]852-you name . [You]852-you don t know what [you]852-you were to [me]851-i , once . Why , once ... Oh , [I]851-i can t bear to think of it ! [I]851-i wish [I]851-i had never laid eyes upon [you]852-you ! [You]852-you have spoiled the romance of [my]851-i life . How little [you]852-you can know of love , if [you]852-you say it mars [your]852-you art ! Without [your]852-you art , [you]852-you are nothing . [I]851-i would have made [you]852-you famous , splendid , magnificent . [The world]1908-the world would have worshipped [you]852-you , and [you]852-you would have borne [my]851-i name . What are [you]852-you now ? A third - rate actress with a pretty face . "[851-i]

[The girl]2212-the girl grew white , and trembled . [She]2212-the girl clenched [her]2212-the girl hands together , and [her]2212-the girl voice seemed to catch in [her]2212-the girl throat . " Acting ! [I]854-he leave that to [you]2212-the girl . [You]2212-the girl do it so well , "[854-he] [he]854-he answered bitterly .

[She]2212-the girl rose from [her]2212-the girl knees and , with a piteous expression of pain in [her]2212-the girl face , came across [the room]386-the room to [him]854-he . [[My]2212-the girl brother]2752-my brother ... No ; never mind . [He]2752-my brother didn t mean it . [He]2752-my brother was in jest .... There is always something ridiculous about the emotions of people whom [one has ceased to love]857-one has ceased to love . [Sibyl Vane]168-sibyl seemed to [him]117-dorian gray to be absurdly melodramatic . [Her]168-sibyl tears and sobs annoyed [him]117-dorian gray .

" [I]117-dorian gray am going , "[117-dorian gray] [he]117-dorian gray said at last in [his]117-dorian gray calm clear voice .
