[She]856-her wept silently , and made no answer , but crept nearer . [Her]856-her little hands stretched blindly out , and appeared to be seeking for [him]117-dorian gray . [He]117-dorian gray turned on [his]117-dorian gray heel and left [the room]386-the room . In a few moments [he]117-dorian gray was out of [the theatre]2164-the theatre .

Where [he]117-dorian gray went to [he]117-dorian gray hardly knew . [He]117-dorian gray remembered wandering through [dimly lit streets]860-dimly lit streets , past gaunt , black - shadowed archways and [evil - looking houses]861-evil - looking houses . [Women with hoarse voices and harsh laughter]862-women with hoarse voices and harsh laughter had called after [him]117-dorian gray . [Drunkards]863-drunkards had reeled by , cursing and chattering to [themselves]863-drunkards like monstrous apes . [He]117-dorian gray had seen [grotesque children]864-grotesque children huddled upon door - steps , and heard shrieks and oaths from [gloomy courts]865-gloomy courts .

As the dawn was just breaking , [he]117-dorian gray found [himself]117-dorian gray close to [Covent Garden]37-covent garden . The darkness lifted , and , flushed with faint fires , the sky hollowed itself into a perfect pearl . [Huge carts filled with nodding lilies]866-huge carts filled with nodding lilies rumbled slowly down [the polished empty street]867-the polished empty street . The air was heavy with the perfume of the flowers , and their beauty seemed to bring [him]117-dorian gray an anodyne for [his]117-dorian gray pain . [He]117-dorian gray followed into [the market]868-the market and watched [the men]2198-the men unloading [their]2198-the men waggons . [A white - smocked carter]870-a white - smocked carter offered [him]117-dorian gray some cherries . [He]117-dorian gray thanked [him]870-a white - smocked carter , wondered why [he]117-dorian gray refused to accept any money for [them]871-them , and began to eat them listlessly . [They]871-them had been plucked at midnight , and the coldness of the moon had entered into [them]871-them . [A long line of boys carrying crates of striped tulips , and of yellow and red roses]872-a long line of boys carrying crates of striped tulips , and of yellow and red roses , defiled in front of [him]117-dorian gray , threading [their]872-a long line of boys carrying crates of striped tulips , and of yellow and red roses way through the huge , jade - green piles of vegetables . Under [the portico]873-the portico , with [its]873-the portico grey , sun - bleached pillars , loitered a troop of [draggled bareheaded girls]874-draggled bareheaded girls , waiting for the auction to be over . [Others]1931-others crowded round the swinging doors of [the coffee - house in [the piazza]877-the piazza]876-the coffee - house in the piazza . [The heavy cart - horses]878-the heavy cart - horses slipped and stamped upon the rough stones , shaking [their]878-the heavy cart - horses bells and trappings . [Some of [the drivers]880-the drivers]879-some of the drivers were lying asleep on a pile of sacks . Iris - necked and pink - footed , the pigeons ran about picking up seeds .

After a little while , [he]117-dorian gray hailed a hansom and drove [home]2087-home . For a few moments [he]117-dorian gray loitered upon [the doorstep]882-the doorstep , looking round at [the silent square]883-the silent square , with [its]883-the silent square blank , close - shuttered windows and [its]883-the silent square staring blinds . The sky was pure opal now , and the roofs of [the houses]545-the houses glistened like silver against it . From some chimney opposite a thin wreath of smoke was rising . It curled , a violet riband , through the nacre - coloured air .

In the huge gilt Venetian lantern , spoil of [some Doge s barge]885-some doge s barge , that hung from the ceiling of [the great , oak - panelled hall of entrance]886-the great , oak - panelled hall of entrance , lights were still burning from three flickering jets : thin blue petals of flame they seemed , rimmed with white fire . [He]117-dorian gray turned them out and , having thrown [his]117-dorian gray hat and cape on the table , passed through [the library]887-the library towards the door of [[his]117-dorian gray bedroom]888-his bedroom , [a large octagonal chamber on the ground floor that , in [his]117-dorian gray new - born feeling for luxury , [he]117-dorian gray had just had decorated for [himself]117-dorian gray]889-a large octagonal chamber on the ground floor that , in his new - born feeling for luxury , he had just had decorated for himself and hung with some curious Renaissance tapestries that had been discovered stored in [a disused attic at [Selby Royal]38-selby royal]890-a disused attic at selby royal . As [he]117-dorian gray was turning the handle of the door , [his]117-dorian gray eye fell upon the portrait [Basil Hallward]121-basil had painted of [him]117-dorian gray . [He]117-dorian gray started back as if in surprise . Then [he]117-dorian gray went on into [[his]117-dorian gray own room]891-his own room , looking somewhat puzzled . After [he]117-dorian gray had taken the button - hole out of [his]117-dorian gray coat , [he]117-dorian gray seemed to hesitate . Finally , [he]117-dorian gray came back , went over to the picture , and examined it . In the dim arrested light that struggled through the cream - coloured silk blinds , the face appeared to [him]117-dorian gray to be a little changed . The expression looked different . [One]381-one would have said that there was a touch of cruelty in the mouth . It was certainly strange .

[He]117-dorian gray turned round and , walking to the window , drew up the blind . The bright dawn flooded [the room]386-the room and swept the fantastic shadows into dusky corners , where they lay shuddering . But the strange expression that [he]117-dorian gray had noticed in the face of the portrait seemed to linger there , to be more intensified even . The quivering ardent sunlight showed [him]117-dorian gray the lines of cruelty round the mouth as clearly as if [he]117-dorian gray had been looking into a mirror after [he]117-dorian gray had done some dreadful thing .

[He]117-dorian gray winced and , taking up from the table an oval glass framed in ivory Cupids , one of [Lord Henry]120-lord henry s many presents to [him]117-dorian gray , glanced hurriedly into its polished depths . No line like that warped [his]117-dorian gray red lips . What did it mean ?

[He]117-dorian gray rubbed [his]117-dorian gray eyes , and came close to the picture , and examined it again . There were no signs of any change when [he]117-dorian gray looked into the actual painting , and yet there was no doubt that the whole expression had altered . It was not a mere fancy of [his]117-dorian gray own . The thing was horribly apparent .

[He]117-dorian gray threw [himself]117-dorian gray into a chair and began to think . Suddenly there flashed across [his]117-dorian gray mind what [he]117-dorian gray had said in [[Basil Hallward]121-basil s studio]612-basil hallward s studio the day the picture had been finished . Yes , [he]117-dorian gray remembered it perfectly . [He]117-dorian gray had uttered a mad wish that [he]117-dorian gray [himself]117-dorian gray might remain young , and the portrait grow old ; that [his]117-dorian gray own beauty might be untarnished , and the face on the canvas bear the burden of [his]117-dorian gray passions and [his]117-dorian gray sins ; that the painted image might be seared with the lines of suffering and thought , and that [he]117-dorian gray might keep all the delicate bloom and loveliness of [his]117-dorian gray then just conscious boyhood . Surely [his]117-dorian gray wish had not been fulfilled ? Such things were impossible . It seemed monstrous even to think of them . And , yet , there was the picture before [him]117-dorian gray , with the touch of cruelty in the mouth .

Cruelty ! Had [he]117-dorian gray been cruel ? It was [the girl]2212-the girl s fault , not [his]117-dorian gray . [He]117-dorian gray had dreamed of [her]2212-the girl as [a great artist]2713-a great artist , had given [his]117-dorian gray love to [her]2212-the girl because [he]117-dorian gray had thought [her]2212-the girl great . Then [she]2212-the girl had disappointed [him]117-dorian gray . [She]2212-the girl had been shallow and unworthy . And , yet , a feeling of infinite regret came over [him]117-dorian gray , as [he]117-dorian gray thought of [her]2212-the girl lying at [his]117-dorian gray feet sobbing like [a little child]897-a little child . [He]117-dorian gray remembered with what callousness [he]117-dorian gray had watched [her]2212-the girl . Why had [he]117-dorian gray been made like that ? Why had such a soul been given to [him]117-dorian gray ? But [he]117-dorian gray had suffered also . During the three terrible hours that the play had lasted , [he]117-dorian gray had lived centuries of pain , aeon upon aeon of torture . [His]117-dorian gray life was well worth [hers]2212-the girl . [She]2212-the girl had marred [him]117-dorian gray for a moment , if [he]117-dorian gray had wounded [her]2212-the girl for an age . Besides , [women]2058-women were better suited to bear sorrow than [men]2041-men . [They]2058-women lived on [their]2058-women emotions . [They]2058-women only thought of [their]2058-women emotions . When [they]2058-women took [lovers]900-lovers , it was merely to have [some one with whom [they]2058-women could have scenes]901-some one with whom they could have scenes . [Lord Henry]120-lord henry had told [him]117-dorian gray that , and [Lord Henry]120-lord henry knew what [women]2058-women were . Why should [he]117-dorian gray trouble about [Sibyl Vane]168-sibyl ? [She]168-sibyl was nothing to [him]117-dorian gray now .

But the picture ? What was [he]117-dorian gray to say of that ? It held the secret of [his]117-dorian gray life , and told [his]117-dorian gray story . It had taught [him]117-dorian gray to love [his]117-dorian gray own beauty . Would it teach [him]117-dorian gray to loathe [his]117-dorian gray own soul ? Would [he]117-dorian gray ever look at [it]903-its again ?

No ; it was merely an illusion wrought on the troubled senses . The horrible night that [he]117-dorian gray had passed had left phantoms behind it . Suddenly there had fallen upon [his]117-dorian gray brain that tiny scarlet speck that makes [men]2041-men mad . The picture had not changed . It was folly to think so .

Yet it was watching [him]117-dorian gray , with its beautiful marred face and its cruel smile . [Its]903-its bright hair gleamed in the early sunlight . [Its]903-its blue eyes met [his]117-dorian gray own . A sense of infinite pity , not for [himself]117-dorian gray , but for the painted image of [himself]117-dorian gray , came over [him]117-dorian gray . It had altered already , and would alter more . Its gold would wither into grey . Its red and white roses would die . For every sin that [he]117-dorian gray committed , a stain would fleck and wreck its fairness . But [he]117-dorian gray would not sin . The picture , changed or unchanged , would be to [him]117-dorian gray the visible emblem of conscience . [He]117-dorian gray would resist temptation . [He]117-dorian gray would not see [Lord Henry]120-lord henry any more would not , at any rate , listen to those subtle poisonous theories that in [[Basil Hallward]121-basil s garden]905-basil hallward s garden had first stirred within [him]117-dorian gray the passion for impossible things . [He]117-dorian gray would go back to [Sibyl Vane]168-sibyl , make [her]168-sibyl amends , marry [her]168-sibyl , try to love [her]168-sibyl again . Yes , it was [his]117-dorian gray duty to do so . [She]168-sibyl must have suffered more than [he]117-dorian gray had . [Poor child]906-poor child ! [He]117-dorian gray had been selfish and cruel to [her]168-sibyl . The fascination that [she]168-sibyl had exercised over [him]117-dorian gray would return . [They]907-they would be happy together . [His]117-dorian gray life with [her]168-sibyl would be beautiful and pure .

[He]117-dorian gray got up from [his]117-dorian gray chair and drew a large screen right in front of the portrait , shuddering as [he]117-dorian gray glanced at it . " How horrible ! "[117-dorian gray] [he]117-dorian gray murmured to [himself]117-dorian gray , and [he]117-dorian gray walked across to the window and opened it . When [he]117-dorian gray stepped out on to the grass , [he]117-dorian gray drew a deep breath . The fresh morning air seemed to drive away all [his]117-dorian gray sombre passions . [He]117-dorian gray thought only of [Sibyl]168-sibyl . A faint echo of [his]117-dorian gray love came back to [him]117-dorian gray . [He]117-dorian gray repeated [her]168-sibyl name over and over again . The birds that were singing in the dew - drenched garden seemed to be telling the flowers about [her]168-sibyl .

CHAPTER VIII .

It was long past noon when [he]117-dorian gray awoke . [[His]117-dorian gray valet]509-his valet had crept several times on tiptoe into [the room]386-the room to see if [he]117-dorian gray was stirring , and had wondered what made [[his]117-dorian gray young master]910-his young master sleep so late . Finally [his]117-dorian gray bell sounded , and [Victor]195-victor came in softly with a cup of tea , and a pile of letters , on a small tray of old Sevres china , and drew back the olive - satin curtains , with their shimmering blue lining , that hung in front of the three tall windows .

" [Monsieur]2756-monsieur has well slept this morning , "[195-victor] [he]195-victor said , smiling .

" What o clock is it , [Victor]195-victor ? "[117-dorian gray] asked [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray drowsily .

" One hour and a quarter , [Monsieur]2757-monsieur . "[195-victor]

How late it was ! [He]117-dorian gray sat up , and having sipped some tea , turned over [his]117-dorian gray letters . One of them was from [Lord Henry]120-lord henry , and had been brought by hand that morning . [He]117-dorian gray hesitated for a moment , and then put it aside . The others [he]117-dorian gray opened listlessly . They contained the usual collection of cards , invitations to dinner , tickets for private views , programmes of charity concerts , and the like that are showered on [fashionable young men]911-fashionable young men every morning during the season . There was a rather heavy bill for a chased silver Louis - Quinze toilet - set that [he]117-dorian gray had not yet had the courage to send on to [[his]117-dorian gray guardians]912-his guardians , who were [extremely old - fashioned people]913-extremely old - fashioned people and did not realize that [we]914-we live in an age when unnecessary things are [our]914-we only necessities ; and there were several very courteously worded communications from [Jermyn Street money - lenders]915-jermyn street money - lenders offering to advance any sum of money at a moment s notice and at the most reasonable rates of interest .

After about ten minutes [he]117-dorian gray got up , and throwing on an elaborate dressing - gown of silk - embroidered cashmere wool , passed into [the onyx - paved bathroom]916-the onyx - paved bathroom . The cool water refreshed [him]117-dorian gray after [his]117-dorian gray long sleep . [He]117-dorian gray seemed to have forgotten all that [he]117-dorian gray had gone through . A dim sense of having taken part in some strange tragedy came to [him]117-dorian gray once or twice , but there was the unreality of a dream about it .

As soon as [he]117-dorian gray was dressed , [he]117-dorian gray went into [the library]887-the library and sat down to a light French breakfast that had been laid out for [him]117-dorian gray on a small round table close to the open window . It was an exquisite day . The warm air seemed laden with spices . A bee flew in and buzzed round the blue - dragon bowl that , filled with sulphur - yellow roses , stood before [him]117-dorian gray . [He]117-dorian gray felt perfectly happy .

Suddenly [his]117-dorian gray eye fell on the screen that [he]117-dorian gray had placed in front of the portrait , and [he]117-dorian gray started .

" Too cold for [Monsieur]2756-monsieur ? "[509-his valet] asked [[his]117-dorian gray valet]509-his valet , putting an omelette on the table . " [I]509-his valet shut the window ? "[509-his valet]

[Dorian]117-dorian gray shook [his]117-dorian gray head . " [I]117-dorian gray am not cold , "[117-dorian gray] [he]117-dorian gray murmured .

Was it all true ? Had the portrait really changed ? Or had it been simply [his]117-dorian gray own imagination that had made [him]117-dorian gray see a look of evil where there had been a look of joy ? Surely a painted canvas could not alter ? The thing was absurd . It would serve as a tale to tell [Basil]121-basil some day . It would make [him]117-dorian gray smile .

And , yet , how vivid was [his]117-dorian gray recollection of the whole thing ! First in the dim twilight , and then in the bright dawn , [he]117-dorian gray had seen the touch of cruelty round the warped lips . [He]117-dorian gray almost dreaded [[his]117-dorian gray valet]509-his valet leaving [the room]386-the room . [He]117-dorian gray knew that when [he]117-dorian gray was alone [he]117-dorian gray would have to examine the portrait . [He]117-dorian gray was afraid of certainty . When the coffee and cigarettes had been brought and [the man]2023-the man turned to go , [he]117-dorian gray felt a wild desire to tell [him]2023-the man to remain . As the door was closing behind [him]117-dorian gray , [he]117-dorian gray called [him]2023-the man back . [The man]2023-the man stood waiting for [his]117-dorian gray orders . [Dorian]117-dorian gray looked at [him]2023-the man for a moment . " [I]117-dorian gray am not at [home]2087-home to [any one]1934-any one , [Victor]195-victor , "[117-dorian gray] [he]117-dorian gray said with a sigh . [The man]2023-the man bowed and retired .

Then [he]2023-the man rose from the table , lit a cigarette , and flung [himself]2023-the man down on a luxuriously cushioned couch that stood facing the screen . The screen was an old one , of gilt Spanish leather , stamped and wrought with a rather florid Louis - Quatorze pattern . [He]117-dorian gray scanned it curiously , wondering if ever before it had concealed the secret of [a man]380-a man s life .

Should [he]117-dorian gray move it aside , after all ? Why not let it stay there ? What was the use of knowing ? If the thing was true , it was terrible . If it was not true , why trouble about it ? But what if , by some fate or deadlier chance , eyes other than [his]117-dorian gray spied behind and saw the horrible change ? What should [he]117-dorian gray do if [Basil Hallward]121-basil came and asked to look at [his]117-dorian gray own picture ? [Basil]121-basil would be sure to do that . No ; the thing had to be examined , and at once . Anything would be better than this dreadful state of doubt .

[He]117-dorian gray got up and locked both doors . At least [he]117-dorian gray would be alone when [he]117-dorian gray looked upon the mask of [his]117-dorian gray shame . Then [he]117-dorian gray drew the screen aside and saw [himself]117-dorian gray face to face . It was perfectly true . The portrait had altered .

As [he]117-dorian gray often remembered afterwards , and always with no small wonder , [he]117-dorian gray found [himself]117-dorian gray at first gazing at the portrait with a feeling of almost scientific interest . That such a change should have taken place was incredible to [him]117-dorian gray . And yet it was a fact . Was there some subtle affinity between the chemical atoms that shaped themselves into form and colour on the canvas and the soul that was within [him]117-dorian gray ? Could it be that what that soul thought , [they]925-they realized ? that what it dreamed , [they]925-they made true ? Or was there some other , more terrible reason ? [He]117-dorian gray shuddered , and felt afraid , and , going back to the couch , lay there , gazing at the picture in sickened horror .

One thing , however , [he]117-dorian gray felt that it had done for [him]117-dorian gray . It had made [him]117-dorian gray conscious how unjust , how cruel , [he]117-dorian gray had been to [Sibyl Vane]168-sibyl . It was not too late to make reparation for that . [She]168-sibyl could still be [[his]117-dorian gray wife]2313-his wife . [His]117-dorian gray unreal and selfish love would yield to some higher influence , would be transformed into some nobler passion , and the portrait that [Basil Hallward]121-basil had painted of [him]117-dorian gray would be a guide to [him]117-dorian gray through life , would be to [him]117-dorian gray what holiness is to [some]927-some , and conscience to [others]1931-others , and the fear of [God]134-god to [us]929-us all . There were opiates for remorse , drugs that could lull the moral sense to sleep . But here was a visible symbol of the degradation of sin . Here was an ever - present sign of the ruin [men]2041-men brought upon [their]2041-men souls .

Three o clock struck , and four , and the half - hour rang its double chime , but [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray did not stir . [He]117-dorian gray was trying to gather up the scarlet threads of life and to weave them into a pattern ; to find [his]117-dorian gray way through the sanguine labyrinth of passion through which [he]117-dorian gray was wandering . [He]117-dorian gray did not know what to do , or what to think . Finally , [he]117-dorian gray went over to the table and wrote a passionate letter to [the girl [he]117-dorian gray had loved]931-the girl he had loved , imploring [her]931-the girl he had loved forgiveness and accusing [himself]117-dorian gray of madness . [He]117-dorian gray covered page after page with wild words of sorrow and wilder words of pain . There is a luxury in self - reproach . When [we]929-us blame [ourselves]929-us , [we]929-us feel that [no one else]932-no one else has a right to blame [us]929-us . It is the confession , not [the priest]933-the priest , that gives [us]929-us absolution . When [Dorian]117-dorian gray had finished the letter , [he]117-dorian gray felt that [he]117-dorian gray had been forgiven .

Suddenly there came a knock to the door , and [he]117-dorian gray heard [Lord Henry]120-lord henry s voice outside . " [[My]120-lord henry dear boy]2346-my dear boy , [I]120-lord henry must see [you]2346-my dear boy . Let [me]120-lord henry in at once . [I]120-lord henry can t bear [your]2346-my dear boy shutting [yourself]2346-my dear boy up like this . "[120-lord henry]

[He]117-dorian gray made no answer at first , but remained quite still . The knocking still continued and grew louder . Yes , it was better to let [Lord Henry]120-lord henry in , and to explain to [him]120-lord henry the new life [he]120-lord henry was going to lead , to quarrel with [him]120-lord henry if it became necessary to quarrel , to part if parting was inevitable . [He]117-dorian gray jumped up , drew the screen hastily across the picture , and unlocked the door .

" [I]120-lord henry am so sorry for it all , [Dorian]2762-dorian , "[120-lord henry] said [Lord Henry]120-lord henry as [he]120-lord henry entered . " But [you]2762-dorian must not think too much about it . "[120-lord henry]

" Do [you]120-lord henry mean about [Sibyl Vane]168-sibyl ? "[427-the lad] asked [the lad]427-the lad .

" Yes , of course , "[120-lord henry] answered [Lord Henry]120-lord henry , sinking into a chair and slowly pulling off [his]120-lord henry yellow gloves . " It is dreadful , from one point of view , but it was not [your]2762-dorian fault . Tell [me]120-lord henry , did [you]2762-dorian go behind and see [her]168-sibyl , after the play was over ? "[120-lord henry]

" Yes . "[120-lord henry]

" [I]120-lord henry felt sure [you]2762-dorian had . Did [you]2762-dorian make a scene with [her]168-sibyl ? "[120-lord henry]

" [I]120-lord henry was brutal , [Harry]120-lord henry perfectly brutal . But it is all right now . [I]120-lord henry am not sorry for anything that has happened . It has taught [me]120-lord henry to know [myself]120-lord henry better . "[120-lord henry]

" Ah , [Dorian]117-dorian gray , [I]120-lord henry am so glad [you]117-dorian gray take it in that way ! [I]120-lord henry was afraid [I]120-lord henry would find [you]117-dorian gray plunged in remorse and tearing that nice curly hair of yours . "[120-lord henry]

" [I]117-dorian gray have got through all that , "[117-dorian gray] said [Dorian]117-dorian gray , shaking [his]117-dorian gray head and smiling . " [I]117-dorian gray am perfectly happy now . [I]117-dorian gray know what conscience is , to begin with . It is not what [you]120-lord henry told [me]117-dorian gray it was . It is the divinest thing in [us]2763-us . Don t sneer at it , [Harry]120-lord henry , any more at least not before [me]117-dorian gray . [I]117-dorian gray want to be good . [I]117-dorian gray can t bear the idea of [my]117-dorian gray soul being hideous . "[117-dorian gray]

" A very charming artistic basis for ethics , [Dorian]2764-dorian ! [I]120-lord henry congratulate [you]117-dorian gray on it . But how are [you]117-dorian gray going to begin ? "[120-lord henry]

" By marrying [Sibyl Vane]168-sibyl . "[117-dorian gray]

" Marrying [Sibyl Vane]168-sibyl ! "[120-lord henry] cried [Lord Henry]120-lord henry , standing up and looking at [him]117-dorian gray in perplexed amazement . " But , [[my]120-lord henry dear]1914-my dear [Dorian]117-dorian gray "[120-lord henry]

" Yes , [Harry]120-lord henry , [I]117-dorian gray know what [you]117-dorian gray are going to say . Something dreadful about marriage . Don t say it . Don t ever say things of that kind to [me]117-dorian gray again . Two days ago [I]117-dorian gray asked [Sibyl]168-sibyl to marry [me]117-dorian gray . [I]117-dorian gray am not going to break [my]117-dorian gray word to [her]168-sibyl . [She]168-sibyl is to be [[my]117-dorian gray wife]1939-my wife . "[117-dorian gray]

" [[Your]117-dorian gray wife]2720-your wife ! [Dorian]2768-dorian ! ... Didn t [you]117-dorian gray get [my]120-lord henry letter ? [I]120-lord henry wrote to [you]117-dorian gray this morning , and sent the note down by [[my]120-lord henry own man]2769-my own man . "[120-lord henry]

" [Your]120-lord henry letter ? Oh , yes , [I]117-dorian gray remember . [I]117-dorian gray have not read it yet , [Harry]120-lord henry . [I]117-dorian gray was afraid there might be something in it that [I]117-dorian gray wouldn t like . [You]117-dorian gray cut life to pieces with [your]117-dorian gray epigrams . "[117-dorian gray]

" [You]120-lord henry know nothing then ? "[120-lord henry]

" What do [you]120-lord henry mean ? "[117-dorian gray]

[Lord Henry]120-lord henry walked across [the room]386-the room , and sitting down by [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray , took both [his]117-dorian gray hands in [his]120-lord henry own and held them tightly . " [Dorian]2770-dorian , "[120-lord henry] [he]120-lord henry said , " [my]120-lord henry letter don t be frightened was to tell [you]2770-dorian that [Sibyl Vane]168-sibyl is dead . "[120-lord henry]

A cry of pain broke from [the lad]427-the lad s lips , and [he]427-the lad leaped to [his]427-the lad feet , tearing [his]427-the lad hands away from [Lord Henry]120-lord henry s grasp . " Dead ! [Sibyl]168-sibyl dead ! It is not true ! It is a horrible lie ! How dare [you]120-lord henry say it ? "[427-the lad]

" It is quite true , [Dorian]2771-dorian , "[120-lord henry] said [Lord Henry]120-lord henry , gravely . " It is in all the morning papers . [I]120-lord henry wrote down to [you]2770-dorian to ask [you]2770-dorian not to see [any one]1934-any one till [I]120-lord henry came . There will have to be an inquest , of course , and [you]2770-dorian must not be mixed up in it . Things like that make [a man]380-a man fashionable in [Paris]13-paris . But in [London]2-london [people]1933-people are so prejudiced . Here , [one]381-one should never make one s _ d but _ with a scandal . [One]381-one should reserve that to give an interest to one s old age . [I]120-lord henry suppose [they]1933-people don t know [your]2770-dorian name at [the theatre]2164-the theatre ? If [they]1933-people don t , it is all right . Did [any one]1934-any one see [you]2770-dorian going round to [[her]1934-any one room]2779-her room ? That is an important point . "[120-lord henry]

[Dorian]117-dorian gray did not answer for a few moments . [He]117-dorian gray was dazed with horror . Finally [he]117-dorian gray stammered , in a stifled voice , " [Harry]120-lord henry , did [you]120-lord henry say an inquest ? What did [you]120-lord henry mean by that ? Did [Sibyl]168-sibyl ? Oh , [Harry]120-lord henry , [I]117-dorian gray can t bear it ! But be quick . Tell [me]117-dorian gray everything at once . "[117-dorian gray]

" [I]120-lord henry have no doubt it was not an accident , [Dorian]117-dorian gray , though it must be put in that way to the public . It seems that as [she]168-sibyl was leaving [the theatre]2164-the theatre with [[her]168-sibyl mother]2455-her mother , about half - past twelve or so , [she]168-sibyl said [she]168-sibyl had forgotten something [upstairs]676-upstairs . [They]2783-they waited some time for [her]168-sibyl , but [she]168-sibyl did not come down again . [They]2783-they ultimately found [her]168-sibyl lying dead on the floor of [[her]168-sibyl dressing - room]2784-her dressing - room . [She]168-sibyl had swallowed something by mistake , some dreadful thing [they]2783-they use at [theatres]2785-theatres . [I]120-lord henry don t know what it was , but it had either prussic acid or white lead in it . [I]120-lord henry should fancy it was prussic acid , as [she]168-sibyl seems to have died instantaneously . "[120-lord henry]

" [Harry]120-lord henry , [Harry]120-lord henry , it is terrible ! "[427-the lad] cried [the lad]427-the lad .

" Yes ; it is very tragic , of course , but [you]120-lord henry must not get [yourself]120-lord henry mixed up in it . [I]120-lord henry see by _ The Standard _ that [she]168-sibyl was seventeen . [I]120-lord henry should have thought [she]168-sibyl was almost younger than that . [She]168-sibyl looked such [a child]2444-a child , and seemed to know so little about acting . [Dorian]2787-dorian , [you]2787-dorian mustn t let this thing get on [your]2787-dorian nerves . [You]2787-dorian must come and dine with [me]120-lord henry , and afterwards [we]2788-we will look in at the opera . It is a Patti night , and [everybody]2085-everybody will be there . [You]2787-dorian can come to [[my]120-lord henry sister]2581-my sister s box . [She]168-sibyl has got [some smart women]2791-some smart women with [her]168-sibyl . "[120-lord henry]

" So [I]117-dorian gray have murdered [Sibyl Vane]168-sibyl , "[117-dorian gray] said [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray , half to [himself]117-dorian gray , " murdered [her]168-sibyl as surely as if [I]117-dorian gray had cut [her]168-sibyl little throat with a knife . Yet the roses are not less lovely for all that . The birds sing just as happily in [[my]117-dorian gray garden]2792-my garden . And to - night [I]117-dorian gray am to dine with [you]2787-dorian , and then go on to the opera , and sup somewhere , [I]117-dorian gray suppose , afterwards . How extraordinarily dramatic life is ! If [I]117-dorian gray had read all this in a book , [Harry]120-lord henry , [I]117-dorian gray think [I]117-dorian gray would have wept over it . Somehow , now that it has happened actually , and to [me]117-dorian gray , it seems far too wonderful for tears . Here is the first passionate love - letter [I]117-dorian gray have ever written in [my]117-dorian gray life . Strange , that [my]117-dorian gray first passionate love - letter should have been addressed to [a dead girl]2793-a dead girl . Can [they]2794-they feel , [I]117-dorian gray wonder , [those white silent people [we]2796-we call the dead]2795-those white silent people we call the dead ? [Sibyl]168-sibyl ! Can [she]168-sibyl feel , or know , or listen ? Oh , [Harry]120-lord henry , how [I]117-dorian gray loved [her]168-sibyl once ! It seems years ago to [me]117-dorian gray now . [She]168-sibyl was everything to [me]117-dorian gray . Then came that dreadful night was it really only last night ? when [she]168-sibyl played so badly , and [my]117-dorian gray heart almost broke . [She]168-sibyl explained it all to [me]117-dorian gray . It was terribly pathetic . But [I]117-dorian gray was not moved a bit . [I]117-dorian gray thought [her]168-sibyl shallow . Suddenly something happened that made [me]117-dorian gray afraid . [I]117-dorian gray can t tell [you]120-lord henry what it was , but it was terrible . [I]117-dorian gray said [I]117-dorian gray would go back to [her]168-sibyl . [I]117-dorian gray felt [I]117-dorian gray had done wrong . And now [she]168-sibyl is dead . [[My]117-dorian gray God]2467-my god ! [[My]117-dorian gray God]2467-my god ! [Harry]120-lord henry , what shall [I]117-dorian gray do ? [You]120-lord henry don t know the danger [I]117-dorian gray am in , and there is nothing to keep [me]117-dorian gray straight . [She]168-sibyl would have done that for [me]117-dorian gray . [She]168-sibyl had no right to kill [herself]168-sibyl . It was selfish of [her]168-sibyl . "[117-dorian gray]

" [[My]120-lord henry dear]1914-my dear [Dorian]117-dorian gray , "[120-lord henry] answered [Lord Henry]120-lord henry , taking a cigarette from [his]120-lord henry case and producing a gold - latten matchbox , " the only way [a woman]2360-a woman can ever reform [a man]380-a man is by boring [him]380-a man so completely that [he]380-a man loses all possible interest in life . If [you]120-lord henry had married [this girl]2406-this girl , [you]120-lord henry would have been wretched . Of course , [you]120-lord henry would have treated [her]2406-this girl kindly . [One]381-one can always be kind to [people about whom one]2804-people about whom one cares nothing . But [she]2406-this girl would have soon found out that [you]120-lord henry were absolutely indifferent to [her]2406-this girl . And when [a woman]2360-a woman finds that out about [[her]2360-a woman husband]2806-her husband , [she]2360-a woman either becomes dreadfully dowdy , or wears very smart bonnets that [[some other woman]2807-some other woman s husband]2808-some other woman s husband has to pay for . [I]120-lord henry say nothing about the social mistake , which would have been abject which , of course , [I]120-lord henry would not have allowed but [I]120-lord henry assure [you]120-lord henry that in any case the whole thing would have been an absolute failure . "[120-lord henry]

" [I]427-the lad suppose it would , "[427-the lad] muttered [the lad]427-the lad , walking up and down [the room]386-the room and looking horribly pale . " But [I]427-the lad thought it was [my]427-the lad duty . It is not [my]427-the lad fault that this terrible tragedy has prevented [my]427-the lad doing what was right . [I]427-the lad remember [your]120-lord henry saying once that there is a fatality about good resolutions that they are always made too late . [Mine]427-the lad certainly were . "[427-the lad]

" Good resolutions are useless attempts to interfere with scientific laws . [Their]2809-they origin is pure vanity . Their result is absolutely _ nil _ . [They]2809-they give [us]2810-us , now and then , some of those luxurious sterile emotions that have a certain charm for [the weak]2811-the weak . That is all that can be said for [them]2809-they . [They]2809-they are simply cheques that [men]2041-men draw on a bank where [they]2041-men have no account . "[120-lord henry]

" [Harry]120-lord henry , "[117-dorian gray] cried [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray , coming over and sitting down beside [him]427-the lad , " why is it that [I]117-dorian gray can not feel this tragedy as much as [I]117-dorian gray want to ? [I]117-dorian gray don t think [I]117-dorian gray am heartless . Do [you]120-lord henry ? "[117-dorian gray]

" [You]117-dorian gray have done too many foolish things during the last fortnight to be entitled to give [yourself]117-dorian gray that name , [Dorian]117-dorian gray , "[120-lord henry] answered [Lord Henry]120-lord henry with [his]120-lord henry sweet melancholy smile .

[The lad]427-the lad frowned . " [I]120-lord henry don t like that explanation , [Harry]120-lord henry , "[120-lord henry] [he]120-lord henry rejoined , " but [I]120-lord henry am glad [you]120-lord henry don t think [I]120-lord henry am heartless . [I]120-lord henry am nothing of the kind . [I]120-lord henry know [I]120-lord henry am not . And yet [I]120-lord henry must admit that this thing that has happened does not affect [me]120-lord henry as it should . It seems to [me]120-lord henry to be simply like a wonderful ending to a wonderful play . It has all the terrible beauty of a Greek tragedy , a tragedy in which [I]120-lord henry took a great part , but by which [I]120-lord henry have not been wounded . "[120-lord henry]

" It is an interesting question , "[120-lord henry] said [Lord Henry]120-lord henry , who found an exquisite pleasure in playing on [the lad]427-the lad s unconscious egotism , " an extremely interesting question . [I]120-lord henry fancy that the true explanation is this : It often happens that the real tragedies of life occur in such an inartistic manner that [they]2813-their hurt [us]2814-us by [their]2813-their crude violence , [their]2813-their absolute incoherence , [their]2813-their absurd want of meaning , [their]2813-their entire lack of style . [They]2813-their affect [us]2814-us just as vulgarity affects [us]2814-us . [They]2813-their give [us]2814-us an impression of sheer brute force , and [we]2814-us revolt against that . Sometimes , however , a tragedy that possesses artistic elements of beauty crosses [our]2814-us lives . If these elements of beauty are real , the whole thing simply appeals to [our]2814-us sense of dramatic effect . Suddenly [we]2814-us find that [we]2814-us are no longer [the actors]2815-the actors , but [the spectators of the play]2816-the spectators of the play . Or rather [we]2814-us are both . [We]2814-us watch [ourselves]2814-us , and the mere wonder of the spectacle enthralls [us]2814-us . In the present case , what is it that has really happened ? [Some one]1960-some one has killed [herself]1960-some one for love of [you]2818-you . [I]120-lord henry wish that [I]120-lord henry had ever had such an experience . It would have made [me]120-lord henry in love with love for the rest of [my]120-lord henry life . [The people who have adored [me]120-lord henry]2819-the people who have adored me there have not been very many , but there have been [some have always insisted on living on]2820-some have always insisted on living on , long after [I]120-lord henry had ceased to care for [them]2819-the people who have adored me , or [they]2819-the people who have adored me to care for [me]120-lord henry . [They]2819-the people who have adored me have become stout and tedious , and when [I]120-lord henry meet [them]2819-the people who have adored me , [they]2819-the people who have adored me go in at once for reminiscences . That awful memory of [woman]2821-woman ! What a fearful thing it is ! And what an utter intellectual stagnation it reveals ! [One]381-one should absorb the colour of life , but [one]381-one should never remember its details . Details are always vulgar . "[120-lord henry]

" [I]117-dorian gray must sow poppies in [[my]117-dorian gray garden]2792-my garden , "[117-dorian gray] sighed [Dorian]117-dorian gray .

" There is no necessity , "[397-his companion] rejoined [[his]117-dorian gray companion]397-his companion . " Life has always poppies in [her]2821-woman hands . Of course , now and then things linger . [I]397-his companion once wore nothing but violets all through one season , as a form of artistic mourning for a romance that would not die . Ultimately , however , it did die . [I]397-his companion forget what killed it . [I]397-his companion think it was [her]2821-woman proposing to sacrifice [the whole world]2139-the whole world for [me]397-his companion . That is always a dreadful moment . It fills [one]381-one with the terror of eternity . Well would [you]2827-you believe it ? a week ago , at [Lady Hampshire]196-lady hampshire s , [I]397-his companion found [myself]397-his companion seated at dinner next [the lady in question]2828-the lady in question , and [she]2821-woman insisted on going over the whole thing again , and digging up the past , and raking up the future . [I]397-his companion had buried [my]397-his companion romance in a bed of asphodel . [She]2821-woman dragged it out again and assured [me]397-his companion that [I]397-his companion had spoiled [her]2821-woman life . [I]397-his companion am bound to state that [she]2821-woman ate an enormous dinner , so [I]397-his companion did not feel any anxiety . But what a lack of taste [she]2821-woman showed ! The one charm of the past is that it is the past . But [women]2058-women never know when the curtain has fallen . [They]2058-women always want a sixth act , and as soon as the interest of the play is entirely over , [they]2058-women propose to continue it . If [they]2058-women were allowed [their]2058-women own way , every comedy would have a tragic ending , and every tragedy would culminate in a farce . [They]2058-women are charmingly artificial , but [they]2058-women have no sense of art . [You]2830-you are more fortunate than [I]397-his companion am . [I]397-his companion assure [you]2830-you , [Dorian]117-dorian gray , that [not one of [the women [I]397-his companion have known]2832-the women i have known]2831-not one of the women i have known would have done for [me]397-his companion what [Sibyl Vane]168-sibyl did for [you]2830-you . [Ordinary women]2413-ordinary women always console [themselves]2413-ordinary women . [Some of [them]2413-ordinary women]2834-some of them do it by going in for sentimental colours . Never trust [a woman who wears mauve , whatever [her]168-sibyl age may be , or [a woman over thirty - five who is fond of pink ribbons]2836-a woman over thirty - five who is fond of pink ribbons . It always means that [they]2413-ordinary women have a history . [Others]1931-others find a great consolation in suddenly discovering the good qualities of [[their]1931-others husbands]2838-their husbands]2835-a woman who wears mauve , whatever her age may be , or a woman over thirty - five who is fond of pink ribbons . it always means that they have a history . others find a great consolation in suddenly discovering the good qualities of their husbands . [They]1931-others flaunt [their]1931-others conjugal felicity in one s face , as if it were the most fascinating of sins . Religion consoles [some]927-some . Its mysteries have all the charm of a flirtation , [a woman]2360-a woman once told [me]397-his companion , and [I]397-his companion can quite understand it . " What is that , [Harry]120-lord henry ? "[427-the lad] said [the lad]427-the lad listlessly .

" Oh , the obvious consolation . Taking [some one else s admirer]2845-some one else s admirer when [one]381-one loses [one]381-one [s]381-one own . " [I]397-his companion was terribly cruel to [her]168-sibyl . [You]117-dorian gray forget that . "[397-his companion]

"[397-his companion]

" [You]117-dorian gray said to [me]397-his companion that [Sibyl Vane]168-sibyl represented to [you]117-dorian gray all the heroines of romance that [she]168-sibyl was [Desdemona]197-desdemona one night , and [Ophelia]198-ophelia the other ; that if [she]168-sibyl died as [Juliet]171-juliet , [she]168-sibyl came to life as [Imogen]174-imogen . There was a silence . The evening darkened in [the room]386-the room . Noiselessly , and with silver feet , the shadows crept in from [the garden]384-the garden . The colours faded wearily out of things .

After some time [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray looked up . " [You]117-dorian gray have explained [me]117-dorian gray to [myself]117-dorian gray , [Harry]120-lord henry , "[117-dorian gray] [he]117-dorian gray murmured with something of a sigh of relief . " But suppose , [Harry]120-lord henry , [I]117-dorian gray became haggard , and old , and wrinkled ? What then ? "[117-dorian gray]

" [We]2869-we are only at the beginning of [our]2869-we friendship , [Dorian]2870-dorian , "[120-lord henry] answered [Lord Henry]120-lord henry , shaking [him]117-dorian gray by the hand . " Good - bye . [I]120-lord henry shall see [you]2870-dorian before nine - thirty , [I]120-lord henry hope . Remember , [Patti]202-patti is singing . "[120-lord henry]

As [he]120-lord henry closed the door behind [him]120-lord henry , [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray touched the bell , and in a few minutes [Victor]195-victor appeared with the lamps and drew the blinds down . [He]195-victor waited impatiently for [him]195-victor to go . [The man]2023-the man seemed to take an interminable time over everything .

As soon as [he]2023-the man had left , [he]2023-the man rushed to the screen and drew it back . No ; there was no further change in the picture . [It]948-it had received the news of [Sibyl Vane]168-sibyl s death before [he]2023-the man had known of it [himself]2023-the man . It was conscious of the events of life as they occurred . The vicious cruelty that marred the fine lines of the mouth had , no doubt , appeared at the very moment that [the girl]2212-the girl had drunk the poison , whatever it was . Or was it indifferent to results ? Did it merely take cognizance of what passed within the soul ? [He]2023-the man wondered , and hoped that some day [he]2023-the man would see the change taking place before [his]2023-the man very eyes , shuddering as [he]2023-the man hoped it .

[Poor Sibyl]203-poor sibyl ! What a romance it had all been ! [She]2212-the girl had often mimicked death on the stage . Then [Death]204-death [himself]204-death had touched [her]2212-the girl and taken [her]2212-the girl with [him]204-death . How had [she]2212-the girl played that dreadful last scene ? Had [she]2212-the girl cursed [him]2023-the man , as [she]2212-the girl died ? No ; [she]2212-the girl had died for love of [him]2023-the man , and love would always be a sacrament to [him]2023-the man now . [She]2212-the girl had atoned for everything by the sacrifice [she]2212-the girl had made of [her]2212-the girl life . [He]2023-the man would not think any more of what [she]2212-the girl had made [him]2023-the man go through , on that horrible night at [the theatre]2164-the theatre . When [he]2023-the man thought of [her]2212-the girl , it would be as [a wonderful tragic figure sent on to]951-a wonderful tragic figure sent on to [the world]1908-the world s stage to show the supreme reality of love . [A wonderful tragic figure]953-a wonderful tragic figure ? Tears came to [his]2023-the man eyes as [he]2023-the man remembered [her]2212-the girl childlike look , and winsome fanciful ways , and shy tremulous grace . [He]2023-the man brushed them away hastily and looked again at the picture .

[He]2023-the man felt that the time had really come for making [his]2023-the man choice . Or had [his]2023-the man choice already been made ? Yes , life had decided that for [him]2023-the man life , and [his]2023-the man own infinite curiosity about life . Eternal youth , infinite passion , pleasures subtle and secret , wild joys and wilder sins [he]2023-the man was to have all these things . The portrait was to bear the burden of [his]2023-the man shame : that was all .

A feeling of pain crept over [him]2023-the man as [he]2023-the man thought of the desecration that was in store for the fair face on the canvas . Once , in boyish mockery of [Narcissus]205-narcissus , [he]2023-the man had kissed , or feigned to kiss , those painted lips that now smiled so cruelly at [him]2023-the man . Morning after morning [he]2023-the man had sat before the portrait wondering at its beauty , almost enamoured of it , as it seemed to [him]2023-the man at times . Was it to alter now with every mood to which [he]2023-the man yielded ? Was it to become a monstrous and loathsome thing , to be hidden away in [a locked room]954-a locked room , to be shut out from the sunlight that had so often touched to brighter gold the waving wonder of its hair ? The pity of it ! the pity of it !

For a moment , [he]2023-the man thought of praying that the horrible sympathy that existed between [him]2023-the man and the picture might cease . It had changed in answer to a prayer ; perhaps in answer to a prayer it might remain unchanged . And yet , who , that knew anything about life , would surrender the chance of remaining always young , however fantastic that chance might be , or with what fateful consequences it might be fraught ? Besides , was it really under [his]2023-the man control ? Had it indeed been prayer that had produced the substitution ? Might there not be some curious scientific reason for it all ? If thought could exercise its influence upon a living organism , might not thought exercise an influence upon dead and inorganic things ? Nay , without thought or conscious desire , might not things external to [ourselves]955-ourselves vibrate in unison with [our]955-ourselves moods and passions , atom calling to atom in secret love or strange affinity ? But the reason was of no importance . [He]2023-the man would never again tempt by a prayer any terrible power . If the picture was to alter , it was to alter . That was all . Why inquire too closely into it ?

For there would be a real pleasure in watching it . [He]2023-the man would be able to follow [his]2023-the man mind into its secret places . This portrait would be to [him]2023-the man the most magical of mirrors . As it had revealed to [him]2023-the man [his]2023-the man own body , so it would reveal to [him]2023-the man [his]2023-the man own soul . And when winter came upon it , [he]2023-the man would still be standing where spring trembles on the verge of summer . When the blood crept from its face , and left behind a pallid mask of chalk with leaden eyes , [he]2023-the man would keep the glamour of boyhood . Not one blossom of [his]2023-the man loveliness would ever fade . Not one pulse of [his]2023-the man life would ever weaken . Like [the gods of [the Greeks]206-the greeks]956-the gods of the greeks , [he]2023-the man would be strong , and fleet , and joyous . What did it matter what happened to the coloured image on the canvas ? [He]2023-the man would be safe . That was everything .

[He]2023-the man drew the screen back into its former place in front of the picture , smiling as [he]2023-the man did so , and passed into [[his]2023-the man bedroom]888-his bedroom , where [[his]2023-the man valet]509-his valet was already waiting for [him]2023-the man . An hour later [he]2023-the man was at [the opera]959-the opera , and [Lord Henry]120-lord henry was leaning over [his]120-lord henry chair .

CHAPTER IX .

" [I]121-basil am so glad [I]121-basil have found [you]2023-the man , [Dorian]2871-dorian , "[121-basil] [he]121-basil said gravely . " [I]121-basil called last night , and [they]2872-they told [me]121-basil [you]2023-the man were at the opera . Of course , [I]121-basil knew that was impossible . But [I]121-basil wish [you]2023-the man had left word where [you]2023-the man had really gone to . [I]121-basil passed a dreadful evening , half afraid that one tragedy might be followed by another . " [You]2893-you went to the opera ? "[121-basil] said [Hallward]121-basil , speaking very slowly and with a strained touch of pain in [his]121-basil voice . " Stop , [Basil]121-basil ! [I]961-dorian won t hear it ! "[961-dorian] cried [Dorian]961-dorian , leaping to [his]961-dorian feet . " [You]2893-you must not tell [me]961-dorian about things . What is done is done . What is past is past . "[961-dorian]

" [You]2893-you call yesterday the past ? "[121-basil]

" What has the actual lapse of time got to do with it ? It is only [shallow people who require years to get rid of an emotion]2898-shallow people who require years to get rid of an emotion . [A man who is master of [himself]2899-a man who is master of himself]2899-a man who is master of himself can end a sorrow as easily as [he]2899-a man who is master of himself can invent a pleasure . [I]961-dorian don t want to be at the mercy of [my]961-dorian emotions . [I]961-dorian want to use them , to enjoy them , and to dominate them . "[961-dorian]

" [Dorian]2900-dorian , this is horrible ! Something has changed [you]2900-dorian completely . [You]2900-dorian look exactly [the same wonderful boy who , day after day , used to come down to [[my]121-basil studio]2902-my studio to sit for [his]121-basil picture . " [I]357-the artist want the [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray [I]357-the artist used to paint , "[357-the artist] said [the artist]357-the artist sadly .

" [Basil]121-basil , "[427-the lad] said [the lad]427-the lad , going over to [him]427-the lad and putting [his]427-the lad hand on [his]427-the lad shoulder , " [you]121-basil have come too late . Yesterday , when [I]427-the lad heard that [Sibyl Vane]168-sibyl had killed [herself]168-sibyl "[427-the lad]

" Killed [herself]168-sibyl ! Good heavens ! is there no doubt about that ? "[121-basil] cried [Hallward]121-basil , looking up at [him]427-the lad with an expression of horror .

[The elder man]966-the elder man buried [his]966-the elder man face in [his]966-the elder man hands . " How fearful , "[966-the elder man] [he]966-the elder man muttered , and a shudder ran through [him]966-the elder man .

" No , "[117-dorian gray] said [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray , " there is nothing fearful about it . It is one of the great romantic tragedies of the age . As a rule , [people who act lead the most commonplace lives]2907-people who act lead the most commonplace lives . [They]2907-people who act lead the most commonplace lives are [good husbands]2908-good husbands , or [faithful wives]2909-faithful wives , or something tedious . If [you]121-basil had come in yesterday at a particular moment about half - past five , perhaps , or a quarter to six [you]121-basil would have found [me]117-dorian gray in tears . Weeks and weeks went on , and [I]389-the painter grew more and more absorbed in [you]2950-dorian . Then came a new development . [I]389-the painter had drawn [you]2950-dorian as [Paris]13-paris in dainty armour , and as [Adonis with huntsman s cloak and polished boar - spear]2953-adonis with huntsman s cloak and polished boar - spear . And it had all been what art should be unconscious , ideal , and remote . One day , a fatal day [I]389-the painter sometimes think , [I]389-the painter determined to paint a wonderful portrait of [you]2950-dorian as [you]2950-dorian actually are , not in the costume of dead ages , but in [your]2950-dorian own dress and in [your]2950-dorian own time . Whether it was the realism of the method , or the mere wonder of [your]2950-dorian own personality , thus directly presented to [me]389-the painter without mist or veil , [I]389-the painter can not tell . But [I]389-the painter know that as [I]389-the painter worked at it , every flake and film of colour seemed to [me]389-the painter to reveal [my]389-the painter secret . [I]389-the painter grew afraid that [others]1931-others would know of [my]389-the painter idolatry . [I]389-the painter felt , [Dorian]117-dorian gray , that [I]389-the painter had told too much , that [I]389-the painter had put too much of [myself]389-the painter into it . Even now [I]389-the painter can not help feeling that it is a mistake to think that the passion one feels in creation is ever really shown in the work [one]2959-one creates . Art is always more abstract than [we]2960-we fancy . Form and colour tell [us]2960-we of form and colour that is all . It often seems to [me]389-the painter that art conceals [the artist]357-the artist far more completely than it ever reveals [him]357-the artist . Perhaps one should never put [one]381-one s worship into words . "[981-some one who would fill him with a strange idolatry]

" It was a very disappointing confession . "[117-dorian gray]

" Why , what did [you]2963-dorian expect , [Dorian]2967-dorian ? [You]2963-dorian didn t see anything else in the picture , did [you]2963-dorian ? There was nothing else to see ? "[981-some one who would fill him with a strange idolatry]

" No ; there was nothing else to see . Why do [you]2963-dorian ask ? But [you]2963-dorian mustn t talk about worship . It is foolish . [You]2963-dorian and [I]117-dorian gray are [friends]1988-friends , [Basil]121-basil , and [we]1988-friends must always remain so . "[117-dorian gray]

" [You]2963-dorian have got [Harry]120-lord henry , "[389-the painter] said [the painter]389-the painter sadly .

" Oh , [Harry]120-lord henry ! "[427-the lad] cried [the lad]427-the lad , with a ripple of laughter . " [Harry]120-lord henry spends [his]120-lord henry days in saying what is incredible and [his]120-lord henry evenings in doing what is improbable . Just the sort of life [I]427-the lad would like to lead . But still [I]427-the lad don t think [I]427-the lad would go to [Harry]120-lord henry if [I]427-the lad were in trouble . [I]427-the lad would sooner go to [you]121-basil , [Basil]121-basil . "[427-the lad]

" [You]121-basil will sit to [me]117-dorian gray again ? "[117-dorian gray]

" Impossible ! "[427-the lad]

" [You]121-basil spoil [my]117-dorian gray life as [an artist]368-an artist by refusing , [Dorian]2970-dorian . [No man]2631-no man comes across two ideal things . Few come across one . "[117-dorian gray]

" [I]427-the lad can t explain it to [you]121-basil , [Basil]121-basil , but [I]427-the lad must never sit to [you]121-basil again . There is something fatal about a portrait . It has a life of its own . [I]427-the lad will come and have tea with [you]121-basil . That will be just as pleasant . "[427-the lad]

" Pleasanter for [you]121-basil , [I]121-basil am afraid , "[121-basil] murmured [Hallward]121-basil regretfully . " And now good - bye . [I]121-basil am sorry [you]121-basil won t let [me]121-basil look at the picture once again . But that can t be helped . [I]121-basil quite understand what [you]121-basil feel about it . "[121-basil]

As [he]121-basil left [the room]386-the room , [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray smiled to [himself]117-dorian gray . [Poor Basil]212-poor basil ! How little [he]121-basil knew of the true reason ! And how strange it was that , instead of having been forced to reveal [his]121-basil own secret , [he]121-basil had succeeded , almost by chance , in wresting a secret from [[his]121-basil friend]643-his friend ! How much that strange confession explained to [him]121-basil ! [The painter]389-the painter s absurd fits of jealousy , [his]389-the painter wild devotion , [his]389-the painter extravagant panegyrics , [his]389-the painter curious reticences [he]121-basil understood them all now , and [he]121-basil felt sorry . There seemed to [him]121-basil to be something tragic in a friendship so coloured by romance .

[He]121-basil sighed and touched the bell . The portrait must be hidden away at all costs . [He]121-basil could not run such a risk of discovery again . It had been mad of [him]121-basil to have allowed the thing to remain , even for an hour , in [a room to which any of [[his]121-basil friends]390-his friends had access]987-a room to which any of his friends had access .

CHAPTER X.

When [[his]121-basil servant]422-his servant entered , [he]121-basil looked at [him]422-his servant steadfastly and wondered if [he]121-basil had thought of peering behind the screen . [The man]2023-the man was quite impassive and waited for [his]121-basil orders . [Dorian]991-dorian lit a cigarette and walked over to the glass and glanced into it . [He]991-dorian could see the reflection of [Victor]195-victor s face perfectly . It was like a placid mask of servility . There was nothing to be afraid of , there . Yet [he]991-dorian thought it best to be on [his]991-dorian guard .

Speaking very slowly , [he]991-dorian told [him]422-his servant to tell [the house - keeper]992-the house - keeper that [he]991-dorian wanted to see [her]422-his servant , and then to go to [the frame - maker]993-the frame - maker and ask [him]422-his servant to send [two of [[his]121-basil men]995-his men]994-two of his men round at once . It seemed to [him]991-dorian that as [the man]2023-the man left [the room]386-the room [his]2023-the man eyes wandered in the direction of the screen . Or was that merely [his]2023-the man own fancy ?

After a few moments , in [her]422-his servant black silk dress , with old - fashioned thread mittens on [her]422-his servant wrinkled hands , [Mrs. Leaf]213-leaf bustled into [the library]887-the library . [He]991-dorian asked [her]422-his servant for the key of [the schoolroom]999-the schoolroom .

" [The old schoolroom]2972-the old schoolroom , [Mr. Dorian]117-dorian gray ? "[422-his servant] [she]422-his servant exclaimed . " Why , [it]2972-the old schoolroom is full of dust . [I]422-his servant must get it arranged and put straight before [you]991-dorian go into it . It is not fit for [you]991-dorian to see , [sir]2063-sir . It is not , indeed . "[422-his servant]

" [I]422-his servant don t want it put straight , [Leaf]213-leaf . [I]422-his servant only want the key . "[422-his servant]

" Well , [sir]2063-sir , [you]991-dorian ll be covered with cobwebs if [you]991-dorian go into it . Why , [it]2972-the old schoolroom hasn t been opened for nearly five years not since [[his]1000-his grandfather lordship]2975-his lordship died . "[422-his servant]

[He]991-dorian winced at the mention of [[his]991-dorian grandfather]1000-his grandfather . [He]991-dorian had hateful memories of [him]1000-his grandfather . " That does not matter , "[991-dorian] [he]991-dorian answered . " [I]991-dorian simply want to see the place that is all . Give [me]991-dorian the key . "[991-dorian]

" And here is the key , [sir]2063-sir , "[1001-the old lady] said [the old lady]1001-the old lady , going over the contents of [her]1001-the old lady bunch with tremulously uncertain hands . " Here is the key . [I]1001-the old lady ll have it off the bunch in a moment . But [you]2063-sir don t think of living up there , [sir]2063-sir , and [you]2063-sir so comfortable [here]2327-here ? "[1001-the old lady]

" No , no , "[991-dorian] [he]991-dorian cried petulantly . " Thank [you]2063-sir , [Leaf]213-leaf . That will do . "[991-dorian]

[She]1001-the old lady lingered for a few moments , and was garrulous over some detail of [the household]1002-the household . [He]991-dorian sighed and told [her]1001-the old lady to manage things as [she]1001-the old lady thought best . [She]1001-the old lady left [the room]386-the room , wreathed in smiles .

As the door closed , [Dorian]117-dorian gray put the key in [his]117-dorian gray pocket and looked round [the room]386-the room . [His]117-dorian gray eye fell on a large , purple satin coverlet heavily embroidered with gold , a splendid piece of late seventeenth - century Venetian work that [[his]117-dorian gray grandfather]1000-his grandfather had found in [a convent near [Bologna]43-bologna]1006-a convent near bologna . Yes , that would serve to wrap the dreadful thing in . It had perhaps served often as a pall for [the dead]1007-the dead . Now it was to hide something that had a corruption of its own , worse than the corruption of death itself something that would breed horrors and yet would never die . What the worm was to the corpse , [his]117-dorian gray sins would be to the painted image on the canvas . [They]1008-they would mar its beauty and eat away its grace . [They]1008-they would defile it and make it shameful . And yet the thing would still live on . [It]1009-it would be always alive .

[He]117-dorian gray shuddered , and for a moment [he]117-dorian gray regretted that [he]117-dorian gray had not told [Basil]121-basil the true reason why [he]117-dorian gray had wished to hide the picture away . [Basil]121-basil would have helped [him]117-dorian gray to resist [Lord Henry]120-lord henry s influence , and the still more poisonous influences that came from [his]117-dorian gray own temperament . The love that [he]117-dorian gray bore [him]117-dorian gray for it was really love had nothing in it that was not noble and intellectual . It was not that mere physical admiration of beauty that is born of the senses and that dies when the senses tire . It was such love as [Michelangelo]214-michelangelo had known , and [Montaigne]215-montaigne , and [Winckelmann]216-winckelmann , and [Shakespeare]1010-shakespeare [himself]1010-shakespeare . Yes , [Basil]121-basil could have saved [him]117-dorian gray . But it was too late now . The past could always be annihilated . Regret , denial , or forgetfulness could do that . But the future was inevitable . There were passions in [him]117-dorian gray that would find [their]1011-their terrible outlet , dreams that would make the shadow of [their]1011-their evil real .

[He]117-dorian gray took up from the couch the great purple - and - gold texture that covered it , and , holding it in [his]117-dorian gray hands , passed behind the screen . Was the face on the canvas viler than before ? It seemed to [him]117-dorian gray that it was unchanged , and yet [his]117-dorian gray loathing of it was intensified . Gold hair , blue eyes , and rose - red lips they all were there . It was simply the expression that had altered . That was horrible in its cruelty . Compared to what [he]117-dorian gray saw in it of censure or rebuke , how shallow [Basil]121-basil s reproaches about [Sibyl Vane]168-sibyl had been ! how shallow , and of what little account ! [His]117-dorian gray own soul was looking out at [him]117-dorian gray from the canvas and calling [him]117-dorian gray to judgement . A look of pain came across [him]117-dorian gray , and [he]117-dorian gray flung the rich pall over the picture . As [he]117-dorian gray did so , a knock came to the door . [He]117-dorian gray passed out as [[his]117-dorian gray servant]422-his servant entered .

" [The persons]2979-the persons are [here]2327-here , [Monsieur]2981-monsieur . "[117-dorian gray]

[He]117-dorian gray felt that [the man]2023-the man must be got rid of at once . [He]117-dorian gray must not be allowed to know where the picture was being taken to . There was something sly about [him]117-dorian gray , and [he]117-dorian gray had thoughtful , treacherous eyes . Sitting down at the writing - table [he]117-dorian gray scribbled a note to [Lord Henry]120-lord henry , asking [him]120-lord henry to send [him]120-lord henry round something to read and reminding [him]120-lord henry that [they]1014-they were to meet at eight - fifteen that evening .

" Wait for an answer , "[117-dorian gray] [he]117-dorian gray said , handing it to [him]120-lord henry , " and show [the men]2198-the men in [here]2327-here . "[117-dorian gray]

In two or three minutes there was another knock , and [Mr. Hubbard]217-mr. hubbard [himself]217-mr. hubbard , [the celebrated frame - maker of [South Audley Street]44-south audley street]1015-the celebrated frame - maker of south audley street , came in with [a somewhat rough - looking young assistant]1016-a somewhat rough - looking young assistant . [Mr. Hubbard]217-mr. hubbard was [a florid , red - whiskered little man , whose admiration for art was considerably tempered by the inveterate impecuniosity of most of [the artists who dealt with [him]217-mr. hubbard]1018-the artists who dealt with him . As a rule , [he]217-mr. hubbard never left [[his]217-mr. hubbard shop]1019-his shop]1017-a florid , red - whiskered little man , whose admiration for art was considerably tempered by the inveterate impecuniosity of most of the artists who dealt with him . as a rule , he never left his shop . [He]217-mr. hubbard waited for [people]1933-people to come to [him]217-mr. hubbard . But [he]217-mr. hubbard always made an exception in favour of [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray . There was something about [Dorian]117-dorian gray that charmed [everybody]2085-everybody . It was a pleasure even to see [him]117-dorian gray .

" What can [I]217-mr. hubbard do for [you]117-dorian gray , [Mr. Gray]117-dorian gray ? "[217-mr. hubbard] [he]217-mr. hubbard said , rubbing [his]217-mr. hubbard fat freckled hands . " [I]217-mr. hubbard thought [I]217-mr. hubbard would do [myself]217-mr. hubbard the honour of coming round in person . [I]217-mr. hubbard have just got a beauty of a frame , [sir]2063-sir . Picked it up at a sale . [Old Florentine]218-old florentine . Came from [Fonthill]45-fonthill , [I]217-mr. hubbard believe . Admirably suited for a religious subject , [Mr. Gray]117-dorian gray . "[217-mr. hubbard]

" [I]2085-everybody am so sorry [you]2063-sir have given [yourself]2063-sir the trouble of coming round , [Mr. Hubbard]217-mr. hubbard . [I]2085-everybody shall certainly drop in and look at the frame though [I]2085-everybody don t go in much at present for religious art but to - day [I]2085-everybody only want a picture carried to the top of [the house]425-the house for [me]2085-everybody . It is rather heavy , so [I]2085-everybody thought [I]2085-everybody would ask [you]2063-sir to lend [me]2085-everybody [a couple of [[your]2063-sir men]2987-your men]2986-a couple of your men . "[2085-everybody]

" No trouble at all , [Mr. Gray]117-dorian gray . [I]217-mr. hubbard am delighted to be of any service to [you]2063-sir . Which is the work of art , [sir]2063-sir ? "[217-mr. hubbard]

" This , "[117-dorian gray] replied [Dorian]117-dorian gray , moving the screen back . " Can [you]2063-sir move it , covering and all , just as it is ? [I]117-dorian gray don t want it to get scratched going [upstairs]676-upstairs . "[117-dorian gray]

" There will be no difficulty , [sir]2063-sir , "[1022-the genial frame - maker] said [the genial frame - maker]1022-the genial frame - maker , beginning , with the aid of [[his]1022-the genial frame - maker assistant]1023-his assistant , to unhook the picture from the long brass chains by which it was suspended . " And , now , where shall [we]2991-we carry it to , [Mr. Gray]117-dorian gray ? "[1022-the genial frame - maker]

" [I]1022-the genial frame - maker will show [you]2063-sir the way , [Mr. Hubbard]217-mr. hubbard , if [you]2063-sir will kindly follow [me]1022-the genial frame - maker . Or perhaps [you]2063-sir had better go in front . [I]1022-the genial frame - maker am afraid it is right at the top of [the house]425-the house . [We]2991-we will go up by the front staircase , as [it]425-the house is wider . "[1022-the genial frame - maker]

[He]1022-the genial frame - maker held the door open for [them]1024-them , and [they]1024-them passed out into [the hall]1025-the hall and began the ascent . The elaborate character of the frame had made the picture extremely bulky , and now and then , in spite of the obsequious protests of [Mr. Hubbard]217-mr. hubbard , who had [the true tradesman]1026-the true tradesman s spirited dislike of seeing [a gentleman]504-a gentleman doing anything useful , [Dorian]1028-dorian put [his]1028-dorian hand to it so as to help [them]1024-them .

" Something of a load to carry , [sir]2063-sir , "[1029-the little man] gasped [the little man]1029-the little man when [they]1024-them reached the top landing . And [he]1029-the little man wiped [his]1029-the little man shiny forehead .

" [I]117-dorian gray am afraid it is rather heavy , "[117-dorian gray] murmured [Dorian]117-dorian gray as [he]117-dorian gray unlocked the door that opened into [the room that was to keep for [him]1029-the little man the curious secret of [his]1029-the little man life and hide [his]1029-the little man soul from the eyes of [men]2041-men]1030-the room that was to keep for him the curious secret of his life and hide his soul from the eyes of men .

[He]117-dorian gray had not entered [the place]2436-the place for more than four years not , indeed , since [he]117-dorian gray had used [it]2436-the place first as [a play - room]1033-a play - room when [he]117-dorian gray was [a child]2444-a child , and then as [a study]1035-a study when [he]117-dorian gray grew somewhat older . It was a large , well - proportioned room , which had been specially built by [the last Lord Kelso]141-kelso for the use of [the little grandson whom , for [his]117-dorian gray strange likeness to [[his]117-dorian gray mother]2191-his mother , and also for other reasons , [he]117-dorian gray had always hated and desired to keep at a distance]1036-the little grandson whom , for his strange likeness to his mother , and also for other reasons , he had always hated and desired to keep at a distance . It appeared to [Dorian]117-dorian gray to have but little changed . There was [the huge Italian _ cassone _]1038-the huge italian _ cassone _ , with [its]1038-the huge italian _ cassone _ fantastically painted panels and [its]1038-the huge italian _ cassone _ tarnished gilt mouldings , in which [he]117-dorian gray had so often hidden [himself]117-dorian gray as [a boy]754-a boy . There the satinwood book - case filled with [his]117-dorian gray dog - eared schoolbooks . On the wall behind [it]1038-the huge italian _ cassone _ was hanging the same ragged Flemish tapestry where [a faded king]1040-a faded king and [queen]599-queen were playing chess in [a garden]1042-a garden , while [a company of hawkers]1043-a company of hawkers rode by , carrying hooded birds on [their]1043-a company of hawkers gauntleted wrists . How well [he]117-dorian gray remembered it all ! Every moment of [his]117-dorian gray lonely childhood came back to [him]117-dorian gray as [he]117-dorian gray looked round . [He]117-dorian gray recalled the stainless purity of [his]117-dorian gray boyish life , and it seemed horrible to [him]117-dorian gray that it was here the fatal portrait was to be hidden away . How little [he]117-dorian gray had thought , in those dead days , of all that was in store for [him]117-dorian gray !

But there was no other place in [the house]425-the house so secure from prying eyes as this . [He]117-dorian gray had the key , and [no one else]932-no one else could enter [it]1038-the huge italian _ cassone _ . Beneath its purple pall , the face painted on the canvas could grow bestial , sodden , and unclean . What did it matter ? [No one]2310-no one could see [it]1047-it . [He]117-dorian gray [himself]117-dorian gray would not see it . Why should [he]117-dorian gray watch the hideous corruption of [his]117-dorian gray soul ? [He]117-dorian gray kept [his]117-dorian gray youth that was enough . And , besides , might not [his]117-dorian gray nature grow finer , after all ? There was no reason that the future should be so full of shame . Some love might come across [his]117-dorian gray life , and purify [him]117-dorian gray , and shield [him]117-dorian gray from those sins that seemed to be already stirring in spirit and in flesh those curious unpictured sins whose very mystery lent [them]1048-them [their]1048-them subtlety and their charm . Perhaps , some day , the cruel look would have passed away from the scarlet sensitive mouth , and [he]117-dorian gray might show to [the world]1908-the world [Basil Hallward]121-basil s masterpiece .

No ; that was impossible . Hour by hour , and week by week , the thing upon the canvas was growing old . It might escape the hideousness of sin , but the hideousness of age was in store for it . The cheeks would become hollow or flaccid . Yellow crow s feet would creep round the fading eyes and make them horrible . The hair would lose its brightness , the mouth would gape or droop , would be foolish or gross , as the mouths of [old men]1912-old men are . There would be the wrinkled throat , the cold , blue - veined hands , the twisted body , that [he]117-dorian gray remembered in [the grandfather who had been so stern to [him]117-dorian gray in [his]117-dorian gray boyhood]1051-the grandfather who had been so stern to him in his boyhood . The picture had to be concealed . There was no help for it .

" Bring it in , [Mr. Hubbard]217-mr. hubbard , please , "[117-dorian gray] [he]117-dorian gray said , wearily , turning round . " [I]117-dorian gray am sorry [I]117-dorian gray kept [you]217-mr. hubbard so long . [I]117-dorian gray was thinking of something else . "[117-dorian gray]

" Always glad to have a rest , [Mr. Gray]117-dorian gray , "[1052-the frame - maker , who was still gasping for breath] answered [the frame - maker , who was still gasping for breath]1052-the frame - maker , who was still gasping for breath . " Where shall [we]2994-we put it , [sir]2063-sir ? "[1052-the frame - maker , who was still gasping for breath]

" Oh , anywhere . Here : this will do . [I]2023-the man don t want to have it hung up . Just lean it against the wall . Thanks . "[2023-the man]

" Might one look at the work of art , [sir]2063-sir ? "[1052-the frame - maker , who was still gasping for breath]

[Dorian]117-dorian gray started . " It would not interest [you]2063-sir , [Mr. Hubbard]217-mr. hubbard , "[117-dorian gray] [he]117-dorian gray said , keeping [his]117-dorian gray eye on [the man]2023-the man . [He]117-dorian gray felt ready to leap upon [him]2023-the man and fling [him]2023-the man to the ground if [he]117-dorian gray dared to lift the gorgeous hanging that concealed the secret of [his]2023-the man life . " [I]117-dorian gray shan t trouble [you]2063-sir any more now . [I]117-dorian gray am much obliged for [your]2063-sir kindness in coming round . "[117-dorian gray]

" Not at all , not at all , [Mr. Gray]117-dorian gray . Ever ready to do anything for [you]2063-sir , [sir]2063-sir . "[217-mr. hubbard] And [Mr. Hubbard]217-mr. hubbard tramped [downstairs]763-downstairs , followed by [the assistant]1055-the assistant , who glanced back at [Dorian]117-dorian gray with a look of shy wonder in [his]1055-the assistant rough uncomely face . [He]117-dorian gray had never seen [any one]1934-any one so marvellous .

When the sound of [their]1057-their footsteps had died away , [Dorian]117-dorian gray locked the door and put the key in [his]117-dorian gray pocket . [He]117-dorian gray felt safe now . [No one]2310-no one would ever look upon the horrible thing . No eye but [his]117-dorian gray would ever see [his]117-dorian gray shame .

On reaching [the library]887-the library , [he]117-dorian gray found that it was just after five o clock and that the tea had been already brought up . On a little table of dark perfumed wood thickly incrusted with nacre , a present from [Lady Radley]219-lady radley , [[his]117-dorian gray guardian s wife]1060-his guardian s wife , [a pretty professional invalid who had spent the preceding winter in [Cairo]46-cairo]1061-a pretty professional invalid who had spent the preceding winter in cairo , was lying a note from [Lord Henry]120-lord henry , and beside it was a book bound in yellow paper , the cover slightly torn and the edges soiled . A copy of the third edition of _ The St. James s Gazette _ had been placed on the tea - tray . It was evident that [Victor]195-victor had returned .
