[I]1390-dorian think it right that [you]3009-dorian should know that the most dreadful things are being said against [you]3009-dorian in [London]2-london . "[1390-dorian]

" [I]1390-dorian don t wish to know anything about them . [I]1390-dorian love scandals about [other people]2010-other people , but scandals about [myself]1390-dorian don t interest [me]1390-dorian . [They]3036-they have not got the charm of novelty . "[1390-dorian]

" [They]3036-they must interest [you]3009-dorian , [Dorian]3037-dorian . [Every gentleman]3038-every gentleman is interested in [his]3038-every gentleman good name . [You]3009-dorian don t want [people]1933-people to talk of [you]3009-dorian as something vile and degraded . Of course , [you]3009-dorian have [your]3009-dorian position , and [your]3009-dorian wealth , and all that kind of thing . But position and wealth are not everything . Mind [you]3009-dorian , [I]1390-dorian don t believe these rumours at all . At least , [I]1390-dorian can t believe them when [I]1390-dorian see [you]3009-dorian . Sin is a thing that writes itself across [a man]380-a man s face . It can not be concealed . [People]1933-people talk sometimes of secret vices . There are no such things . If [a wretched man]3042-a wretched man has a vice , it shows itself in the lines of [his]3042-a wretched man mouth , the droop of [his]3042-a wretched man eyelids , the moulding of [his]3042-a wretched man hands even . [Somebody]604-somebody [I]1390-dorian won t mention [his]604-somebody name , but [you]3009-dorian know [him]604-somebody came to [me]1390-dorian last year to have [his]604-somebody portrait done . [I]1390-dorian had never seen [him]604-somebody before , and had never heard anything about [him]604-somebody at the time , though [I]1390-dorian have heard a good deal since . [He]604-somebody offered an extravagant price . [I]1390-dorian refused [him]604-somebody . There was something in the shape of [his]604-somebody fingers that [I]1390-dorian hated . [I]1390-dorian know now that [I]1390-dorian was quite right in what [I]1390-dorian fancied about [him]604-somebody . [His]604-somebody life is dreadful . But [you]3009-dorian , [Dorian]117-dorian gray , with [your]3009-dorian pure , bright , innocent face , and [your]3009-dorian marvellous untroubled youth [I]1390-dorian can t believe anything against [you]3009-dorian . And yet [I]1390-dorian see [you]3009-dorian very seldom , and [you]3009-dorian never come down to [the studio]383-the studio now , and when [I]1390-dorian am away from [you]3009-dorian , and [I]1390-dorian hear all these hideous things that [people]1933-people are whispering about [you]3009-dorian , [I]1390-dorian don t know what to say . Why is it , [Dorian]117-dorian gray , that [a man like [the Duke of Berwick]302-berwick]3046-a man like the duke of berwick leaves [the room of [a club]3048-a club]3047-the room of a club when [you]3009-dorian enter [it]3048-a club ? [You]3009-dorian used to be [a friend of [Lord Staveley]303-lord staveley]3051-a friend of lord staveley . [I]1390-dorian met [him]303-lord staveley at dinner last week . [Your]3009-dorian name happened to come up in conversation , in connection with the miniatures [you]3009-dorian have lent to the exhibition at [the Dudley]90-the dudley . [Staveley]303-lord staveley curled [his]303-lord staveley lip and said that [you]3009-dorian might have the most artistic tastes , but that [you]3009-dorian were [a man whom no pure - minded girl]3052-a man whom no pure - minded girl should be allowed to know , and whom [no chaste woman]3053-no chaste woman should sit in [the same room]3054-the same room with . [I]1390-dorian reminded [him]303-lord staveley that [I]1390-dorian was [a friend of yours]3055-a friend of yours , and asked [him]303-lord staveley what [he]303-lord staveley meant . [He]303-lord staveley told [me]1390-dorian . [He]303-lord staveley told [me]1390-dorian right out before [everybody]2085-everybody . It was horrible ! Why is [your]3009-dorian friendship so fatal to [young men]2173-young men ? There was [that wretched boy in the Guards who committed suicide]3058-that wretched boy in the guards who committed suicide . There was [Sir Henry Ashton]304-sir henry ashton , who had to leave [England]5-england with a tarnished name . [You]3009-dorian and [he]304-sir henry ashton were inseparable . What about [Adrian Singleton]211-adrian singleton and [his]211-adrian singleton dreadful end ? What about [[Lord Kent]305-lord kent s only son]3060-lord kent s only son and [his]211-adrian singleton career ? [I]1390-dorian met [[his]211-adrian singleton father]493-his father yesterday in [St. James s Street]91-st. james s street . [He]493-his father seemed broken with shame and sorrow . What about [the young Duke of [Perth]306-the young duke of perth]306-the young duke of perth ? What sort of life has [he]306-the young duke of perth got now ? [What gentleman]3062-what gentleman would associate with [him]306-the young duke of perth ? "[1390-dorian]

" Stop , [Basil]121-basil . [You]121-basil are talking about things of which [you]121-basil know nothing , "[117-dorian gray] said [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray , biting [his]117-dorian gray lip , and with a note of infinite contempt in [his]117-dorian gray voice . " [You]121-basil ask [me]117-dorian gray why [Berwick]302-berwick leaves [a room]1253-a room when [I]117-dorian gray enter [it]1253-a room . It is because [I]117-dorian gray know everything about [his]302-berwick life , not because [he]302-berwick knows anything about [mine]117-dorian gray . With such blood as [he]302-berwick has in [his]302-berwick veins , how could [his]302-berwick record be clean ? [You]121-basil ask [me]117-dorian gray about [Henry Ashton]304-sir henry ashton and [young Perth]306-the young duke of perth . Did [I]117-dorian gray teach [the one]3064-the one [his]3064-the one vices , and [the other]3065-the other [his]3064-the one debauchery ? If [[Kent]305-lord kent s silly son]3066-kent s silly son takes [[his]3066-kent s silly son wife]2313-his wife from [the streets]3068-the streets , what is that to [me]117-dorian gray ? If [Adrian Singleton]211-adrian singleton writes [[his]211-adrian singleton friend]643-his friend s name across a bill , am [I]117-dorian gray [[his]211-adrian singleton keeper]3070-his keeper ? [I]117-dorian gray know how [people]1933-people chatter in [England]5-england . [The middle classes]2651-the middle classes air [their]2651-the middle classes moral prejudices over [their]2651-the middle classes gross dinner - tables , and whisper about what [they]2651-the middle classes call the profligacies of [[their]2651-the middle classes betters]3073-their betters in order to try and pretend that [they]2651-the middle classes are in smart society and on intimate terms with [the people [they]2651-the middle classes slander]3074-the people they slander . In [this country]3075-this country , it is enough for [a man]380-a man to have distinction and brains for every common tongue to wag against [him]380-a man . And what sort of lives do [these people , who pose as being moral]3077-these people , who pose as being moral , lead [themselves]3077-these people , who pose as being moral ? [[My]117-dorian gray dear fellow]1907-my dear fellow , [you]1907-my dear fellow forget that [we]3079-we are in [the native land of [the hypocrite]3081-the hypocrite]3080-the native land of the hypocrite . "[117-dorian gray]

" [Dorian]3082-dorian , "[121-basil] cried [Hallward]121-basil , " that is not the question . [England]5-england is bad enough [I]121-basil know , and English society is all wrong . That is the reason why [I]121-basil want [you]3082-dorian to be fine . [You]3082-dorian have not been fine . [One]381-one has a right to judge of [a man]380-a man by the effect [he]380-a man has over [[his]380-a man friends]390-his friends . [Yours]3082-dorian seem to lose all sense of honour , of goodness , of purity . [You]3082-dorian have filled [them]390-his friends with a madness for pleasure . [They]390-his friends have gone down into the depths . [You]3082-dorian led [them]390-his friends [there]1904-there . Yes : [you]3082-dorian led [them]390-his friends [there]1904-there , and yet [you]3082-dorian can smile , as [you]3082-dorian are smiling now . And there is worse behind . [I]121-basil know [you]3082-dorian and [Harry]304-sir henry ashton are inseparable . Surely for that reason , if for none other , [you]3082-dorian should not have made [[his]304-sir henry ashton sister]663-his sister s name a by - word . "[121-basil]

" Take care , [Basil]121-basil . [You]121-basil go too far . "[117-dorian gray]

" [I]121-basil must speak , and [you]3082-dorian must listen . [You]3082-dorian shall listen . When [you]3082-dorian met [Lady Gwendolen]207-lady gwendolen , not a breath of scandal had ever touched [her]207-lady gwendolen . Is there [a single decent woman in [London]2-london]3089-a single decent woman in london now who would drive with [her]207-lady gwendolen in [the park]2309-the park ? Why , even [[her]207-lady gwendolen children]3091-her children are not allowed to live with [her]207-lady gwendolen . Then there are other stories stories that [you]3082-dorian have been seen creeping at dawn out of [dreadful houses]3092-dreadful houses and slinking in disguise into [the foulest dens in [London]2-london]3093-the foulest dens in london . Are [they]3094-they true ? Can they be true ? When [I]121-basil first heard [them]3094-they , [I]121-basil laughed . What about [[your]3082-dorian country - house]3095-your country - house and the life that is led [there]1904-there ? [Dorian]3097-dorian , [you]3082-dorian don t know what is said about [you]3082-dorian . [I]121-basil won t tell [you]3082-dorian that [I]121-basil don t want to preach to [you]3082-dorian . [I]121-basil remember [Harry]304-sir henry ashton saying once that [every man who turned [himself]3098-every man who turned himself into an amateur curate for the moment into [an amateur curate for the moment]3099-an amateur curate for the moment]3098-every man who turned himself into an amateur curate for the moment always began by saying that , and then proceeded to break [his]3098-every man who turned himself into an amateur curate for the moment word . [I]121-basil do want to preach to [you]3082-dorian . [I]121-basil want [you]3082-dorian to lead such a life as will make [the world]1908-the world respect [you]3082-dorian . [I]121-basil want [you]3082-dorian to have a clean name and a fair record . [I]121-basil want [you]3082-dorian to get rid of [the dreadful people [you]3082-dorian associate with]3101-the dreadful people you associate with . Don t shrug [your]3082-dorian shoulders like that . Don t be so indifferent . [You]3082-dorian have a wonderful influence . Let it be for good , not for evil . [They]3101-the dreadful people you associate with say that [you]3082-dorian corrupt every one with whom [you]3082-dorian become intimate , and that it is quite sufficient for [you]3082-dorian to enter [a house]3102-a house for shame of some kind to follow after . [I]121-basil don t know whether it is so or not . How should [I]121-basil know ? But it is said of [you]3082-dorian . [I]121-basil am told things that it seems impossible to doubt . [Lord Gloucester]307-lord gloucester was [one of [[my]121-basil greatest friends at [Oxford]4-oxford]3104-my greatest friends at oxford]3103-one of my greatest friends at oxford . [He]307-lord gloucester showed [me]121-basil a letter that [[his]307-lord gloucester wife]2313-his wife had written to [him]307-lord gloucester when [she]2313-his wife was dying alone in [[her]2313-his wife villa at [Mentone]93-mentone]3106-her villa at mentone . [Your]3082-dorian name was implicated in the most terrible confession [I]121-basil ever read . [I]121-basil told [him]307-lord gloucester that it was absurd that [I]121-basil knew [you]3082-dorian thoroughly and that [you]3082-dorian were incapable of anything of the kind . Know [you]3082-dorian ? [I]121-basil wonder do [I]121-basil know [you]3082-dorian ? Before [I]121-basil could answer that , [I]121-basil should have to see [your]3082-dorian soul . "[121-basil]

" To see [my]117-dorian gray soul ! "[117-dorian gray] muttered [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray , starting up from the sofa and turning almost white from fear .

" Yes , "[121-basil] answered [Hallward]121-basil gravely , and with deep - toned sorrow in [his]121-basil voice , " to see [your]3082-dorian soul . But only [God]134-god can do that . "[121-basil]

A bitter laugh of mockery broke from the lips of [the younger man]1391-the younger man . " [You]3082-dorian shall see it [yourself]3082-dorian , to - night ! "[121-basil] [he]121-basil cried , seizing a lamp from the table . " Come : it is [your]3082-dorian own handiwork . Why shouldn t [you]3082-dorian look at it ? [You]3082-dorian can tell [the world]1908-the world all about it afterwards , if [you]3082-dorian choose . [Nobody]3108-nobody would believe [you]3082-dorian . If [they]3108-nobody did believe [you]3082-dorian , [they]3108-nobody would like [me]121-basil all the better for it . [I]121-basil know the age better than [you]3082-dorian do , though [you]3082-dorian will prate about it so tediously . Come , [I]121-basil tell [you]3082-dorian . [You]3082-dorian have chattered enough about corruption . Now [you]3082-dorian shall look on it face to face . "[121-basil]

There was the madness of pride in every word [he]121-basil uttered . [He]121-basil stamped [his]121-basil foot upon the ground in [his]121-basil boyish insolent manner . [He]121-basil felt a terrible joy at the thought that [some one else]616-some one else was to share [his]121-basil secret , and that [the man who had painted the portrait that was the origin of all [his]121-basil shame]1393-the man who had painted the portrait that was the origin of all his shame was to be burdened for the rest of [his]121-basil life with the hideous memory of what [he]121-basil had done .

" Yes , "[121-basil] [he]121-basil continued , coming closer to [him]121-basil and looking steadfastly into [his]121-basil stern eyes , " [I]121-basil shall show [you]121-basil [my]121-basil soul . [You]121-basil shall see the thing that [you]121-basil fancy only [God]134-god can see . "[121-basil]

[Hallward]121-basil started back . " This is blasphemy , [Dorian]3109-dorian ! "[121-basil] [he]121-basil cried . " [You]3109-dorian must not say things like that . They are horrible , and they don t mean anything . "[121-basil]

" [You]121-basil think so ? "[121-basil] [He]121-basil laughed again .

" [I]121-basil know so . As for what [I]121-basil said to [you]121-basil to - night , [I]121-basil said it for [your]121-basil good . [You]121-basil know [I]121-basil have been always [a stanch friend to [you]121-basil]3110-a stanch friend to you . "[121-basil]

" Don t touch [me]121-basil . Finish what [you]121-basil have to say . "[121-basil]

A twisted flash of pain shot across [the painter]389-the painter s face . [He]121-basil paused for a moment , and a wild feeling of pity came over [him]121-basil . After all , what right had [he]121-basil to pry into the life of [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray ? If [he]121-basil had done a tithe of what was rumoured about [him]121-basil , how much [he]121-basil must have suffered ! Then [he]121-basil straightened [himself]121-basil up , and walked over to [the fire - place]1395-the fire - place , and stood there , looking at the burning logs with their frostlike ashes and their throbbing cores of flame .

" [I]1396-the young man am waiting , [Basil]121-basil , "[1396-the young man] said [the young man]1396-the young man in a hard clear voice .

[He]1396-the young man turned round . " What [I]1396-the young man have to say is this , "[1396-the young man] [he]1396-the young man cried . " [You]121-basil must give [me]1396-the young man some answer to these horrible charges that are made against [you]121-basil . If [you]121-basil tell [me]1396-the young man that they are absolutely untrue from beginning to end , [I]1396-the young man shall believe [you]121-basil . Deny [them]3111-them , [Dorian]117-dorian gray , deny [them]3111-them ! Can t [you]121-basil see what [I]1396-the young man am going through ? [[My]1396-the young man God]2467-my god ! don t tell [me]1396-the young man that [you]121-basil are bad , and corrupt , and shameful . "[1396-the young man]

[Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray smiled . There was a curl of contempt in [his]117-dorian gray lips . " Come [upstairs]676-upstairs , [Basil]121-basil , "[117-dorian gray] [he]117-dorian gray said quietly . " [I]117-dorian gray keep a diary of [my]117-dorian gray life from day to day , and it never leaves [the room in which it is written]3114-the room in which it is written . " [I]1396-the young man shall come with [you]121-basil , [Dorian]117-dorian gray , if [you]121-basil wish it .
