" That shall be given to [you]121-basil [upstairs]676-upstairs . [I]117-dorian gray could not give it here . [You]121-basil will not have to read long . "[117-dorian gray]

CHAPTER XIII .

[He]1397-he passed out of [the room]386-the room and began the ascent , [Basil Hallward]121-basil following close behind . [They]1399-they walked softly , as [men]2041-men do instinctively at night . The lamp cast fantastic shadows on the wall and staircase . A rising wind made some of the windows rattle .

When [they]1399-they reached [the top landing]1401-the top landing , [Dorian]117-dorian gray set the lamp down on the floor , and taking out the key , turned it in the lock . " [You]121-basil insist on knowing , [Basil]121-basil ? "[117-dorian gray] [he]117-dorian gray asked in a low voice .

" Yes . "[117-dorian gray]

" [I]117-dorian gray am delighted , "[117-dorian gray] [he]117-dorian gray answered , smiling . Then [he]117-dorian gray added , somewhat harshly , " [You]121-basil are [the one man in [the world]1908-the world]3117-the one man in the world who is entitled to know everything about [me]117-dorian gray . [You]121-basil have had more to do with [my]117-dorian gray life than [you]121-basil think "[117-dorian gray] ; and , taking up the lamp , [he]117-dorian gray opened the door and went in . A cold current of air passed [them]1399-they , and the light shot up for a moment in a flame of murky orange . [He]117-dorian gray shuddered . " Shut the door behind [you]121-basil , "[117-dorian gray] [he]117-dorian gray whispered , as [he]117-dorian gray placed the lamp on the table .

[Hallward]121-basil glanced round [him]117-dorian gray with a puzzled expression . [The room]386-the room looked as if [it]386-the room had not been lived in for years . A faded Flemish tapestry , a curtained picture , an old Italian _ cassone _ , and an almost empty book - case that was all that it seemed to contain , besides a chair and a table . As [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray was lighting a half - burned candle that was standing on the mantelshelf , [he]117-dorian gray saw that [the whole place]1403-the whole place was covered with dust and that the carpet was in holes . A mouse ran scuffling behind the wainscoting . There was a damp odour of mildew .

" So [you]121-basil think that it is only [God]134-god who sees the soul , [Basil]121-basil ? Draw that curtain back , and [you]121-basil will see [mine]121-basil . "[1396-the young man]

The voice that spoke was cold and cruel . " [You]117-dorian gray are mad , [Dorian]3119-dorian , or playing a part , "[121-basil] muttered [Hallward]121-basil , frowning .

" [You]117-dorian gray won t ? Then [I]1396-the young man must do it [myself]1396-the young man , "[1396-the young man] said [the young man]1396-the young man , and [he]1396-the young man tore the curtain from its rod and flung it on the ground .

An exclamation of horror broke from [the painter]389-the painter s lips as [he]117-dorian gray saw in the dim light the hideous face on the canvas grinning at [him]117-dorian gray . There was something in its expression that filled [him]117-dorian gray with disgust and loathing . Good heavens ! it was [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray s own face that [he]117-dorian gray was looking at ! The horror , whatever it was , had not yet entirely spoiled that marvellous beauty . There was still some gold in the thinning hair and some scarlet on the sensual mouth . The sodden eyes had kept something of the loveliness of [their]1406-their blue , the noble curves had not yet completely passed away from chiselled nostrils and from plastic throat . Yes , it was [Dorian]1407-dorian [himself]1407-dorian . But who had done it ? [He]1407-dorian seemed to recognize [his]1407-dorian own brushwork , and the frame was [his]1407-dorian own design . The idea was monstrous , yet [he]1407-dorian felt afraid . [He]1407-dorian seized the lighted candle , and held it to the picture . In the left - hand corner was [his]1407-dorian own name , traced in long letters of bright vermilion .

It was some foul parody , some infamous ignoble satire . [He]1407-dorian had never done that . Still , it was [his]1407-dorian own picture . [He]1407-dorian knew it , and [he]1407-dorian felt as if [his]1407-dorian blood had changed in a moment from fire to sluggish ice . [His]1407-dorian own picture ! What did it mean ? Why had it altered ? [He]1407-dorian turned and looked at [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray with the eyes of [a sick man]1408-a sick man . [His]117-dorian gray mouth twitched , and [his]117-dorian gray parched tongue seemed unable to articulate . [He]1407-dorian passed [his]1407-dorian hand across [his]1407-dorian forehead . It was dank with clammy sweat .

[The young man]1396-the young man was leaning against the mantelshelf , watching [him]117-dorian gray with that strange expression that [one]381-one sees on the faces of [those who are absorbed in a play]1411-those who are absorbed in a play when [some great artist]1412-some great artist is acting . There was neither real sorrow in it nor real joy . There was simply the passion of [the spectator]376-the spectator , with perhaps a flicker of triumph in [his]117-dorian gray eyes . [He]117-dorian gray had taken the flower out of [his]117-dorian gray coat , and was smelling it , or pretending to do so .

" What does this mean ? "[121-basil] cried [Hallward]121-basil , at last . [His]121-basil own voice sounded shrill and curious in [his]121-basil ears .

" Years ago , when [I]117-dorian gray was [a boy]754-a boy , "[117-dorian gray] said [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray , crushing the flower in [his]117-dorian gray hand , " [you]117-dorian gray met [me]117-dorian gray , flattered [me]117-dorian gray , and taught [me]117-dorian gray to be vain of [my]117-dorian gray good looks . One day [you]117-dorian gray introduced [me]117-dorian gray to [a friend of [yours]117-dorian gray]3055-a friend of yours , who explained to [me]117-dorian gray the wonder of youth , and [you]117-dorian gray finished a portrait of [me]117-dorian gray that revealed to [me]117-dorian gray the wonder of beauty . In a mad moment that , even now , [I]117-dorian gray don t know whether [I]117-dorian gray regret or not , [I]117-dorian gray made a wish , perhaps [you]117-dorian gray would call it a prayer .... "[117-dorian gray]

" [I]121-basil remember it ! Oh , how well [I]121-basil remember it ! No ! the thing is impossible . [The room]386-the room is damp . Mildew has got into the canvas . The paints [I]121-basil used had some wretched mineral poison in them . [I]121-basil tell [you]117-dorian gray the thing is impossible . "[121-basil]

" Ah , what is impossible ? "[1396-the young man] murmured [the young man]1396-the young man , going over to the window and leaning [his]1396-the young man forehead against the cold , mist - stained glass .

" [You]117-dorian gray told [me]117-dorian gray [you]117-dorian gray had destroyed it . "[117-dorian gray]

" [I]117-dorian gray was wrong . It has destroyed [me]117-dorian gray . "[117-dorian gray]

" [I]117-dorian gray don t believe it is [my]117-dorian gray picture . "[117-dorian gray]

" Can t [you]1415-dorian see [your]1415-dorian ideal in it ? "[1415-dorian] said [Dorian]1415-dorian bitterly .

" [My]117-dorian gray ideal , as [you]1415-dorian call it ... "[117-dorian gray]

" As [you]1415-dorian called it . "[117-dorian gray]

" There was nothing evil in it , nothing shameful . [You]117-dorian gray were to [me]117-dorian gray such an ideal as [I]117-dorian gray shall never meet again . This is the face of [a satyr]3123-a satyr . "[117-dorian gray]

" It is the face of [my]117-dorian gray soul . "[117-dorian gray]

" [Christ]224-christ ! what a thing [I]117-dorian gray must have worshipped ! It has the eyes of [a devil]3124-a devil . "[117-dorian gray]

" [Each of [us]3126-us]3125-each of us has [heaven]2562-heaven and hell in [him]3125-each of us , [Basil]121-basil , "[117-dorian gray] cried [Dorian]117-dorian gray with a wild gesture of despair .

[Hallward]121-basil turned again to the portrait and gazed at it . " [[My]121-basil God]2467-my god ! If it is true , "[121-basil] [he]121-basil exclaimed , " and this is what [you]121-basil have done with [your]121-basil life , why , [you]121-basil must be worse even than those who talk against [you]121-basil fancy [you]121-basil to be ! "[121-basil] [He]121-basil held the light up again to the canvas and examined it . The surface seemed to be quite undisturbed and as [he]121-basil had left it . It was from within , apparently , that the foulness and horror had come . Through some strange quickening of inner life the leprosies of sin were slowly eating the thing away . The rotting of a corpse in [a watery grave]1416-a watery grave was not so fearful .

[His]121-basil hand shook , and the candle fell from its socket on the floor and lay there sputtering . [He]121-basil placed [his]121-basil foot on it and put it out . Then [he]121-basil flung [himself]121-basil into the rickety chair that was standing by the table and buried [his]121-basil face in [his]121-basil hands .

" [Good God]134-god , [Dorian]117-dorian gray , what a lesson ! What an awful lesson ! "[1396-the young man] There was no answer , but [he]121-basil could hear [the young man]1396-the young man sobbing at the window . " Pray , [Dorian]3129-dorian , pray , "[121-basil] [he]121-basil murmured . " What is it that [one]381-one was taught to say in one s boyhood ? Lead [us]3131-us not into temptation . Forgive [us]3131-us [our]3131-us sins . Wash away [our]3131-us iniquities . Let [us]3131-us say that together . The prayer of [your]117-dorian gray pride has been answered . The prayer of [your]117-dorian gray repentance will be answered also . [I]121-basil worshipped [you]117-dorian gray too much . [I]121-basil am punished for it . [You]117-dorian gray worshipped [yourself]117-dorian gray too much . [We]3131-us are both punished . "[121-basil]

[Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray turned slowly around and looked at [him]117-dorian gray with tear - dimmed eyes . " It is too late , [Basil]121-basil , "[121-basil] [he]121-basil faltered .

" It is never too late , [Dorian]3132-dorian . Let [us]3131-us kneel down and try if [we]3131-us can not remember a prayer . Isn t there a verse somewhere , Though [your]117-dorian gray sins be as scarlet , yet [I]121-basil will make them as white as snow ? "[121-basil]

" Those words mean nothing to [me]117-dorian gray now . "[117-dorian gray]

" [Hush]308-hush ! Don t say that . [You]117-dorian gray have done enough evil in [your]117-dorian gray life . [[My]121-basil God]2467-my god ! Don t [you]117-dorian gray see that accursed thing leering at [us]3131-us ? "[121-basil]

[Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray glanced at the picture , and suddenly an uncontrollable feeling of hatred for [Basil Hallward]121-basil came over [him]117-dorian gray , as though it had been suggested to [him]117-dorian gray by the image on the canvas , whispered into [his]117-dorian gray ear by those grinning lips . The mad passions of a hunted animal stirred within [him]117-dorian gray , and [he]117-dorian gray loathed [the man who was seated at the table , more than in [his]117-dorian gray whole life [he]117-dorian gray had ever loathed anything]1418-the man who was seated at the table , more than in his whole life he had ever loathed anything . [He]117-dorian gray glanced wildly around . Something glimmered on the top of the painted chest that faced [him]117-dorian gray . [His]117-dorian gray eye fell on it . [He]117-dorian gray knew what it was . It was a knife that [he]117-dorian gray had brought up , some days before , to cut a piece of cord , and had forgotten to take away with [him]117-dorian gray . [He]117-dorian gray moved slowly towards it , passing [Hallward]121-basil as [he]117-dorian gray did so . As soon as [he]117-dorian gray got behind [him]117-dorian gray , [he]117-dorian gray seized it and turned round . [Hallward]121-basil stirred in [his]121-basil chair as if [he]121-basil was going to rise . [He]121-basil rushed at [him]121-basil and dug the knife into the great vein that is behind the ear , crushing [the man]2023-the man s head down on the table and stabbing again and again .

There was a stifled groan and the horrible sound of [some one]1960-some one choking with blood . Three times the outstretched arms shot up convulsively , waving grotesque , stiff - fingered hands in the air . [He]121-basil stabbed [him]2023-the man twice more , but [the man]2023-the man did not move . Something began to trickle on the floor . [He]117-dorian gray waited for a moment , still pressing the head down . Then [he]117-dorian gray threw the knife on the table , and listened .

[He]117-dorian gray could hear nothing , but the drip , drip on the threadbare carpet . [He]117-dorian gray opened the door and went out on [the landing]1422-the landing . [The house]425-the house was absolutely quiet . [No one]2310-no one was about . For a few seconds [he]117-dorian gray stood bending over the balustrade and peering down into the black seething well of darkness . Then [he]117-dorian gray took out the key and returned to [the room]386-the room , locking [himself]117-dorian gray in as [he]117-dorian gray did so .

The thing was still seated in the chair , straining over the table with bowed head , and humped back , and long fantastic arms . Had it not been for the red jagged tear in the neck and the clotted black pool that was slowly widening on the table , [one]381-one would have said that [the man]2023-the man was simply asleep .

How quickly it had all been done ! [He]117-dorian gray felt strangely calm , and walking over to the window , opened it and stepped out on [the balcony]834-the balcony . The wind had blown the fog away , and the sky was like a monstrous peacock s tail , starred with myriads of golden eyes . [He]117-dorian gray looked down and saw [the policeman]1429-the policeman going [his]1429-the policeman rounds and flashing the long beam of [his]1429-the policeman lantern on the doors of [the silent houses]1430-the silent houses . The crimson spot of a prowling hansom gleamed at the corner and then vanished . [A woman in a fluttering shawl]1431-a woman in a fluttering shawl was creeping slowly by the railings , staggering as [she]1431-a woman in a fluttering shawl went . Now and then [she]1431-a woman in a fluttering shawl stopped and peered back . Once , [she]1431-a woman in a fluttering shawl began to sing in a hoarse voice . [The policeman]1429-the policeman strolled over and said something to [her]1431-a woman in a fluttering shawl . [She]1431-a woman in a fluttering shawl stumbled away , laughing . A bitter blast swept across [the square]1433-the square . The gas - lamps flickered and became blue , and the leafless trees shook their black iron branches to and fro . [He]117-dorian gray shivered and went back , closing the window behind [him]117-dorian gray .

Having reached the door , [he]117-dorian gray turned the key and opened it . [He]117-dorian gray did not even glance at [the murdered man]1434-the murdered man . [He]117-dorian gray felt that the secret of the whole thing was not to realize the situation . [The friend who had painted the fatal portrait to which all [his]117-dorian gray misery had been due had gone out of [his]117-dorian gray life]1435-the friend who had painted the fatal portrait to which all his misery had been due had gone out of his life . That was enough .

Then [he]117-dorian gray remembered the lamp . It was a rather curious one of Moorish workmanship , made of dull silver inlaid with arabesques of burnished steel , and studded with coarse turquoises . Perhaps it might be missed by [[his]117-dorian gray servant]422-his servant , and questions would be asked . [He]117-dorian gray hesitated for a moment , then [he]117-dorian gray turned back and took it from the table . [He]117-dorian gray could not help seeing the dead thing . How still it was ! How horribly white the long hands looked ! It was like a dreadful wax image .

Having locked the door behind [him]117-dorian gray , [he]117-dorian gray crept quietly [downstairs]763-downstairs . The woodwork creaked and seemed to cry out as if in pain . [He]117-dorian gray stopped several times and waited . No : everything was still . It was merely the sound of [his]117-dorian gray own footsteps .

When [he]117-dorian gray reached [the library]887-the library , [he]117-dorian gray saw the bag and coat in the corner . They must be hidden away somewhere . [He]117-dorian gray unlocked a secret press that was in [the wainscoting]1439-the wainscoting , a press in which [he]117-dorian gray kept [his]117-dorian gray own curious disguises , and put them into it . [He]117-dorian gray could easily burn them afterwards . Then [he]117-dorian gray pulled out [his]117-dorian gray watch . It was twenty minutes to two .

[He]117-dorian gray sat down and began to think . Every year every month , [almost men]1440-almost men were strangled in [England]5-england for what [he]117-dorian gray had done . There had been a madness of murder in the air . [Some red star]1441-some red star had come too close to the earth .... And yet , what evidence was there against [him]117-dorian gray ? [Basil Hallward]121-basil had left [the house]425-the house at eleven . [No one]2310-no one had seen [him]121-basil come in again . [Most of [the servants]1445-the servants]1444-most of the servants were at [Selby Royal]38-selby royal . [[His]121-basil valet]509-his valet had gone to bed .... [Paris]13-paris ! Yes . It was to [Paris]13-paris that [Basil]121-basil had gone , and by [the midnight train]3012-the midnight train , as [he]121-basil had intended . With [his]117-dorian gray curious reserved habits , it would be months before any suspicions would be roused . Months ! Everything could be destroyed long before then .

A sudden thought struck [him]117-dorian gray . [He]117-dorian gray put on [his]117-dorian gray fur coat and hat and went out into [the hall]1025-the hall . There [he]117-dorian gray paused , hearing the slow heavy tread of [the policeman]1429-the policeman on [the pavement outside]1450-the pavement outside and seeing the flash of the bull s - eye reflected in the window . [He]117-dorian gray waited and held [his]117-dorian gray breath .

After a few moments [he]117-dorian gray drew back the latch and slipped out , shutting the door very gently behind [him]117-dorian gray . Then [he]117-dorian gray began ringing the bell . In about five minutes [[his]121-basil valet]509-his valet appeared , half - dressed and looking very drowsy .

" [I]117-dorian gray am sorry to have had to wake [you]3134-you up , [Francis]269-francis , "[117-dorian gray] [he]117-dorian gray said , stepping in ; " but [I]117-dorian gray had forgotten [my]117-dorian gray latch - key . What time is it ? "[117-dorian gray]

" Ten minutes past two , [sir]2063-sir , "[1452-the man , looking at the clock and blinking] answered [the man , looking at the clock and blinking]1452-the man , looking at the clock and blinking .

" Ten minutes past two ? How horribly late ! [You]3134-you must wake [me]2023-the man at nine to - morrow . [I]2023-the man have some work to do . "[2023-the man]

" All right , [sir]2063-sir . "[2023-the man]

" Did [any one]1934-any one call this evening ? "[2023-the man]

" [Mr. Hallward]125-mr. hallward , [sir]2063-sir . [He]125-mr. hallward stayed [here]2327-here till eleven , and then [he]125-mr. hallward went away to catch [his]125-mr. hallward train . "[2023-the man]

" Oh ! [I]2023-the man am sorry [I]2023-the man didn t see [him]125-mr. hallward . Did [he]125-mr. hallward leave any message ? "[2023-the man]

" No , [sir]2063-sir , except that [he]125-mr. hallward would write to [you]2063-sir from [Paris]13-paris , if [he]125-mr. hallward did not find [you]2063-sir at [the club]2210-the club . "[2023-the man]

" That will do , [Francis]269-francis . Don t forget to call [me]2023-the man at nine to - morrow . "[2023-the man]

" No , [sir]2063-sir . "[2023-the man]

[The man]2023-the man shambled down [the passage]1454-the passage in [his]2023-the man slippers .

[Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray threw [his]117-dorian gray hat and coat upon the table and passed into [the library]887-the library . For a quarter of an hour [he]117-dorian gray walked up and down [the room]386-the room , biting [his]117-dorian gray lip and thinking . Then [he]117-dorian gray took down the Blue Book from one of the shelves and began to turn over the leaves . " [Alan Campbell]309-alan , [152]3143-152 , [Hertford Street]94-hertford street , [Mayfair]24-mayfair . "[117-dorian gray] Yes ; that was [the man [he]117-dorian gray wanted]1457-the man he wanted .

CHAPTER XIV .

At nine o clock the next morning [[his]117-dorian gray servant]422-his servant came in with a cup of chocolate on a tray and opened the shutters . [Dorian]1459-dorian was sleeping quite peacefully , lying on [his]1459-dorian right side , with one hand underneath [his]1459-dorian cheek . [He]1459-dorian looked like [a boy who had been tired out with play , or study]1460-a boy who had been tired out with play , or study .

[The man]2023-the man had to touch [him]1459-dorian twice on the shoulder before [he]1459-dorian woke , and as [he]1459-dorian opened [his]1459-dorian eyes a faint smile passed across [his]1459-dorian lips , as though [he]1459-dorian had been lost in some delightful dream . Yet [he]1459-dorian had not dreamed at all . [His]1459-dorian night had been untroubled by any images of pleasure or of pain . But [youth]630-youth smiles without any reason . It is one of its chiefest charms .

[He]1459-dorian turned round , and leaning upon [his]1459-dorian elbow , began to sip [his]1459-dorian chocolate . The mellow November sun came streaming into [the room]386-the room . The sky was bright , and there was a genial warmth in the air . It was almost like a morning in May.

Gradually the events of the preceding night crept with silent , blood - stained feet into [his]1459-dorian brain and reconstructed themselves there with terrible distinctness . [He]1459-dorian winced at the memory of all that [he]1459-dorian had suffered , and for a moment the same curious feeling of loathing for [Basil Hallward]121-basil that had made [him]1459-dorian kill [him]1459-dorian as [he]1459-dorian sat in the chair came back to [him]1459-dorian , and [he]1459-dorian grew cold with passion . [The dead man]1320-the dead man was still sitting there , too , and in the sunlight now . How horrible that was ! Such hideous things were for the darkness , not for the day .

[He]1459-dorian felt that if [he]1459-dorian brooded on what [he]1459-dorian had gone through [he]1459-dorian would sicken or grow mad . There were [sins whose fascination was more in the memory]1465-sins whose fascination was more in the memory than in the doing of [them]1465-sins whose fascination was more in the memory , strange triumphs that gratified the pride more than the passions , and gave to [the intellect]2383-the intellect a quickened sense of joy , greater than any joy [they]2383-the intellect brought , or could ever bring , to the senses . But this was not one of them . It was a thing to be driven out of the mind , to be drugged with poppies , to be strangled lest it might strangle one [itself]1467-itself .

When the half - hour struck , [he]1459-dorian passed [his]1459-dorian hand across [his]1459-dorian forehead , and then got up hastily and dressed [himself]1459-dorian with even more than [his]1459-dorian usual care , giving a good deal of attention to the choice of [his]1459-dorian necktie and scarf - pin and changing [his]1459-dorian rings more than once . [He]1459-dorian spent a long time also over breakfast , tasting the various dishes , talking to [[his]1459-dorian valet]509-his valet about some new liveries that [he]1459-dorian was thinking of getting made for [the servants at [Selby]16-selby]1469-the servants at selby , and going through [his]1459-dorian correspondence . At some of the letters , [he]1459-dorian smiled . Three of them bored [him]1459-dorian . One [he]1459-dorian read several times over and then tore up with a slight look of annoyance in [his]1459-dorian face . " That awful thing , [a woman]2360-a woman s memory ! "[1459-dorian] as [Lord Henry]120-lord henry had once said .

After [he]1459-dorian had drunk [his]1459-dorian cup of black coffee , [he]1459-dorian wiped [his]1459-dorian lips slowly with a napkin , motioned to [[his]1459-dorian servant]422-his servant to wait , and going over to the table , sat down and wrote two letters . One [he]1459-dorian put in [his]1459-dorian pocket , the other [he]1459-dorian handed to [the valet]1471-the valet .

" Take this round to 152 , [Hertford Street]94-hertford street , [Francis]269-francis , and if [Mr. Campbell]310-mr. campbell is out of [town]1935-town , get [his]310-mr. campbell address . "[1459-dorian]

As soon as [he]1459-dorian was alone , [he]1459-dorian lit a cigarette and began sketching upon a piece of paper , drawing first flowers and bits of architecture , and then human faces . Suddenly [he]1459-dorian remarked that every face that [he]1459-dorian drew seemed to have a fantastic likeness to [Basil Hallward]121-basil . [He]1459-dorian frowned , and getting up , went over to the book - case and took out a volume at hazard . [He]1459-dorian was determined that [he]1459-dorian would not think about what had happened until it became absolutely necessary that [he]1459-dorian should do so .

When [he]1459-dorian had stretched [himself]1459-dorian on the sofa , [he]1459-dorian looked at the title - page of the book . It was [Gautier]208-gautier s " maux et Cam es "[311-charpentier] , [Charpentier]311-charpentier s Japanese - paper edition , with the Jacquemart etching . The binding was of citron - green leather , with a design of gilt trellis - work and dotted pomegranates . It had been given to [him]1459-dorian by [Adrian Singleton]211-adrian singleton . As [he]1459-dorian turned over the pages , [his]1459-dorian eye fell on the poem about the hand of [Lacenaire]312-lacenaire , the cold yellow hand " _ du supplice encore mal lav e _ , "[1459-dorian] with its downy red hairs and its " _ doigts de faune _ . "[1459-dorian] [He]1459-dorian glanced at [his]1459-dorian own white taper fingers , shuddering slightly in spite of [himself]1459-dorian , and passed on , till [he]1459-dorian came to those lovely stanzas upon [Venice]95-venice :

Sur une gamme chromatique , Le sein de [perles ruisselant]0-perles ruisselant , [La V nus de l Adriatique Sort de l eau son corps rose et blanc]1472-la v nus de l adriatique sort de l eau son corps rose et blanc .

Les d mes , sur l azur des ondes Suivant la phrase au pur contour , S enflent comme des gorges rondes Que soul ve un soupir d amour .

L esquif aborde et [me]0-perles ruisselant d pose , Jetant son amarre au pilier , Devant une fa ade rose , Sur le marbre d un escalier .

How exquisite they were ! As one read them , [one]381-one seemed to be floating down the green water - ways of the pink and pearl city , seated in a black gondola with silver prow and trailing curtains . The mere lines looked to [him]1459-dorian like those straight lines of turquoise - blue that follow one as one pushes out to [the Lido]97-the lido . The sudden flashes of colour reminded [him]1459-dorian of the gleam of the opal - and - iris - throated birds that flutter round the tall honeycombed Campanile , or stalk , with such stately grace , through the dim , dust - stained arcades . Leaning back with half - closed eyes , [he]1459-dorian kept saying over and over to [himself]1459-dorian :

" Devant une fa ade rose , Sur le marbre d un escalier . "[1459-dorian]

The whole of [Venice]95-venice was in those two lines . [He]1459-dorian remembered the autumn that [he]1459-dorian had passed [there]1904-there , and a wonderful love that had stirred [him]1459-dorian to mad delightful follies . There was romance in [every place]1475-every place . But [Venice]95-venice , like [Oxford]4-oxford , had kept the background for romance , and , to the true romantic , background was everything , or almost everything . [Basil]121-basil had been with [him]1459-dorian part of the time , and had gone wild over [Tintoret]98-tintoret . Poor [Basil]121-basil ! What a horrible way for [a man to die]1476-a man to die !

[He]1459-dorian sighed , and took up the volume again , and tried to forget . [He]1459-dorian read of the swallows that fly in and out of [the little _ caf]1477-the little _ caf _ at [Smyrna]99-smyrna where [the Hadjis]313-the hadjis sit counting [their]313-the hadjis amber beads and [the turbaned merchants]1478-the turbaned merchants smoke [their]1478-the turbaned merchants long tasselled pipes and talk gravely to [each other]1942-each other ; [he]1459-dorian read of [the Obelisk]1480-the obelisk in [the Place de la Concorde]1481-the place de la concorde that weeps tears of granite in [its]1480-the obelisk lonely sunless exile and longs to be back by [the hot , lotus - covered Nile]1482-the hot , lotus - covered nile , where there are [Sphinxes]314-sphinxes , and rose - red ibises , and white vultures with gilded claws , and crocodiles with small beryl eyes that crawl over the green steaming mud ; [he]1459-dorian began to brood over those verses which , drawing music from kiss - stained marble , tell of that curious statue that [Gautier]208-gautier compares to a contralto voice , the " _ monstre charmant _ "[1459-dorian] that couches in [the porphyry - room of the Louvre]1483-the porphyry - room of the louvre . But after a time the book fell from [his]1459-dorian hand . [He]1459-dorian grew nervous , and a horrible fit of terror came over [him]1459-dorian . What if [Alan Campbell]309-alan should be out of [England]5-england ? Days would elapse before [he]309-alan could come back . Perhaps [he]309-alan might refuse to come . What could [he]309-alan do then ? Every moment was of vital importance .

[They]1484-they had been [great friends]1485-great friends once , five years before almost inseparable , indeed . Then the intimacy had come suddenly to an end . When [they]1484-they met in society now , it was only [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray who smiled : [Alan Campbell]309-alan never did .

[He]309-alan was [an extremely clever young man]1486-an extremely clever young man , though [he]309-alan had no real appreciation of the visible arts , and whatever little sense of the beauty of poetry [he]309-alan possessed [he]309-alan had gained entirely from [Dorian]117-dorian gray . [His]309-alan dominant intellectual passion was for science . At [Cambridge]100-cambridge [he]309-alan had spent a great deal of [his]309-alan time working in [the laboratory]1487-the laboratory , and had taken a good class in the Natural Science Tripos of [his]309-alan year . Indeed , [he]309-alan was still devoted to the study of chemistry , and had [a laboratory of [his]309-alan own in which [he]309-alan used to shut [himself]309-alan up all day long]1488-a laboratory of his own in which he used to shut himself up all day long , greatly to the annoyance of [[his]309-alan mother]2191-his mother , who had set [her]2191-his mother heart on [his]309-alan standing for Parliament and had a vague idea that [a chemist]1490-a chemist was [a person who made up prescriptions]1491-a person who made up prescriptions . [He]309-alan was [an excellent musician]1492-an excellent musician , however , as well , and played both the violin and the piano better than [most amateurs]1493-most amateurs . In fact , it was music that had first brought [him]309-alan and [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray together music and that indefinable attraction that [Dorian]117-dorian gray seemed to be able to exercise whenever [he]117-dorian gray wished and , indeed , exercised often without being conscious of it . [They]1494-they had met at [Lady Berkshire]315-lady berkshire s the night that [Rubinstein]316-rubinstein played [there]1904-there , and after that used to be always seen together at [the opera]959-the opera and wherever good music was going on . For eighteen months [their]1494-they intimacy lasted . [Campbell]309-alan was always either at [Selby Royal]38-selby royal or in [Grosvenor Square]88-grosvenor square . To [him]309-alan , as to [many others]1497-many others , [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray was the type of everything that is wonderful and fascinating in life . Whether or not a quarrel had taken place between [them]1494-they [no one]2310-no one ever knew . But suddenly [people]1933-people remarked that [they]1933-people scarcely spoke when [they]1933-people met and that [Campbell]309-alan seemed always to go away early from any party at which [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray was present . [He]117-dorian gray had changed , too was strangely melancholy at times , appeared almost to dislike hearing music , and would never [himself]117-dorian gray play , giving as [his]117-dorian gray excuse , when [he]117-dorian gray was called upon , that [he]117-dorian gray was so absorbed in science that [he]117-dorian gray had no time left in which to practise . And this was certainly true . Every day [he]117-dorian gray seemed to become more interested in biology , and [his]117-dorian gray name appeared once or twice in some of the scientific reviews in connection with certain curious experiments .

This was [the man [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray]1500-the man dorian gray was waiting for . Every second [he]117-dorian gray kept glancing at the clock . As the minutes went by [he]117-dorian gray became horribly agitated . At last [he]117-dorian gray got up and began to pace up and down [the room]386-the room , looking like a beautiful caged thing . [He]117-dorian gray took long stealthy strides . [His]117-dorian gray hands were curiously cold .

The suspense became unbearable . Time seemed to [him]117-dorian gray to be crawling with feet of lead , while [he]117-dorian gray by monstrous winds was being swept towards the jagged edge of [some black cleft of precipice]1502-some black cleft of precipice . [He]117-dorian gray knew what was waiting for [him]117-dorian gray there ; saw it , indeed , and , shuddering , crushed with dank hands [his]117-dorian gray burning lids as though [he]117-dorian gray would have robbed the very brain of sight and driven the eyeballs back into [[their]1503-their cave]1504-their cave . It was useless . The brain had its own food on which it battened , and the imagination , made grotesque by terror , twisted and distorted as a living thing by pain , danced like [some foul puppet on a stand and grinned through moving masks]1505-some foul puppet on a stand and grinned through moving masks . Then , suddenly , time stopped for [him]117-dorian gray . Yes : [that blind , slow - breathing thing]1506-that blind , slow - breathing thing crawled no more , and horrible thoughts , time being dead , raced nimbly on in front , and dragged a hideous future from its grave , and showed it to [him]117-dorian gray . [He]117-dorian gray stared at it . Its very horror made [him]117-dorian gray stone .

At last the door opened and [[his]117-dorian gray servant]422-his servant entered . [He]422-his servant turned glazed eyes upon [him]117-dorian gray .

" [Mr. Campbell]310-mr. campbell , [sir]2063-sir , "[2023-the man] said [the man]2023-the man .

A sigh of relief broke from [his]117-dorian gray parched lips , and the colour came back to [his]117-dorian gray cheeks .

" Ask [him]422-his servant to come in at once , [Francis]269-francis . "[117-dorian gray] [He]117-dorian gray felt that [he]117-dorian gray was [himself]117-dorian gray again . [His]117-dorian gray mood of cowardice had passed away .

[The man]2023-the man bowed and retired . In a few moments , [Alan Campbell]309-alan walked in , looking very stern and rather pale , [his]309-alan pallor being intensified by [his]309-alan coal - black hair and dark eyebrows .

" [Alan]309-alan ! This is kind of [you]309-alan . [I]2023-the man thank [you]309-alan for coming . "[2023-the man]

" [I]309-alan had intended never to enter [[your]309-alan house]3050-your house again , [Gray]117-dorian gray . But [you]309-alan said it was a matter of life and death . "[309-alan] [His]309-alan voice was hard and cold . [He]309-alan spoke with slow deliberation . There was a look of contempt in the steady searching gaze that [he]309-alan turned on [Dorian]117-dorian gray . [He]309-alan kept [his]309-alan hands in the pockets of [his]309-alan Astrakhan coat , and seemed not to have noticed the gesture with which [he]309-alan had been greeted .

" Yes : it is a matter of life and death , [Alan]309-alan , and to [more than one person]3148-more than one person . Sit down . "[117-dorian gray]

[Campbell]309-alan took a chair by the table , and [Dorian]117-dorian gray sat opposite to [him]309-alan . [The two men]479-the two men s eyes met . In [Dorian]117-dorian gray s there was infinite pity . [He]117-dorian gray knew that what [he]117-dorian gray was going to do was dreadful .

After a strained moment of silence , [he]117-dorian gray leaned across and said , very quietly , but watching the effect of each word upon the face of [him]117-dorian gray [he]117-dorian gray had sent for , " [Alan]309-alan , in [a locked room at the top of [this house]3150-this house]3149-a locked room at the top of this house , [a room to which [nobody]3108-nobody but [myself]117-dorian gray has access]3151-a room to which nobody but myself has access , [a dead man]3153-a dead man is seated at a table . [He]3153-a dead man has been dead ten hours now . Don t stir , and don t look at [me]117-dorian gray like that . Who [the man]2023-the man is , why [he]3153-a dead man died , how [he]3153-a dead man died , are matters that do not concern [you]309-alan . What [you]309-alan have to do is this "[117-dorian gray]

" Stop , [Gray]117-dorian gray . [I]117-dorian gray don t want to know anything further . Whether what [you]309-alan have told [me]117-dorian gray is true or not true doesn t concern [me]117-dorian gray . [I]117-dorian gray entirely decline to be mixed up in [your]309-alan life . Keep [your]309-alan horrible secrets to [yourself]309-alan . [They]3155-they don t interest [me]117-dorian gray any more . "[117-dorian gray]

" [Alan]309-alan , [they]3155-they will have to interest [you]309-alan . [This one]3156-this one will have to interest [you]309-alan . [I]117-dorian gray am awfully sorry for [you]309-alan , [Alan]309-alan . But [I]117-dorian gray can t help [myself]117-dorian gray . [You]309-alan are [the one man who is able to save [me]117-dorian gray]3157-the one man who is able to save me . [I]117-dorian gray am forced to bring [you]309-alan into the matter . [I]117-dorian gray have no option . [Alan]309-alan , [you]309-alan are scientific . [You]309-alan know about chemistry and things of that kind . [You]309-alan have made experiments . What [you]309-alan have got to do is to destroy the thing that is upstairs to destroy it so that not a vestige of it will be left . [Nobody]3108-nobody saw [this person]3159-this person come into [the house]425-the house . Indeed , at the present moment [he]3159-this person is supposed to be in [Paris]13-paris . [He]3159-this person will not be missed for months . When [he]3159-this person is missed , there must be no trace of [him]3159-this person found [here]2327-here . [You]309-alan , [Alan]309-alan , [you]309-alan must change [him]3159-this person , and everything that belongs to [him]3159-this person , into a handful of ashes that [I]117-dorian gray may scatter in the air . "[117-dorian gray]

" [You]309-alan are mad , [Dorian]3162-dorian . "[117-dorian gray]

" Ah ! [I]117-dorian gray was waiting for [you]309-alan to call [me]117-dorian gray [Dorian]3163-dorian . "[117-dorian gray]

" [You]309-alan are mad , [I]117-dorian gray tell [you]309-alan mad to imagine that [I]117-dorian gray would raise a finger to help [you]309-alan , mad to make this monstrous confession . [I]117-dorian gray will have nothing to do with this matter , whatever it is . Do [you]309-alan think [I]117-dorian gray am going to peril [my]117-dorian gray reputation for [you]309-alan ? What is it to [me]117-dorian gray what devil s work [you]309-alan are up to ? "[117-dorian gray]

" It was suicide , [Alan]309-alan . "[117-dorian gray]

" [I]117-dorian gray am glad of that . But who drove [him]117-dorian gray to it ? [You]309-alan , [I]117-dorian gray should fancy . "[117-dorian gray]

" Do [you]309-alan still refuse to do this for [me]117-dorian gray ? "[117-dorian gray]

" Of course [I]117-dorian gray refuse . [I]117-dorian gray will have absolutely nothing to do with it . [I]117-dorian gray don t care what shame comes on [you]309-alan . [You]309-alan deserve it all . [I]117-dorian gray should not be sorry to see [you]309-alan disgraced , publicly disgraced . How dare [you]309-alan ask [me]117-dorian gray , of [all men in [the world]1908-the world]3164-all men in the world , to mix [myself]117-dorian gray up in this horror ? [I]117-dorian gray should have thought [you]309-alan knew more about [people s characters]3166-people s characters . [[Your]309-alan friend]2051-your friend [Lord Henry Wotton]120-lord henry can t have taught [you]309-alan much about psychology , whatever else [he]2051-your friend has taught [you]309-alan . Nothing will induce [me]117-dorian gray to stir a step to help [you]309-alan . [You]309-alan have come to [the wrong man]3168-the wrong man . Go to [some of [[your]309-alan friends]2140-your friends]2511-some of your friends . Don t come to [me]117-dorian gray . "[117-dorian gray]

" [Alan]309-alan , it was murder . [I]117-dorian gray killed [him]3168-the wrong man . [You]309-alan don t know what [he]3168-the wrong man had made [me]117-dorian gray suffer . Whatever [my]117-dorian gray life is , [he]3168-the wrong man had more to do with the making or the marring of it than poor [Harry]120-lord henry has had . [He]3168-the wrong man may not have intended it , the result was the same . "[117-dorian gray]

" Murder ! [Good God]134-god , [Dorian]117-dorian gray , is that what [you]117-dorian gray have come to ? [I]117-dorian gray shall not inform upon [you]117-dorian gray . It is not [my]117-dorian gray business . Besides , without [my]117-dorian gray stirring in the matter , [you]117-dorian gray are certain to be arrested . [Nobody]3108-nobody ever commits a crime without doing something stupid . But [I]117-dorian gray will have nothing to do with it . "[117-dorian gray]

" [You]117-dorian gray must have something to do with it . Wait , wait a moment ; listen to [me]117-dorian gray . Only listen , [Alan]309-alan . All [I]117-dorian gray ask of [you]117-dorian gray is to perform a certain scientific experiment . [You]117-dorian gray go to [hospitals]3172-hospitals and [dead - houses]3173-dead - houses , and the horrors that [you]117-dorian gray do there don t affect [you]117-dorian gray . If in [some hideous dissecting - room]3174-some hideous dissecting - room or [fetid laboratory]3175-fetid laboratory [you]117-dorian gray found [this man]2580-this man lying on a leaden table with red gutters scooped out in it for the blood to flow through , [you]117-dorian gray would simply look upon [him]2580-this man as an admirable subject . [You]117-dorian gray would not turn a hair . [You]117-dorian gray would not believe that [you]117-dorian gray were doing anything wrong . On the contrary , [you]117-dorian gray would probably feel that [you]117-dorian gray were benefiting [the human race]3177-the human race , or increasing the sum of knowledge in [the world]1908-the world , or gratifying intellectual curiosity , or something of that kind . What [I]117-dorian gray want [you]117-dorian gray to do is merely what [you]117-dorian gray have often done before . Indeed , to destroy a body must be far less horrible than what [you]117-dorian gray are accustomed to work at . And , remember , it is the only piece of evidence against [me]117-dorian gray . If it is discovered , [I]117-dorian gray am lost ; and it is sure to be discovered unless [you]117-dorian gray help [me]117-dorian gray . "[117-dorian gray]

" [I]117-dorian gray have no desire to help [you]117-dorian gray . [You]117-dorian gray forget that . [I]117-dorian gray am simply indifferent to the whole thing . It has nothing to do with [me]117-dorian gray . "[117-dorian gray]

" [Alan]309-alan , [I]117-dorian gray entreat [you]309-alan . Think of the position [I]117-dorian gray am in . Just before [you]309-alan came [I]117-dorian gray almost fainted with terror . [You]117-dorian gray may know terror [yourself]117-dorian gray some day . No ! don t think of that . Look at the matter purely from the scientific point of view . [You]117-dorian gray don t inquire where the dead things on which [you]117-dorian gray experiment come from . Don t inquire now . [I]117-dorian gray have told [you]309-alan too much as it is . But [I]117-dorian gray beg of [you]309-alan to do this . [We]3179-we were [friends]1988-friends once , [Alan]309-alan . "[117-dorian gray]

" Don t speak about those days , [Dorian]3181-dorian [they]3181-dorian are dead . "[117-dorian gray]

" [The dead]1007-the dead linger sometimes . [The man upstairs]3183-the man upstairs will not go away . [He]3183-the man upstairs is sitting at the table with bowed head and outstretched arms . [Alan]309-alan ! [Alan]309-alan ! If [you]309-alan don t come to [my]117-dorian gray assistance , [I]117-dorian gray am ruined . Why , [they]3181-dorian will hang [me]117-dorian gray , [Alan]309-alan ! Don t [you]309-alan understand ? [They]3181-dorian will hang [me]117-dorian gray for what [I]117-dorian gray have done . "[117-dorian gray]

" There is no good in prolonging this scene . [I]117-dorian gray absolutely refuse to do anything in the matter . It is insane of [you]309-alan to ask [me]117-dorian gray . "[117-dorian gray]

" [You]117-dorian gray refuse ? "[117-dorian gray]

" Yes . "[117-dorian gray]

" [I]117-dorian gray entreat [you]309-alan , [Alan]309-alan . "[117-dorian gray]

" It is useless . "[117-dorian gray]

The same look of pity came into [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray s eyes . Then [he]117-dorian gray stretched out [his]117-dorian gray hand , took a piece of paper , and wrote something on it . [He]117-dorian gray read it over twice , folded it carefully , and pushed it across the table . Having done this , [he]117-dorian gray got up and went over to the window .

[Campbell]309-alan looked at [him]117-dorian gray in surprise , and then took up the paper , and opened it . As [he]309-alan read it , [his]309-alan face became ghastly pale and [he]309-alan fell back in [his]309-alan chair . A horrible sense of sickness came over [him]309-alan . [He]309-alan felt as if [his]309-alan heart was beating itself to death in some empty hollow .

After two or three minutes of terrible silence , [Dorian]117-dorian gray turned round and came and stood behind [him]309-alan , putting [his]117-dorian gray hand upon [his]309-alan shoulder .

" [I]117-dorian gray am so sorry for [you]309-alan , [Alan]309-alan , "[117-dorian gray] [he]117-dorian gray murmured , " but [you]309-alan leave [me]117-dorian gray no alternative . [I]117-dorian gray have a letter written already . Here it is . [You]309-alan see the address . If [you]309-alan don t help [me]117-dorian gray , [I]117-dorian gray must send it . If [you]309-alan don t help [me]117-dorian gray , [I]117-dorian gray will send it . [You]309-alan know what the result will be . But [you]309-alan are going to help [me]117-dorian gray . It is impossible for [you]309-alan to refuse now . [I]117-dorian gray tried to spare [you]309-alan . [You]309-alan will do [me]117-dorian gray the justice to admit that . [You]309-alan were stern , harsh , offensive . [You]309-alan treated [me]117-dorian gray as [no man]2631-no man has ever dared to treat [me]117-dorian gray [no living man]3185-no living man , at any rate . [I]117-dorian gray bore it all . Now it is for [me]117-dorian gray to dictate terms . "[117-dorian gray]

[Campbell]309-alan buried [his]309-alan face in [his]309-alan hands , and a shudder passed through [him]309-alan .

" Yes , it is [my]309-alan turn to dictate terms , [Alan]309-alan . [You]309-alan know what they are . The thing is quite simple . Come , don t work [yourself]309-alan into this fever . The thing has to be done . Face it , and do it . "[309-alan]

A groan broke from [Campbell]309-alan s lips and [he]309-alan shivered all over . The ticking of the clock on the mantelpiece seemed to [him]309-alan to be dividing time into separate atoms of agony , each of which was too terrible to be borne . [He]309-alan felt as if an iron ring was being slowly tightened round [his]309-alan forehead , as if the disgrace with which [he]309-alan was threatened had already come upon [him]309-alan . The hand upon [his]309-alan shoulder weighed like a hand of lead . It was intolerable . It seemed to crush [him]309-alan .

" Come , [Alan]309-alan , [you]309-alan must decide at once . "[309-alan]

" [I]309-alan can not do it , "[309-alan] [he]309-alan said , mechanically , as though words could alter things .

" [You]309-alan must . [You]309-alan have no choice . Don t delay . "[309-alan]

[He]309-alan hesitated a moment . " Is there a fire in [the room]386-the room [upstairs]676-upstairs ? "[309-alan]

" Yes , there is a gas - fire with asbestos . "[309-alan]

" [I]309-alan shall have to go [home]2087-home and get some things from [the laboratory]1487-the laboratory . "[309-alan]

" No , [Alan]309-alan , [you]309-alan must not leave [the house]425-the house . Write out on a sheet of notepaper what [you]309-alan want and [[my]309-alan servant]2935-my servant will take [a cab]3192-a cab and bring the things back to [you]309-alan . "[309-alan]

[Campbell]309-alan scrawled a few lines , blotted them , and addressed an envelope to [[his]309-alan assistant]1023-his assistant . [Dorian]1512-dorian took the note up and read it carefully . Then [he]309-alan rang the bell and gave it to [[his]309-alan valet]509-his valet , with orders to return as soon as possible and to bring the things with [him]309-alan .

As [the hall]1025-the hall door shut , [Campbell]309-alan started nervously , and having got up from the chair , went over to the chimney - piece . [He]309-alan was shivering with a kind of ague . For nearly twenty minutes , [neither of [the men]2198-the men]1515-neither of the men spoke . A fly buzzed noisily about [the room]386-the room , and the ticking of the clock was like the beat of a hammer .

As the chime struck one , [Campbell]309-alan turned round , and looking at [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray , saw that [his]309-alan eyes were filled with tears . There was something in the purity and refinement of that sad face that seemed to enrage [him]309-alan . " [You]117-dorian gray are infamous , absolutely infamous ! "[309-alan] [he]309-alan muttered .

" Hush , [Alan]309-alan . [You]117-dorian gray have saved [my]117-dorian gray life , "[117-dorian gray] said [Dorian]117-dorian gray .

" [Your]117-dorian gray life ? Good heavens ! what a life that is ! [You]117-dorian gray have gone from corruption to corruption , and now [you]117-dorian gray have culminated in crime . In doing what [I]309-alan am going to do what [you]117-dorian gray force [me]309-alan to do it is not of [your]117-dorian gray life that [I]309-alan am thinking . "[309-alan]

" Ah , [Alan]309-alan , "[117-dorian gray] murmured [Dorian]117-dorian gray with a sigh , " [I]117-dorian gray wish [you]309-alan had a thousandth part of the pity for [me]117-dorian gray that [I]117-dorian gray have for [you]309-alan . "[117-dorian gray] [He]117-dorian gray turned away as [he]117-dorian gray spoke and stood looking out at [the garden]384-the garden . [Campbell]309-alan made no answer .

After about ten minutes a knock came to the door , and [the servant]1519-the servant entered , carrying a large mahogany chest of chemicals , with a long coil of steel and platinum wire and two rather curiously shaped iron clamps .

" Shall [I]309-alan leave the things here , [sir]2063-sir ? "[309-alan] [he]309-alan asked [Campbell]309-alan .

" Yes , "[117-dorian gray] said [Dorian]117-dorian gray . " And [I]117-dorian gray am afraid , [Francis]269-francis , that [I]117-dorian gray have another errand for [you]309-alan . What is the name of [the man at [Richmond]101-richmond who supplies [Selby]16-selby with orchids]3194-the man at richmond who supplies selby with orchids ? "[117-dorian gray]

" [Harden]317-harden , [sir]2063-sir . "[309-alan]

" Yes [Harden]317-harden . [You]309-alan must go down to [Richmond]101-richmond at once , see [Harden]317-harden personally , and tell [him]317-harden to send twice as many orchids as [I]117-dorian gray ordered , and to have as few white ones as possible . In fact , [I]117-dorian gray don t want any white ones . It is a lovely day , [Francis]269-francis , and [Richmond]101-richmond is a very pretty place otherwise [I]117-dorian gray wouldn t bother [you]309-alan about it . "[117-dorian gray]

" No trouble , [sir]2063-sir . At what time shall [I]309-alan be back ? "[309-alan]

[Dorian]117-dorian gray looked at [Campbell]309-alan . " How long will [your]309-alan experiment take , [Alan]309-alan ? "[309-alan] [he]309-alan said in a calm indifferent voice . The presence of [a third person]1520-a third person in [the room]386-the room seemed to give [him]309-alan extraordinary courage .

[Campbell]309-alan frowned and bit [his]309-alan lip . " It will take about five hours , "[309-alan] [he]309-alan answered .

" It will be time enough , then , if [you]309-alan are back at half - past seven , [Francis]269-francis . Or stay : just leave [my]1520-a third person things out for dressing . [You]309-alan can have the evening to [yourself]309-alan . [I]1520-a third person am not dining at [home]2087-home , so [I]1520-a third person shall not want [you]309-alan . "[1520-a third person]

" Thank [you]309-alan , [sir]2063-sir , "[2023-the man] said [the man]2023-the man , leaving [the room]386-the room .

" Now , [Alan]309-alan , there is not a moment to be lost . How heavy this chest is ! [I]2023-the man ll take it for [you]309-alan . [You]309-alan bring the other things . "[2023-the man] [He]2023-the man spoke rapidly and in an authoritative manner . [Campbell]309-alan felt dominated by [him]2023-the man . [They]1524-they left [the room]386-the room together .

When [they]1524-they reached [the top landing]1401-the top landing , [Dorian]117-dorian gray took out the key and turned it in the lock . Then [he]117-dorian gray stopped , and a troubled look came into [his]117-dorian gray eyes . [He]117-dorian gray shuddered . " [I]117-dorian gray don t think [I]117-dorian gray can go in , [Alan]309-alan , "[117-dorian gray] [he]117-dorian gray murmured .

" It is nothing to [me]309-alan . [I]309-alan don t require [you]309-alan , "[309-alan] said [Campbell]309-alan coldly .

[Dorian]1527-dorian half opened the door . As [he]1527-dorian did so , [he]1527-dorian saw the face of [his]1527-dorian portrait leering in the sunlight . On the floor in front of it the torn curtain was lying . [He]1527-dorian remembered that the night before [he]1527-dorian had forgotten , for the first time in [his]1527-dorian life , to hide the fatal canvas , and was about to rush forward , when [he]1527-dorian drew back with a shudder .

What was that loathsome red dew that gleamed , wet and glistening , on one of the hands , as though the canvas had sweated blood ? How horrible it was ! more horrible , it seemed to [him]1527-dorian for the moment , than the silent thing that [he]1527-dorian knew was stretched across the table , the thing whose grotesque misshapen shadow on the spotted carpet showed [him]1527-dorian that it had not stirred , but was still there , as [he]1527-dorian had left it .

[He]1527-dorian heaved a deep breath , opened the door a little wider , and with half - closed eyes and averted head , walked quickly in , determined that [he]1527-dorian would not look even once upon [the dead man]1320-the dead man . Then , stooping down and taking up the gold - and - purple hanging , [he]1527-dorian flung it right over the picture .

There [he]1527-dorian stopped , feeling afraid to turn round , and [his]1527-dorian eyes fixed themselves on the intricacies of the pattern before [him]1527-dorian . [He]1527-dorian heard [Campbell]309-alan bringing in the heavy chest , and the irons , and the other things that [he]309-alan had required for [his]309-alan dreadful work . [He]1527-dorian began to wonder if [he]309-alan and [Basil Hallward]121-basil had ever met , and , if so , what [they]1529-they had thought of [each other]1942-each other .

" Leave [me]1527-dorian now , "[1527-dorian] said a stern voice behind [him]1527-dorian .

[He]1527-dorian turned and hurried out , just conscious that [the dead man]1320-the dead man had been thrust back into the chair and that [Campbell]309-alan was gazing into a glistening yellow face . As [he]1527-dorian was going [downstairs]763-downstairs , [he]1527-dorian heard the key being turned in the lock .

It was long after seven when [Campbell]309-alan came back into [the library]887-the library . [He]309-alan was pale , but absolutely calm . " [I]1527-dorian have done what [you]309-alan asked [me]1527-dorian to do , "[1527-dorian] [he]1527-dorian muttered . " And now , good - bye . Let [us]3199-us never see [each other]1942-each other again . "[1527-dorian]

" [You]309-alan have saved [me]117-dorian gray from ruin , [Alan]309-alan . [I]117-dorian gray can not forget that , "[117-dorian gray] said [Dorian]117-dorian gray simply .

As soon as [Campbell]309-alan had left , [he]1527-dorian went [upstairs]676-upstairs . There was a horrible smell of nitric acid in [the room]386-the room . But the thing that had been sitting at the table was gone .

CHAPTER XV .

That evening , at eight - thirty , exquisitely dressed and wearing a large button - hole of Parma violets , [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray was ushered into [[Lady Narborough]318-lady narborough s drawing - room]1536-lady narborough s drawing - room by [bowing servants]1537-bowing servants . [His]117-dorian gray forehead was throbbing with maddened nerves , and [he]117-dorian gray felt wildly excited , but [his]117-dorian gray manner as [he]117-dorian gray bent over [his]117-dorian gray hostess s hand was as easy and graceful as ever . Perhaps [one]381-one never seems so much at one s ease as when [one]381-one has to play a part . Certainly [no one]2310-no one looking at [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray that night could have believed that [he]117-dorian gray had passed through a tragedy as horrible as any tragedy of [our]1541-our age . Those finely shaped fingers could never have clutched a knife for sin , nor those smiling lips have cried out on [God]134-god and goodness . [He]117-dorian gray [himself]117-dorian gray could not help wondering at the calm of [his]117-dorian gray demeanour , and for a moment felt keenly the terrible pleasure of a double life .

It was a small party , got up rather in a hurry by [Lady Narborough]318-lady narborough , who was [a very clever woman with what [Lord Henry]120-lord henry used to describe as the remains of really remarkable ugliness]1542-a very clever woman with what lord henry used to describe as the remains of really remarkable ugliness . [She]318-lady narborough had proved [an excellent wife to one of [[our]1541-our most tedious ambassadors]1544-our most tedious ambassadors , and having buried [[her]318-lady narborough husband]2806-her husband properly in [a marble mausoleum , which [she]318-lady narborough had [herself]318-lady narborough designed]1546-a marble mausoleum , which she had herself designed , and married off [[her]318-lady narborough daughters]1547-her daughters to [some rich , rather elderly men]1548-some rich , rather elderly men]1543-an excellent wife to one of our most tedious ambassadors , and having buried her husband properly in a marble mausoleum , which she had herself designed , and married off her daughters to some rich , rather elderly men , [she]318-lady narborough devoted [herself]318-lady narborough now to the pleasures of French fiction , French cookery , and French _ esprit _ when [she]318-lady narborough could get it .

[Dorian]117-dorian gray was one of [her]318-lady narborough especial favourites , and [she]318-lady narborough always told [him]117-dorian gray that [she]318-lady narborough was extremely glad [she]318-lady narborough had not met [him]117-dorian gray in early life . " [I]318-lady narborough know , [[my]318-lady narborough dear]1914-my dear , [I]318-lady narborough should have fallen madly in love with [you]117-dorian gray , "[318-lady narborough] [she]318-lady narborough used to say , " and thrown [my]318-lady narborough bonnet right over the mills for [your]117-dorian gray sake . It is most fortunate that [you]117-dorian gray were not thought of at the time . As it was , [our]3202-our bonnets were so unbecoming , and [the mills]3203-the mills were so occupied in trying to raise the wind , that [I]318-lady narborough never had even a flirtation with [anybody]1955-anybody . However , that was all [Narborough]318-lady narborough s fault . [He]117-dorian gray was dreadfully short - sighted , and there is no pleasure in taking in [a husband who never sees anything]3205-a husband who never sees anything . "[318-lady narborough]

[[Her]318-lady narborough guests]1976-her guests this evening were rather tedious . The fact was , as [she]318-lady narborough explained to [Dorian]117-dorian gray , behind [a very shabby fan]1550-a very shabby fan , [one of [[her]318-lady narborough married daughters]1552-her married daughters]1551-one of her married daughters had come up quite suddenly to stay with [her]318-lady narborough , and , to make matters worse , had actually brought [[her]318-lady narborough husband]2806-her husband with [her]318-lady narborough . " [I]318-lady narborough think it is most unkind of [her]318-lady narborough , [[my]318-lady narborough dear]1914-my dear , "[318-lady narborough] [she]318-lady narborough whispered . " Of course [I]318-lady narborough go and stay with [them]1976-her guests every summer after [I]318-lady narborough come from [Homburg]102-homburg , but then [an old woman like [me]318-lady narborough]3207-an old woman like me must have fresh air sometimes , and besides , [I]318-lady narborough really wake [them]1976-her guests up . [You]1914-my dear don t know what an existence [they]1976-her guests lead down there . It is pure unadulterated country life . [They]1976-her guests get up early , because [they]1976-her guests have so much to do , and go to bed early , because [they]1976-her guests have so little to think about . There has not been a scandal in [the neighbourhood]3208-the neighbourhood since the time of [Queen Elizabeth]270-queen elizabeth , and consequently [they]1976-her guests all fall asleep after dinner . [You]1914-my dear shan t sit next either of [them]1976-her guests . [You]1914-my dear shall sit by [me]318-lady narborough and amuse [me]318-lady narborough . "[318-lady narborough]

[Dorian]117-dorian gray murmured a graceful compliment and looked round [the room]386-the room . Yes : it was certainly a tedious party . [Two of [the people [he]117-dorian gray had never seen before]1556-the people he had never seen before]1555-two of the people he had never seen before , and [the others]2490-the others consisted of [Ernest Harrowden]319-ernest harrowden , [one of those middle - aged mediocrities so common in [London]2-london clubs who have [no enemies]1559-no enemies , but are thoroughly disliked by [[their]1559-no enemies friends]1560-their friends]1558-one of those middle - aged mediocrities so common in london clubs who have no enemies , but are thoroughly disliked by their friends ; [Lady Ruxton]320-lady ruxton , [an overdressed woman of forty - seven]1561-an overdressed woman of forty - seven , with a hooked nose , who was always trying to get [herself]320-lady ruxton compromised , but was so peculiarly plain that to [her]320-lady ruxton great disappointment [no one]2310-no one would ever believe anything against [her]320-lady ruxton ; [Mrs. Erlynne]321-mrs. erlynne , [a pushing nobody , with a delightful lisp and Venetian - red hair]1563-a pushing nobody , with a delightful lisp and venetian - red hair ; [Lady Alice Chapman]322-lady alice chapman , [[his]117-dorian gray hostess s daughter]1564-his hostess s daughter , [a dowdy dull girl , with one of those characteristic British faces that , once seen , are never remembered]1565-a dowdy dull girl , with one of those characteristic british faces that , once seen , are never remembered ; and [[her]322-lady alice chapman husband]2806-her husband , [a red - cheeked , white - whiskered creature who , like so many of [[his]117-dorian gray class]1568-his class]1567-a red - cheeked , white - whiskered creature who , like so many of his class , was under the impression that inordinate joviality can atone for an entire lack of ideas .

[He]117-dorian gray was rather sorry [he]117-dorian gray had come , till [Lady Narborough]318-lady narborough , looking at the great ormolu gilt clock that sprawled in gaudy curves on the mauve - draped mantelshelf , exclaimed : " How horrid of [Henry Wotton]120-lord henry to be so late ! [I]318-lady narborough sent round to [him]120-lord henry this morning on chance and [he]120-lord henry promised faithfully not to disappoint [me]318-lady narborough . "[318-lady narborough]

It was some consolation that [Harry]120-lord henry was to be [there]1904-there , and when the door opened and [he]117-dorian gray heard [his]117-dorian gray slow musical voice lending charm to some insincere apology , [he]117-dorian gray ceased to feel bored .

But at dinner [he]117-dorian gray could not eat anything . Plate after plate went away untasted . [Lady Narborough]318-lady narborough kept scolding [him]117-dorian gray for what [she]318-lady narborough called " an insult to poor Adolphe , who invented the _ menu _ specially for [you]117-dorian gray , "[318-lady narborough] and now and then [Lord Henry]120-lord henry looked across at [him]117-dorian gray , wondering at [his]117-dorian gray silence and abstracted manner . From time to time [the butler]419-the butler filled [his]419-the butler glass with champagne . [He]117-dorian gray drank eagerly , and [his]117-dorian gray thirst seemed to increase .

" [Dorian]3209-dorian , "[120-lord henry] said [Lord Henry]120-lord henry at last , as [the _ chaud - froid _]1571-the _ chaud - froid _ was being handed round , " what is the matter with [you]3209-dorian to - night ? [You]3209-dorian are quite out of sorts . "[120-lord henry]
