" [I]1589-he will try to be [there]1904-there , [Harry]120-lord henry , "[1589-he] [he]1589-he said , leaving [the room]386-the room . As [he]1589-he drove back to [[his]1589-he own house]1385-his own house , [he]1589-he was conscious that the sense of terror [he]1589-he thought [he]1589-he had strangled had come back to [him]1589-he . [Lord Henry]120-lord henry s casual questioning had made [him]1589-he lose [his]1589-he nerve for the moment , and [he]1589-he wanted [his]1589-he nerve still . Things that were dangerous had to be destroyed . [He]1589-he winced . [He]1589-he hated the idea of even touching them .

Yet it had to be done . [He]1589-he realized that , and when [he]1589-he had locked the door of [[his]1589-he library]1592-his library , [he]1589-he opened the secret press into which [he]1589-he had thrust [Basil Hallward]121-basil s coat and bag . A huge fire was blazing . [He]1589-he piled another log on it . The smell of the singeing clothes and burning leather was horrible . It took [him]1589-he three - quarters of an hour to consume everything . At the end [he]1589-he felt faint and sick , and having lit some Algerian pastilles in a pierced copper brazier , [he]1589-he bathed [his]1589-he hands and forehead with a cool musk - scented vinegar .

Suddenly [he]1589-he started . [His]1589-he eyes grew strangely bright , and [he]1589-he gnawed nervously at [his]1589-he underlip . Between two of the windows stood a large Florentine cabinet , made out of ebony and inlaid with ivory and blue lapis . [He]1589-he watched it as though it were a thing that could fascinate and make afraid , as though it held something that [he]1589-he longed for and yet almost loathed . [His]1589-he breath quickened . A mad craving came over [him]1589-he . [He]1589-he lit a cigarette and then threw it away . [His]1589-he eyelids drooped till the long fringed lashes almost touched [his]1589-he cheek . But [he]1589-he still watched the cabinet . At last [he]1589-he got up from the sofa on which [he]1589-he had been lying , went over to it , and having unlocked it , touched some hidden spring . A triangular drawer passed slowly out . [His]1589-he fingers moved instinctively towards it , dipped in , and closed on something . It was a small Chinese box of black and gold - dust lacquer , elaborately wrought , the sides patterned with curved waves , and the silken cords hung with round crystals and tasselled in plaited metal threads . [He]1589-he opened it . Inside was a green paste , waxy in lustre , the odour curiously heavy and persistent .

[He]1589-he hesitated for some moments , with a strangely immobile smile upon [his]1589-he face . Then shivering , though the atmosphere of [the room]386-the room was terribly hot , [he]1589-he drew [himself]1589-he up and glanced at the clock . It was twenty minutes to twelve . [He]1589-he put the box back , shutting the cabinet doors as [he]1589-he did so , and went into [[his]1589-he bedroom]888-his bedroom .

As midnight was striking bronze blows upon the dusky air , [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray , dressed commonly , and with a muffler wrapped round [his]117-dorian gray throat , crept quietly out of [[his]1589-he house]1259-his house . In [Bond Street]105-bond street [he]1589-he found a hansom with a good horse . [He]1589-he hailed [it]1596-it and in a low voice gave [the driver]1597-the driver an address .

[The man]2023-the man shook [his]2023-the man head . " It is too far for [me]2023-the man , "[2023-the man] [he]2023-the man muttered .

" Here is a sovereign for [you]2023-the man , "[117-dorian gray] said [Dorian]117-dorian gray . " [You]2023-the man shall have another if [you]2023-the man drive fast . "[117-dorian gray]

" All right , [sir]2063-sir , "[2023-the man] answered [the man]2023-the man , " [you]2063-sir will be there in an hour , "[2023-the man] and after [his]2023-the man fare had got in [he]2023-the man turned [his]2023-the man horse round and drove rapidly towards [the river]1600-the river .

[CHAPTER XVI]106-chapter xvi .

A cold rain began to fall , and the blurred street - lamps looked ghastly in the dripping mist . [The public - houses]1601-the public - houses were just closing , and [dim men]1602-dim men and [women]2058-women were clustering in broken groups round [their]1602-dim men doors . From some of [the bars]1604-the bars came the sound of horrible laughter . In others , [drunkards]863-drunkards brawled and screamed .

Lying back in [the hansom]1606-the hansom , with [his]2023-the man hat pulled over [his]2023-the man forehead , [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray watched with listless eyes the sordid shame of [the great city]1607-the great city , and now and then [he]117-dorian gray repeated to [himself]117-dorian gray the words that [Lord Henry]120-lord henry had said to [him]117-dorian gray on the first day [they]1608-they had met , " To cure the soul by means of the senses , and the senses by means of the soul . "[120-lord henry] Yes , that was the secret . [He]117-dorian gray had often tried it , and would try it again now . There were [opium dens]1609-opium dens where [one]381-one could buy oblivion , [dens of horror]1611-dens of horror where the memory of old sins could be destroyed by the madness of sins that were new .

The moon hung low in the sky like a yellow skull . From time to time a huge misshapen cloud stretched a long arm across and hid it . The gas - lamps grew fewer , and [the streets]3068-the streets more narrow and gloomy . Once [the man]2023-the man lost [his]2023-the man way and had to drive back half a mile . A steam rose from the horse as it splashed up the puddles . The sidewindows of [the hansom]1606-the hansom were clogged with a grey - flannel mist .

" To cure the soul by means of the senses , and the senses by means of the soul ! "[2023-the man] How the words rang in [his]117-dorian gray ears ! [His]117-dorian gray soul , certainly , was sick to death . Was it true that the senses could cure it ? Innocent blood had been spilled . What could atone for that ? Ah ! for that there was no atonement ; but though forgiveness was impossible , forgetfulness was possible still , and [he]117-dorian gray was determined to forget , to stamp the thing out , to crush it as one would crush the adder that had stung [one]381-one . Indeed , what right had [Basil]121-basil to have spoken to [him]117-dorian gray as [he]117-dorian gray had done ? Who had made [him]117-dorian gray [a judge over [others]1931-others]1616-a judge over others ? [He]117-dorian gray had said things that were dreadful , horrible , not to be endured .

On and on plodded [the hansom]1606-the hansom , going slower , it seemed to [him]117-dorian gray , at each step . [He]117-dorian gray thrust up the trap and called to [the man]2023-the man to drive faster . The hideous hunger for opium began to gnaw at [him]117-dorian gray . [His]117-dorian gray throat burned and [his]117-dorian gray delicate hands twitched nervously together . [He]117-dorian gray struck at the horse madly with [his]117-dorian gray stick . [The driver]1597-the driver laughed and whipped up . [He]1597-the driver laughed in answer , and [the man]2023-the man was silent .

The way seemed interminable , and [the streets]3068-the streets like the black web of some sprawling spider . The monotony became unbearable , and as the mist thickened , [he]117-dorian gray felt afraid .

Then [they]1623-they passed by [lonely brickfields]1624-lonely brickfields . The fog was lighter here , and [he]117-dorian gray could see [the strange , bottle - shaped kilns with [their]1625-the strange , bottle - shaped kilns with their orange , fanlike tongues of fire orange , fanlike tongues of fire]1625-the strange , bottle - shaped kilns with their orange , fanlike tongues of fire . A dog barked as [they]1623-they went by , and far away in the darkness [some wandering sea - gull]1626-some wandering sea - gull screamed . [The horse]1627-the horse stumbled in a rut , then swerved aside and broke into a gallop .

After some time [they]1623-they left [the clay road]1628-the clay road and rattled again over [rough - paven streets]1629-rough - paven streets . Most of the windows were dark , but now and then fantastic shadows were silhouetted against some lamplit blind . [He]117-dorian gray watched [them]1623-they curiously . [They]1623-they moved like monstrous marionettes and made gestures like live things . [He]117-dorian gray hated [them]1623-they . A dull rage was in [his]117-dorian gray heart . As [they]1623-they turned a corner , [a woman]2360-a woman yelled something at [them]1623-they from an open door , and [two men]1631-two men ran after the hansom for about a hundred yards . [The driver]1597-the driver beat at [them]1623-they with [his]1597-the driver whip .

It is said that passion makes one think in a circle . Certainly with hideous iteration the bitten lips of [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray shaped and reshaped those subtle words that dealt with soul and sense , till [he]117-dorian gray had found in [them]1623-they the full expression , as it were , of [his]117-dorian gray mood , and justified , by intellectual approval , passions that without such justification would still have dominated [his]117-dorian gray temper . From cell to cell of [his]117-dorian gray brain crept the one thought ; and the wild desire to live , most terrible of all man s appetites , quickened into force each trembling nerve and fibre . Ugliness that had once been hateful to [him]117-dorian gray because it made things real , became dear to [him]117-dorian gray now for that very reason . Ugliness was the one reality . The coarse brawl , the loathsome den , the crude violence of disordered life , the very vileness of [thief and outcast]1633-thief and outcast , were more vivid , in their intense actuality of impression , than all the gracious shapes of art , the dreamy shadows of song . They were what [he]117-dorian gray needed for forgetfulness . In three days [he]117-dorian gray would be free .

Suddenly [the man]2023-the man drew up with a jerk at the top of [a dark lane]1635-a dark lane . Over the low roofs and jagged chimney - stacks of [the houses]545-the houses rose the black masts of [ships]1637-ships . Wreaths of white mist clung like ghostly sails to [the yards]1638-the yards .

" Somewhere about here , [sir]2063-sir , ain t it ? "[2023-the man] [he]2023-the man asked huskily through the trap .

[Dorian]117-dorian gray started and peered round . " This will do , "[117-dorian gray] [he]117-dorian gray answered , and having got out hastily and given [the driver]1597-the driver the extra fare [he]117-dorian gray had promised [him]117-dorian gray , [he]117-dorian gray walked quickly in the direction of [the quay]1640-the quay . Here and there a lantern gleamed at the stern of [some huge merchantman]1641-some huge merchantman . The light shook and splintered in the puddles . A red glare came from [an outward - bound steamer]1642-an outward - bound steamer that was coaling . The slimy pavement looked like a wet mackintosh .

[He]117-dorian gray hurried on towards the left , glancing back now and then to see if [he]117-dorian gray was being followed . In about seven or eight minutes [he]117-dorian gray reached [a small shabby house that was wedged in between [two gaunt factories]1644-two gaunt factories]1643-a small shabby house that was wedged in between two gaunt factories . In one of the top - windows stood a lamp . [He]117-dorian gray stopped and gave a peculiar knock .

After a little time [he]117-dorian gray heard steps in [the passage]1454-the passage and the chain being unhooked . The door opened quietly , and [he]117-dorian gray went in without saying a word to [the squat misshapen figure that flattened itself into the shadow]1646-the squat misshapen figure that flattened itself into the shadow as [he]117-dorian gray passed . At the end of [the hall]1025-the hall hung a tattered green curtain that swayed and shook in the gusty wind which had followed [him]117-dorian gray in from [the street]641-the street . [He]117-dorian gray dragged [it]1649-it aside and entered [a long low room which looked as if [it]1650-a long low room which looked as if it had once been a third - rate dancing - saloon had once been [a third - rate dancing - saloon]1651-a third - rate dancing - saloon]1650-a long low room which looked as if it had once been a third - rate dancing - saloon . Shrill flaring gas - jets , dulled and distorted in the fly - blown mirrors that faced [them]1652-them , were ranged round the walls . Greasy reflectors of ribbed tin backed them , making quivering disks of light . The floor was covered with ochre - coloured sawdust , trampled here and there into mud , and stained with dark rings of spilled liquor . [Some Malays]1653-some malays were crouching by a little charcoal stove , playing with bone counters and showing [their]1653-some malays white teeth as [they]1653-some malays chattered . In one corner , with [his]117-dorian gray head buried in [his]117-dorian gray arms , [a sailor sprawled over a table]1654-a sailor sprawled over a table , and by the tawdrily painted bar that ran across one complete side stood [two haggard women]1655-two haggard women , mocking [an old man who was brushing the sleeves of [his]1656-an old man who was brushing the sleeves of his coat with an expression of disgust coat with an expression of disgust]1656-an old man who was brushing the sleeves of his coat with an expression of disgust . " [He]1656-an old man who was brushing the sleeves of his coat with an expression of disgust thinks [he]1656-an old man who was brushing the sleeves of his coat with an expression of disgust s got red ants on [him]1656-an old man who was brushing the sleeves of his coat with an expression of disgust , "[1655-two haggard women] laughed one of [them]1655-two haggard women , as [Dorian]117-dorian gray passed by . [The man]2023-the man looked at [her]1658-her in terror and began to whimper .

At the end of [the room]386-the room there was a little staircase , leading to [a darkened chamber]1660-a darkened chamber . As [Dorian]117-dorian gray hurried up [its]1661-its three rickety steps , the heavy odour of opium met [him]117-dorian gray . [He]117-dorian gray heaved a deep breath , and [his]117-dorian gray nostrils quivered with pleasure . When [he]117-dorian gray entered , [a young man with smooth yellow hair , who was bending over a lamp lighting a long thin pipe]1662-a young man with smooth yellow hair , who was bending over a lamp lighting a long thin pipe , looked up at [him]117-dorian gray and nodded in a hesitating manner .

" [You]117-dorian gray here , [Adrian]211-adrian singleton ? "[117-dorian gray] muttered [Dorian]117-dorian gray .

" Where else should [I]117-dorian gray be ? "[117-dorian gray] [he]117-dorian gray answered , listlessly . " [None of [the chaps]3299-the chaps]3298-none of the chaps will speak to [me]117-dorian gray now . "[117-dorian gray]

" [I]1662-a young man with smooth yellow hair , who was bending over a lamp lighting a long thin pipe thought [you]117-dorian gray had left [England]5-england . "[1662-a young man with smooth yellow hair , who was bending over a lamp lighting a long thin pipe]

" [Darlington]334-darlington is not going to do anything . [[My]117-dorian gray brother]2752-my brother paid the bill at last . [George]274-george willoughby doesn t speak to [me]117-dorian gray either .... [I]117-dorian gray don t care , "[117-dorian gray] [he]117-dorian gray added with a sigh . " As long as [one]381-one has this stuff , [one]381-one doesn t want [friends]1988-friends . [I]117-dorian gray think [I]117-dorian gray have had [too many friends]3304-too many friends . "[117-dorian gray]

[Dorian]117-dorian gray winced and looked round at the grotesque things that lay in such fantastic postures on the ragged mattresses . The twisted limbs , the gaping mouths , the staring lustreless eyes , fascinated [him]117-dorian gray . [He]117-dorian gray knew in what strange heavens [they]1663-they were suffering , and what dull hells were teaching [them]1663-they the secret of some new joy . [They]1663-they were better off than [he]117-dorian gray was . [He]117-dorian gray was prisoned in thought . Memory , like a horrible malady , was eating [his]117-dorian gray soul away . From time to time [he]117-dorian gray seemed to see the eyes of [Basil Hallward]121-basil looking at [him]117-dorian gray . Yet [he]117-dorian gray felt [he]117-dorian gray could not stay . The presence of [Adrian Singleton]211-adrian singleton troubled [him]117-dorian gray . [He]117-dorian gray wanted to be where [no one]2310-no one would know who [he]117-dorian gray was . [He]117-dorian gray wanted to escape from [himself]117-dorian gray .

" [I]117-dorian gray am going on to [the other place]3305-the other place , "[117-dorian gray] [he]117-dorian gray said after a pause .

" On [the wharf]3306-the wharf ? "[117-dorian gray]

" Yes . "[117-dorian gray]

" That mad - cat is sure to be there . [They]3307-they won t have [her]3308-her in [this place]3309-this place now . "[117-dorian gray]

[Dorian]117-dorian gray shrugged [his]117-dorian gray shoulders . " [I]117-dorian gray am sick of [women who love one]3310-women who love one . [Women who hate one]3311-women who hate one are much more interesting . Besides , the stuff is better . "[117-dorian gray]

" Much the same . "[117-dorian gray]

" [I]117-dorian gray like it better . Come and have something to drink . [I]117-dorian gray must have something . "[117-dorian gray]

" [I]1396-the young man don t want anything , "[1396-the young man] murmured [the young man]1396-the young man .

" Never mind . "[117-dorian gray]

[Adrian Singleton]211-adrian singleton rose up wearily and followed [Dorian]117-dorian gray to [the bar]812-the bar . A half - caste , in a ragged turban and a shabby ulster , grinned a hideous greeting as [he]211-adrian singleton thrust a bottle of brandy and two tumblers in front of [them]1667-them . [The women]2232-the women sidled up and began to chatter . [Dorian]117-dorian gray turned [his]117-dorian gray back on [them]2232-the women and said something in a low voice to [Adrian Singleton]211-adrian singleton .

A crooked smile , like a Malay crease , writhed across the face of [one of [the women]2232-the women]1669-one of the women . " [We]3312-we are very proud to - night , "[1669-one of the women] [she]1669-one of the women sneered .

" For God s sake don t talk to [me]117-dorian gray , "[117-dorian gray] cried [Dorian]117-dorian gray , stamping [his]117-dorian gray foot on the ground . " What do [you]1669-one of the women want ? Money ? Here it is . Don t ever talk to [me]117-dorian gray again . "[117-dorian gray]

Two red sparks flashed for a moment in [the woman]770-the woman s sodden eyes , then flickered out and left them dull and glazed . [She]770-the woman tossed [her]770-the woman head and raked the coins off the counter with greedy fingers . [[Her]770-the woman companion]1672-her companion watched [her]770-the woman enviously .

" It s no use , "[211-adrian singleton] sighed [Adrian Singleton]211-adrian singleton . " [I]211-adrian singleton don t care to go back . What does it matter ? [I]211-adrian singleton am quite happy [here]2327-here . "[211-adrian singleton]

" [You]1669-one of the women will write to [me]117-dorian gray if [you]1669-one of the women want anything , won t [you]1669-one of the women ? "[117-dorian gray] said [Dorian]117-dorian gray , after a pause .

" Perhaps . "[211-adrian singleton]

" Good night , then . "[211-adrian singleton]

" Good night , "[1396-the young man] answered [the young man]1396-the young man , passing up the steps and wiping [his]1396-the young man parched mouth with a handkerchief .

[Dorian]117-dorian gray walked to the door with a look of pain in [his]117-dorian gray face . As [he]117-dorian gray drew the curtain aside , a hideous laugh broke from the painted lips of [the woman who had taken [his]117-dorian gray money]1674-the woman who had taken his money . " There goes the devil s bargain ! "[1674-the woman who had taken his money] [she]1674-the woman who had taken his money hiccoughed , in a hoarse voice .

" Curse [you]1674-the woman who had taken his money ! "[117-dorian gray] [he]117-dorian gray answered , " don t call [me]117-dorian gray that . "[117-dorian gray]

[She]1674-the woman who had taken his money snapped [her]1674-the woman who had taken his money fingers . " [Prince Charming]185-prince charming is what [you]117-dorian gray like to be called , ain t it ? "[1674-the woman who had taken his money] [she]1674-the woman who had taken his money yelled after [him]117-dorian gray .

[The drowsy sailor]1675-the drowsy sailor leaped to [his]1675-the drowsy sailor feet as [she]1674-the woman who had taken his money spoke , and looked wildly round . The sound of the shutting of the hall door fell on [his]1675-the drowsy sailor ear . [He]1675-the drowsy sailor rushed out as if in pursuit .

[Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray hurried along [the quay]1640-the quay through the drizzling rain . [His]117-dorian gray meeting with [Adrian Singleton]211-adrian singleton had strangely moved [him]117-dorian gray , and [he]117-dorian gray wondered if the ruin of that young life was really to be laid at [his]117-dorian gray door , as [Basil Hallward]121-basil had said to [him]117-dorian gray with such infamy of insult . [He]117-dorian gray bit [his]117-dorian gray lip , and for a few seconds [his]117-dorian gray eyes grew sad . Yet , after all , what did it matter to [him]117-dorian gray ? [One]381-one s days were too brief to take the burden of another s errors on one s shoulders . [Each man]1678-each man lived [his]1678-each man own life and paid [his]1678-each man own price for living it . The only pity was [one]381-one had to pay so often for a single fault . [One]381-one had to pay over and over again , indeed . In [her]1681-her dealings with [man]364-man , destiny never closed [her]1681-her accounts .

There are moments , [psychologists]1683-psychologists tell [us]1684-us , when the passion for sin , or for what [the world]1908-the world calls sin , so dominates a nature that every fibre of the body , as every cell of the brain , seems to be instinct with fearful impulses . [Men]2041-men and [women]2058-women at such moments lose the freedom of [their]1688-their will . [They]1688-their move to [their]1688-their terrible end as automatons move . Choice is taken from [them]1688-their , and conscience is either killed , or , if it lives at all , lives but to give rebellion its fascination and disobedience its charm . For all sins , as theologians weary not of reminding [us]1684-us , are sins of disobedience . When [that high spirit , that morning star of evil]1689-that high spirit , that morning star of evil , fell from [heaven]2562-heaven , it was as [a rebel]1691-a rebel that [he]1689-that high spirit , that morning star of evil fell .

Callous , concentrated on evil , with stained mind , and soul hungry for rebellion , [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray hastened on , quickening [his]117-dorian gray step as [he]117-dorian gray went , but as [he]117-dorian gray darted aside into [a dim archway]1692-a dim archway , that had served [him]117-dorian gray often as a short cut to [the ill - famed place where [he]117-dorian gray was going]1693-the ill - famed place where he was going , [he]117-dorian gray felt [himself]117-dorian gray suddenly seized from behind , and before [he]117-dorian gray had time to defend [himself]117-dorian gray , [he]117-dorian gray was thrust back against the wall , with a brutal hand round [his]117-dorian gray throat .

[He]117-dorian gray struggled madly for life , and by a terrible effort wrenched the tightening fingers away . In a second [he]117-dorian gray heard the click of a revolver , and saw the gleam of a polished barrel , pointing straight at [his]117-dorian gray head , and the dusky form of [a short , thick - set man]1694-a short , thick - set man facing [him]117-dorian gray .

" What do [you]2023-the man want ? "[117-dorian gray] [he]117-dorian gray gasped .

" Keep quiet , "[2023-the man] said [the man]2023-the man . " If [you]117-dorian gray stir , [I]2023-the man shoot [you]117-dorian gray . "[2023-the man]

" [You]117-dorian gray are mad . What have [I]1694-a short , thick - set man done to [you]117-dorian gray ? "[1694-a short , thick - set man]

" [You]117-dorian gray wrecked the life of [Sibyl Vane]168-sibyl , "[2023-the man] was the answer , " and [Sibyl Vane]168-sibyl was [[my]2023-the man sister]2581-my sister . [She]168-sibyl killed [herself]168-sibyl . [I]2023-the man know it . [Her]168-sibyl death is at [your]117-dorian gray door . [I]2023-the man swore [I]2023-the man would kill [you]117-dorian gray in return . For years [I]2023-the man have sought [you]117-dorian gray . [I]2023-the man had no clue , no trace . [The two people who could have described [you]117-dorian gray]3315-the two people who could have described you were dead . [I]2023-the man knew nothing of [you]117-dorian gray but the pet name [she]168-sibyl used to call [you]117-dorian gray . [I]2023-the man heard it to - night by chance . Make [your]117-dorian gray peace with [God]134-god , for to - night [you]117-dorian gray are going to die . "[2023-the man]

[Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray grew sick with fear . " [I]117-dorian gray never knew [her]168-sibyl , "[117-dorian gray] [he]117-dorian gray stammered . " [I]117-dorian gray never heard of [her]168-sibyl . [You]117-dorian gray are mad . "[117-dorian gray]

" [You]117-dorian gray had better confess [your]117-dorian gray sin , for as sure as [I]2023-the man am [James Vane]183-jim , [you]117-dorian gray are going to die . "[2023-the man] There was a horrible moment . [Dorian]1696-dorian did not know what to say or do . " Down on [your]117-dorian gray knees ! "[2023-the man] growled [the man]2023-the man . [Dorian]117-dorian gray s arms fell to [his]117-dorian gray side . Paralysed with terror , [he]117-dorian gray did not know what to do . Suddenly a wild hope flashed across [his]117-dorian gray brain . " Stop , "[117-dorian gray] [he]117-dorian gray cried . " How long ago is it since [[your]2023-the man sister]2864-your sister died ? Quick , tell [me]117-dorian gray ! "[117-dorian gray]

[James Vane]183-jim hesitated for a moment , not understanding what was meant . Then [he]183-jim seized [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray and dragged [him]117-dorian gray from [the archway]1699-the archway .

Dim and wavering as was the wind - blown light , yet it served to show [him]183-jim the hideous error , as it seemed , into which [he]183-jim had fallen , for the face of [the man [he]183-jim had sought to kill]1700-the man he had sought to kill had all the bloom of boyhood , all the unstained purity of youth . [He]183-jim seemed little more than [a lad of twenty summers]1701-a lad of twenty summers , hardly older , if older indeed at all , than [[his]183-jim sister]663-his sister had been when [they]1703-they had parted so many years ago . It was obvious that this was not [the man who had destroyed [her]663-his sister life]1704-the man who had destroyed her life .

[He]117-dorian gray loosened [his]117-dorian gray hold and reeled back . " [[My]117-dorian gray God]2467-my god ! [[my]117-dorian gray God]2467-my god ! " Forgive [me]183-jim , [sir]2063-sir , "[183-jim] muttered [James Vane]183-jim . " [I]183-jim was deceived . A chance word [I]183-jim heard in [that damned den]3321-that damned den set [me]183-jim on the wrong track . "[183-jim]

" [You]183-jim had better go [home]2087-home and put that pistol away , or [you]183-jim may get into trouble , "[117-dorian gray] said [Dorian]117-dorian gray , turning on [his]117-dorian gray heel and going slowly down [the street]641-the street .

[James Vane]183-jim stood on [the pavement]1387-the pavement in horror . [He]183-jim was trembling from head to foot . After a little while , a black shadow that had been creeping along the dripping wall moved out into the light and came close to [him]183-jim with stealthy footsteps . [He]183-jim felt a hand laid on [his]183-jim arm and looked round with a start . " Why didn t [you]183-jim kill [him]183-jim ? " [I]1707-one of the women who had been drinking at the bar knew [you]183-jim were following [him]183-jim when [you]183-jim rushed out from [Daly s.]107-daly s. [[You]183-jim fool]3323-you fool ! [You]183-jim should have killed [him]183-jim . [He]183-jim has lots of money , and [he]183-jim s as bad as bad . "[1707-one of the women who had been drinking at the bar]

" [He]183-jim is not [the man [I]183-jim am looking for]3324-the man i am looking for , "[183-jim] [he]183-jim answered , " and [I]183-jim want [no man]2631-no man s money . CHAPTER XVII .

[Everybody]2085-everybody started up . [The duchess]573-the duchess stood motionless in horror . And with fear in [his]1742-he eyes , [Lord Henry]120-lord henry rushed through the flapping palms to find [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray lying face downwards on the tiled floor in a deathlike swoon .

[He]117-dorian gray was carried at once into [the blue drawing - room]1747-the blue drawing - room and laid upon one of the sofas . After a short time , [he]117-dorian gray came to [himself]117-dorian gray and looked round with a dazed expression .

[He]117-dorian gray went to [[his]117-dorian gray room]1748-his room and dressed . CHAPTER XVIII .

The next day [he]117-dorian gray did not leave [the house]425-the house , and , indeed , spent most of the time in [[his]117-dorian gray own room]891-his own room , sick with a wild terror of dying , and yet indifferent to life itself . The consciousness of being hunted , snared , tracked down , had begun to dominate [him]117-dorian gray . If the tapestry did but tremble in the wind , [he]117-dorian gray shook . The dead leaves that were blown against the leaded panes seemed to [him]117-dorian gray like [his]117-dorian gray own wasted resolutions and wild regrets . When [he]117-dorian gray closed [his]117-dorian gray eyes , [he]117-dorian gray saw again the sailor s face peering through the mist - stained glass , and horror seemed once more to lay its hand upon [his]117-dorian gray heart .

But perhaps it had been only [his]117-dorian gray fancy that had called vengeance out of the night and set the hideous shapes of punishment before [him]117-dorian gray . Actual life was chaos , but there was something terribly logical in the imagination . It was the imagination that set remorse to dog the feet of sin . It was the imagination that made each crime bear its misshapen brood . In the common world of fact [the wicked]1752-the wicked were not punished , nor the good rewarded . Success was given to [the strong]1753-the strong , failure thrust upon [the weak]2811-the weak . That was all . Besides , had [any stranger]1755-any stranger been prowling round [the house]425-the house , [he]117-dorian gray would have been seen by [the servants]1445-the servants or [the keepers]1758-the keepers . Had any foot - marks been found on the flower - beds , [the gardeners]3336-the gardeners would have reported it . Yes , it had been merely fancy . [[Sibyl Vane]168-sibyl s brother]1760-sibyl vane s brother had not come back to kill [him]117-dorian gray . [He]117-dorian gray had sailed away in [[his]117-dorian gray ship]1761-his ship to founder in [some winter sea]1762-some winter sea . From [him]117-dorian gray , at any rate , [he]117-dorian gray was safe . Why , [the man]2023-the man did not know who [he]2023-the man was , could not know who [he]2023-the man was . The mask of youth had saved [him]2023-the man .

And yet if it had been merely an illusion , how terrible it was to think that conscience could raise such fearful phantoms , and give [them]1764-them visible form , and make [them]1764-them move before one ! What sort of life would [his]2023-the man be if , day and night , shadows of [his]2023-the man crime were to peer at [him]2023-the man from silent corners , to mock [him]2023-the man from secret places , to whisper in [his]2023-the man ear as [he]2023-the man sat at the feast , to wake [him]2023-the man with icy fingers as [he]2023-the man lay asleep ! As the thought crept through [his]2023-the man brain , [he]2023-the man grew pale with terror , and the air seemed to [him]2023-the man to have become suddenly colder . Oh ! in what a wild hour of madness [he]2023-the man had killed [[his]2023-the man friend]643-his friend ! How ghastly the mere memory of the scene ! [He]2023-the man saw it all again . Each hideous detail came back to [him]2023-the man with added horror . Out of the black cave of time , terrible and swathed in scarlet , rose the image of [his]2023-the man sin . When [Lord Henry]120-lord henry came in at six o clock , [he]120-lord henry found [him]2023-the man crying as [one whose heart will break]1766-one whose heart will break .

It was not till the third day that [he]2023-the man ventured to go out . There was something in the clear , pine - scented air of that winter morning that seemed to bring [him]2023-the man back [his]2023-the man joyousness and [his]2023-the man ardour for life . But it was not merely the physical conditions of environment that had caused the change . [His]2023-the man own nature had revolted against the excess of anguish that had sought to maim and mar the perfection of its calm . With subtle and finely wrought temperaments it is always so . [Their]1767-their strong passions must either bruise or bend . [They]1767-their either slay [the man]2023-the man , or [themselves]1767-their die . Shallow sorrows and shallow loves live on . The loves and sorrows that are great are destroyed by [their]1767-their own plenitude . Besides , [he]2023-the man had convinced [himself]2023-the man that [he]2023-the man had been the victim of a terror - stricken imagination , and looked back now on [his]2023-the man fears with something of pity and not a little of contempt .

After breakfast , [he]2023-the man walked with [the duchess]573-the duchess for an hour in [the garden]384-the garden and then drove across [the park]2309-the park to join the shooting - party . The crisp frost lay like salt upon the grass . The sky was an inverted cup of blue metal . A thin film of ice bordered [the flat , reed - grown lake]1772-the flat , reed - grown lake .

At the corner of [the pine - wood]1773-the pine - wood [he]2023-the man caught sight of [Sir Geoffrey Clouston]332-geoffrey , [[the duchess]573-the duchess s brother]1775-the duchess s brother , jerking two spent cartridges out of [his]332-geoffrey gun . [He]2023-the man jumped from [the cart]1776-the cart , and having told [the groom]1777-the groom to take the mare [home]2087-home , made [his]2023-the man way towards [[his]2023-the man guest]1779-his guest through the withered bracken and rough undergrowth .

" Have [you]332-geoffrey had good sport , [Geoffrey]332-geoffrey ? "[2023-the man] [he]2023-the man asked .

" Not very good , [Dorian]3385-dorian . [I]2023-the man think most of the birds have gone to the open . [I]2023-the man dare say it will be better after lunch , when [we]1780-we get to new ground . "[2023-the man]

[Dorian]117-dorian gray strolled along by [his]332-geoffrey side . The keen aromatic air , the brown and red lights that glimmered in the wood , the hoarse cries of the beaters ringing out from time to time , and the sharp snaps of the guns that followed , fascinated [him]117-dorian gray and filled [him]117-dorian gray with a sense of delightful freedom . [He]117-dorian gray was dominated by the carelessness of happiness , by the high indifference of joy .

Suddenly from a lumpy tussock of old grass some twenty yards in front of [them]1780-we , with black - tipped ears erect and long hinder limbs throwing it forward , started a hare . It bolted for [a thicket of alders]1781-a thicket of alders . [Sir Geoffrey]332-geoffrey put [his]332-geoffrey gun to [his]332-geoffrey shoulder , but there was something in the animal s grace of movement that strangely charmed [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray , and [he]332-geoffrey cried out at once , " Don t shoot it , [Geoffrey]332-geoffrey . Let [it]3386-it live . "[332-geoffrey]

" What nonsense , [Dorian]3387-dorian ! "[397-his companion] laughed [[his]332-geoffrey companion]397-his companion , and as the hare bounded into the thicket , [he]332-geoffrey fired . There were two cries heard , the cry of a hare in pain , which is dreadful , the cry of [a man in agony , which is worse]1783-a man in agony , which is worse .

" Good heavens ! [I]332-geoffrey have hit [a beater]3388-a beater ! "[332-geoffrey] exclaimed [Sir Geoffrey]332-geoffrey . " What [an ass]3389-an ass [the man]2023-the man was to get in front of the guns ! Stop shooting there ! "[332-geoffrey] [he]332-geoffrey called out at the top of [his]332-geoffrey voice . " [A man]380-a man is hurt . "[332-geoffrey]

[The head - keeper]1784-the head - keeper came running up with a stick in [his]1784-the head - keeper hand .

" Where , [sir]2063-sir ? Where is [he]380-a man ? "[1784-the head - keeper] [he]1784-the head - keeper shouted . At the same time , the firing ceased along the line .

" Here , "[332-geoffrey] answered [Sir Geoffrey]332-geoffrey angrily , hurrying towards the thicket . " Why on earth don t [you]2063-sir keep [[your]2063-sir men]2987-your men back ? Spoiled [my]332-geoffrey shooting for the day . "[332-geoffrey]

[Dorian]117-dorian gray watched [them]1785-them as [they]1785-them plunged into [the alder - clump]1786-the alder - clump , brushing the lithe swinging branches aside . In a few moments [they]1785-them emerged , dragging a body after [them]1785-them into the sunlight . [He]117-dorian gray turned away in horror . It seemed to [him]117-dorian gray that misfortune followed wherever [he]117-dorian gray went . [He]117-dorian gray heard [Sir Geoffrey]332-geoffrey ask if [the man]2023-the man was really dead , and the affirmative answer of [the keeper]1788-the keeper . The wood seemed to [him]117-dorian gray to have become suddenly alive with faces . There was the trampling of myriad feet and the low buzz of voices . A great copper - breasted pheasant came beating through the boughs overhead .

After a few moments that were to [him]117-dorian gray , in [his]117-dorian gray perturbed state , like endless hours of pain [he]117-dorian gray felt a hand laid on [his]117-dorian gray shoulder . [He]117-dorian gray started and looked round .

" [Dorian]3394-dorian , "[120-lord henry] said [Lord Henry]120-lord henry , " [I]120-lord henry had better tell [them]3395-them that the shooting is stopped for to - day . It would not look well to go on . "[120-lord henry]

" [I]117-dorian gray wish it were stopped for ever , [Harry]120-lord henry , "[117-dorian gray] [he]117-dorian gray answered bitterly . " The whole thing is hideous and cruel . Is [the man]2023-the man ... ? "[117-dorian gray]

[Upstairs]676-upstairs , in [[his]1807-he own room]891-his own room , [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray was lying on a sofa , with terror in every tingling fibre of [his]1807-he body . Tell [one of [the grooms]3473-the grooms]3472-one of the grooms to bring [my]117-dorian gray horse round . No . Never mind . [I]117-dorian gray ll go to [the stables]3474-the stables [myself]117-dorian gray . It will save time . "[117-dorian gray]

In less than a quarter of an hour , [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray was galloping down [the long avenue]1823-the long avenue as hard as [he]117-dorian gray could go . The trees seemed to sweep past [him]117-dorian gray in spectral procession , and wild shadows to fling themselves across [his]117-dorian gray path . Once the mare swerved at a white gate - post and nearly threw [him]117-dorian gray . [He]117-dorian gray lashed [her]1824-her across the neck with [his]117-dorian gray crop . [She]1824-her cleft the dusky air like an arrow . The stones flew from [her]1824-her hoofs .

At last [he]117-dorian gray reached [the Home Farm]3466-the home farm . [Two men]1631-two men were loitering in [the yard]1827-the yard . [He]117-dorian gray leaped from the saddle and threw the reins to one of [them]1631-two men . In [the farthest stable]1828-the farthest stable a light was glimmering . Something seemed to tell [him]117-dorian gray that [the body]1829-the body was there , and [he]117-dorian gray hurried to the door and put [his]117-dorian gray hand upon the latch .

There [he]117-dorian gray paused for a moment , feeling that [he]117-dorian gray was on the brink of a discovery that would either make or mar [his]117-dorian gray life . Then [he]117-dorian gray thrust the door open and entered .

On a heap of sacking in the far corner was lying the dead body of [a man dressed in a coarse shirt and a pair of blue trousers]1830-a man dressed in a coarse shirt and a pair of blue trousers . A spotted handkerchief had been placed over the face . A coarse candle , stuck in a bottle , sputtered beside it .

[Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray shuddered . [He]117-dorian gray felt that [his]117-dorian gray could not be the hand to take the handkerchief away , and called out to [one of [the farm - servants]1832-the farm - servants]1831-one of the farm - servants to come to [him]117-dorian gray .

" Take that thing off the face . [I]117-dorian gray wish to see it , "[117-dorian gray] [he]117-dorian gray said , clutching at the door - post for support .

When [the farm - servant]1833-the farm - servant had done so , [he]117-dorian gray stepped forward . A cry of joy broke from [his]117-dorian gray lips . [The man who had been shot in the thicket]1834-the man who had been shot in the thicket was [James Vane]183-jim .

[He]183-jim stood there for some minutes looking at the dead body . As [he]183-jim rode [home]2087-home , [his]183-jim eyes were full of tears , for [he]183-jim knew [he]183-jim was safe .

CHAPTER XIX .

" There is no use [your]117-dorian gray telling [me]120-lord henry that [you]117-dorian gray are going to be good , "[120-lord henry] cried [Lord Henry]120-lord henry , dipping [his]120-lord henry white fingers into a red copper bowl filled with rose - water . " [You]117-dorian gray are quite perfect . [Pray]3475-pray , don t change . "[120-lord henry]

[Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray shook [his]117-dorian gray head . " No , [Harry]120-lord henry , [I]117-dorian gray have done too many dreadful things in [my]117-dorian gray life . [I]117-dorian gray am not going to do any more . [I]117-dorian gray began [my]117-dorian gray good actions yesterday . "[117-dorian gray]

" Where were [you]117-dorian gray yesterday ? "[120-lord henry]

" In [the country]511-the country , [Harry]120-lord henry . [I]117-dorian gray was staying at [a little inn]3477-a little inn by [myself]117-dorian gray . "[117-dorian gray]

" [[My]120-lord henry dear boy]2346-my dear boy , "[120-lord henry] said [Lord Henry]120-lord henry , smiling , " [anybody]1955-anybody can be good in [the country]511-the country . There are no temptations there . That is the reason why [people who live out of [town]1935-town]3481-people who live out of town are so absolutely uncivilized . [Civilization]3483-civilization is not by any means an easy thing to attain to . There are only two ways by which [man]364-man can reach it . One is by being cultured , the other by being corrupt . [Country people]3485-country people have no opportunity of being either , so [they]3485-country people stagnate . "[120-lord henry]

" Culture and corruption , "[117-dorian gray] echoed [Dorian]117-dorian gray . " [I]117-dorian gray have known something of both . It seems terrible to [me]117-dorian gray now that [they]3486-they should ever be found together . For [I]117-dorian gray have a new ideal , [Harry]120-lord henry . [I]117-dorian gray am going to alter . [I]117-dorian gray think [I]117-dorian gray have altered . "[117-dorian gray]

" [You]117-dorian gray have not yet told [me]397-his companion what [your]117-dorian gray good action was . Or did [you]117-dorian gray say [you]117-dorian gray had done more than one ? "[397-his companion] asked [[his]117-dorian gray companion]397-his companion as [he]117-dorian gray spilled into [his]117-dorian gray plate a little crimson pyramid of seeded strawberries and , through a perforated , shell - shaped spoon , snowed white sugar upon them .

" [I]120-lord henry can tell [you]120-lord henry , [Harry]120-lord henry . It is not a story [I]120-lord henry could tell to [any one else]3487-any one else . [I]120-lord henry spared [somebody]604-somebody . It sounds vain , but [you]120-lord henry understand what [I]120-lord henry mean . [She]604-somebody was quite beautiful and wonderfully like [Sibyl Vane]168-sibyl . [I]120-lord henry think it was that which first attracted [me]120-lord henry to [her]604-somebody . [You]120-lord henry remember [Sibyl]168-sibyl , don t [you]120-lord henry ? How long ago that seems ! Well , [Hetty]348-hetty was not one of [[our]3489-we own class]3490-our own class , of course . [She]348-hetty was simply [a girl in [a village]3492-a village]3491-a girl in a village . But [I]120-lord henry really loved [her]348-hetty . [I]120-lord henry am quite sure that [I]120-lord henry loved [her]348-hetty . All during this wonderful May that [we]3489-we have been having , [I]120-lord henry used to run down and see [her]348-hetty two or three times a week . Yesterday [she]348-hetty met [me]120-lord henry in [a little orchard]3493-a little orchard . The apple - blossoms kept tumbling down on [her]348-hetty hair , and [she]348-hetty was laughing . [We]3489-we were to have gone away together this morning at dawn . Suddenly [I]120-lord henry determined to leave [her]348-hetty as flowerlike as [I]120-lord henry had found [her]348-hetty . "[120-lord henry]

" [I]120-lord henry should think the novelty of the emotion must have given [you]120-lord henry a thrill of real pleasure , [Dorian]3494-dorian , "[120-lord henry] interrupted [Lord Henry]120-lord henry . " But [I]120-lord henry can finish [your]120-lord henry idyll for [you]120-lord henry . [You]120-lord henry gave [her]348-hetty good advice and broke [her]348-hetty heart . That was the beginning of [your]120-lord henry reformation . "[120-lord henry]

" [Harry]120-lord henry , [you]120-lord henry are horrible ! [You]120-lord henry mustn t say these dreadful things . [Hetty]348-hetty s heart is not broken . "[120-lord henry]

" And weep over [a faithless Florizel]3495-a faithless florizel , "[120-lord henry] said [Lord Henry]120-lord henry , laughing , as [he]120-lord henry leaned back in [his]120-lord henry chair . " [[My]120-lord henry dear]1914-my dear [Dorian]117-dorian gray , [you]117-dorian gray have the most curiously boyish moods . Do [you]117-dorian gray think [this girl]2406-this girl will ever be really content now with [any one of [her]2406-this girl own rank]3498-any one of her own rank ? "[120-lord henry]

" [I]120-lord henry can t bear this , [Harry]120-lord henry ! [You]120-lord henry mock at everything , and then suggest the most serious tragedies . [I]120-lord henry am sorry [I]120-lord henry told [you]120-lord henry now . [I]120-lord henry don t care what [you]120-lord henry say to [me]120-lord henry . [I]120-lord henry want to be better . [I]120-lord henry am going to be better . Tell [me]120-lord henry something about [yourself]120-lord henry . What is going on in [town]1935-town ? [I]120-lord henry have not been to [the club]2210-the club for days . "[120-lord henry]

" [The people]1905-the people are still discussing [poor Basil]121-basil s disappearance . "[120-lord henry]

" [I]117-dorian gray should have thought [they]1905-the people had got tired of that by this time , "[117-dorian gray] said [Dorian]117-dorian gray , pouring [himself]117-dorian gray out some wine and frowning slightly .

" [[My]120-lord henry dear boy]2346-my dear boy , [they]1905-the people have only been talking about it for six weeks , and [the British public]3509-the british public are really not equal to the mental strain of having more than one topic every three months . [They]1905-the people have been very fortunate lately , however . [They]1905-the people have had [my]120-lord henry own divorce - case and [Alan Campbell]309-alan s suicide . Now [they]1905-the people have got the mysterious disappearance of [an artist]368-an artist . [It]112-san francisco must be [a delightful city]3516-a delightful city , and possess all the attractions of [the next world]3226-the next world . "[120-lord henry]

" What do [you]117-dorian gray think has happened to [Basil]121-basil ? "[117-dorian gray] asked [Dorian]117-dorian gray , holding up [his]117-dorian gray Burgundy against the light and wondering how it was that [he]117-dorian gray could discuss the matter so calmly .

" [I]120-lord henry have not the slightest idea . If [Basil]121-basil chooses to hide [himself]121-basil , it is no business of [mine]120-lord henry . If [he]121-basil is dead , [I]120-lord henry don t want to think about [him]121-basil . Death is the only thing that ever terrifies [me]120-lord henry . [I]120-lord henry hate it . "[120-lord henry]

" Why ? "[1391-the younger man] said [the younger man]1391-the younger man wearily .

" Because , "[120-lord henry] said [Lord Henry]120-lord henry , passing beneath [his]120-lord henry nostrils the gilt trellis of an open vinaigrette box , " one can survive everything nowadays except that . Death and vulgarity are the only two facts in the nineteenth century that one can not explain away . Let [us]3518-us have [our]3518-us coffee in [the music - room]3519-the music - room , [Dorian]3520-dorian . [You]3520-dorian must play Chopin to [me]120-lord henry . [I]120-lord henry was very fond of [her]165-victoria . [The house]425-the house is rather lonely without [her]165-victoria . Of course , married life is merely a habit , a bad habit . [Dorian]117-dorian gray said nothing , but rose from the table , and passing into [the next room]1097-the next room , sat down to the piano and let [his]117-dorian gray fingers stray across the white and black ivory of the keys . "[117-dorian gray]

[Lord Henry]120-lord henry yawned . " [Basil]121-basil was very popular , and always wore a Waterbury watch . Why should [he]121-basil have been murdered ? [He]121-basil was not clever enough to have [enemies]3524-enemies . Of course , [he]121-basil had a wonderful genius for painting . "[120-lord henry]

" Oh , some of the papers do . It does not seem to [me]120-lord henry to be at all probable . "[1391-the younger man] said [the younger man]1391-the younger man . [He]1391-the younger man watched [him]117-dorian gray intently after [he]117-dorian gray had spoken .

" [I]120-lord henry would say , [[my]120-lord henry dear fellow]1907-my dear fellow , that [you]117-dorian gray were posing for a character that doesn t suit [you]117-dorian gray . " A method of procuring sensations ? Do [you]120-lord henry think , then , that [a man who has once committed a murder]3531-a man who has once committed a murder could possibly do the same crime again ? Don t tell [me]120-lord henry that . "[120-lord henry]

Do [you]3537-you know , [I]120-lord henry don t think [he]121-basil would have done much more good work . During the last ten years [his]121-basil painting had gone off very much . "[120-lord henry]

[Dorian]117-dorian gray heaved a sigh , and [Lord Henry]120-lord henry strolled across [the room]386-the room and began to stroke the head of a curious Java parrot , a large , grey - plumaged bird with pink crest and tail , that was balancing itself upon a bamboo perch . As [his]120-lord henry pointed fingers touched it , it dropped the white scurf of crinkled lids over black , glasslike eyes and began to sway backwards and forwards .

" Yes , "[120-lord henry] [he]120-lord henry continued , turning round and taking [his]120-lord henry handkerchief out of [his]120-lord henry pocket ; " [his]121-basil painting had quite gone off . [You]3537-you never got it back ? What a pity ! it was really a masterpiece . [I]120-lord henry remember [I]120-lord henry wanted to buy it . [I]120-lord henry wish [I]120-lord henry had now . " [I]117-dorian gray forget , "[117-dorian gray] said [Dorian]117-dorian gray . " [I]117-dorian gray suppose [I]117-dorian gray did . But [I]117-dorian gray never really liked it . " Like the painting of a sorrow , A face without a heart . "[120-lord henry]

[The elder man]966-the elder man lay back and looked at [him]117-dorian gray with half - closed eyes . " By the way , [Dorian]3544-dorian , "[117-dorian gray] [he]117-dorian gray said after a pause , " what does it profit [a man]380-a man if [he]380-a man gain [the whole world]2139-the whole world and lose how does the quotation run ? " [[My]120-lord henry dear fellow]1907-my dear fellow , "[120-lord henry] said [Lord Henry]120-lord henry , elevating [his]120-lord henry eyebrows in surprise , " [I]120-lord henry asked [you]1907-my dear fellow because [I]120-lord henry thought [you]1907-my dear fellow might be able to give [me]120-lord henry an answer . That is all . [I]120-lord henry was going through [the park]2309-the park last Sunday , and close by [the Marble Arch]113-the marble arch there stood a little crowd of [shabby - looking people]3549-shabby - looking people listening to [some vulgar street - preacher]3550-some vulgar street - preacher . As [I]120-lord henry passed by , [I]120-lord henry heard [the man]2023-the man yelling out that question to [[his]2023-the man audience]587-his audience . It struck [me]120-lord henry as being rather dramatic . [London]2-london is very rich in curious effects of that kind . A wet Sunday , an uncouth Christian in a mackintosh , a ring of sickly white faces under a broken roof of dripping umbrellas , and a wonderful phrase flung into the air by shrill hysterical lips it was really very good in its way , quite a suggestion . [I]120-lord henry thought of telling [the prophet]3553-the prophet that art had [a soul]3554-a soul , but [that man]3555-that man had not . [I]120-lord henry am afraid , however , [he]3555-that man would not have understood [me]120-lord henry . "[120-lord henry]

" Don t , [Harry]120-lord henry . The soul is a terrible reality . [It]3554-a soul can be bought , and sold , and bartered away . It can be poisoned , or made perfect . There is a soul in [each one of [us]3557-our]3556-each one of us . [I]117-dorian gray know it . "[117-dorian gray]

" Do [you]120-lord henry feel quite sure of that , [Dorian]3558-dorian ? "[120-lord henry]

" Quite sure . "[117-dorian gray]

" Ah ! then it must be an illusion . The things [one]381-one feels absolutely certain about are never true . That is the fatality of faith , and the lesson of romance . How grave [you]3558-dorian are ! Don t be so serious . What have [you]3558-dorian or [I]120-lord henry to do with the superstitions of [our]3557-our age ? No : [we]3557-our have given up [our]3557-our belief in the soul . Play [me]120-lord henry something . Play [me]120-lord henry a nocturne , [Dorian]3560-dorian , and , as [you]3558-dorian play , tell [me]120-lord henry , in a low voice , how [you]3558-dorian have kept [your]3558-dorian youth . [You]3558-dorian must have some secret . [I]120-lord henry am only ten years older than [you]3558-dorian are , and [I]120-lord henry am wrinkled , and worn , and yellow . [You]3558-dorian are really wonderful , [Dorian]3561-dorian . [You]3558-dorian have never looked more charming than [you]3558-dorian do to - night . [You]3558-dorian remind [me]120-lord henry of the day [I]120-lord henry saw [you]3558-dorian first . [You]3558-dorian were rather cheeky , very shy , and absolutely extraordinary . [You]3558-dorian have changed , of course , but not in appearance . [I]120-lord henry wish [you]3558-dorian would tell [me]120-lord henry [your]3558-dorian secret . To get back [my]120-lord henry youth [I]120-lord henry would do anything in [the world]1908-the world , except take exercise , get up early , or be respectable . [Youth]135-youth ! There is nothing like it . It s absurd to talk of the ignorance of [youth]630-youth . [The only people to whose opinions [I]120-lord henry listen now with any respect]3564-the only people to whose opinions i listen now with any respect are [people much younger than [myself]120-lord henry]3565-people much younger than myself . [They]3565-people much younger than myself seem in front of [me]120-lord henry . [Life]352-life has revealed to [them]3565-people much younger than myself [her]352-life latest wonder . As for [the aged]3566-the aged , [I]120-lord henry always contradict [the aged]3566-the aged . [I]120-lord henry do it on principle . If [you]3558-dorian ask [them]3566-the aged [their]3566-the aged opinion on something that happened yesterday , [they]3566-the aged solemnly give [you]3558-dorian the opinions current in 1820 , when [people]1933-people wore high stocks , believed in everything , and knew absolutely nothing . How lovely that thing [you]3558-dorian are playing is ! [I]120-lord henry wonder , did [Chopin]227-chopin write it at [Majorca]114-majorca , with [the sea]3569-the sea weeping round [the villa]3570-the villa and the salt spray dashing against the panes ? It is marvellously romantic . What a blessing it is that there is one art left to [us]3571-us that is not imitative ! Don t stop . [I]120-lord henry want music to - night . It seems to [me]120-lord henry that [you]3558-dorian are [the young Apollo]3572-the young apollo and that [I]120-lord henry am [Marsyas]353-marsyas listening to [you]3558-dorian . [I]120-lord henry have sorrows , [Dorian]117-dorian gray , of [my]120-lord henry own , that even [you]3558-dorian know nothing of . The tragedy of old age is not that one is old , but that one is young . [I]120-lord henry am amazed sometimes at [my]120-lord henry own sincerity . Ah , [Dorian]117-dorian gray , how happy [you]117-dorian gray are ! What an exquisite life [you]117-dorian gray have had ! [You]117-dorian gray have drunk deeply of everything . [You]117-dorian gray have crushed the grapes against [your]117-dorian gray palate . Nothing has been hidden from [you]117-dorian gray . And it has all been to [you]117-dorian gray no more than the sound of music . It has not marred [you]117-dorian gray . [You]117-dorian gray are still the same . "[120-lord henry]

" [I]117-dorian gray am not the same , [Harry]120-lord henry . "[117-dorian gray]

" Yes , [you]117-dorian gray are the same . [I]120-lord henry wonder what the rest of [your]117-dorian gray life will be . Don t spoil it by renunciations . At present [you]117-dorian gray are a perfect type . Don t make [yourself]117-dorian gray incomplete . [You]117-dorian gray are quite flawless now . [You]117-dorian gray need not shake [your]117-dorian gray head : [you]117-dorian gray know [you]117-dorian gray are . Besides , [Dorian]3573-dorian , don t deceive [yourself]117-dorian gray . Life is not governed by will or intention . Life is a question of nerves , and fibres , and slowly built - up cells in which thought hides itself and passion has its dreams . [You]117-dorian gray may fancy [yourself]117-dorian gray safe and think [yourself]117-dorian gray strong . But a chance tone of colour in [a room]1253-a room or a morning sky , a particular perfume that [you]117-dorian gray had once loved and that brings subtle memories with it , a line from a forgotten poem that [you]117-dorian gray had come across again , a cadence from a piece of music that [you]117-dorian gray had ceased to play [I]120-lord henry tell [you]117-dorian gray , [Dorian]117-dorian gray , that it is on things like these that [our]3575-our lives depend . [Browning]3576-browning writes about that somewhere ; but [our]3575-our own senses will imagine them for [us]3575-our . There are moments when the odour of _ lilas blanc _ passes suddenly across [me]120-lord henry , and [I]120-lord henry have to live the strangest month of [my]120-lord henry life over again . [I]120-lord henry wish [I]120-lord henry could change places with [you]117-dorian gray , [Dorian]3577-dorian . [The world]1908-the world has cried out against [us]3575-our both , but it has always worshipped [you]117-dorian gray . [It]1908-the world always will worship [you]117-dorian gray . [You]117-dorian gray are the type of what the age is searching for , and what it is afraid it has found . [I]120-lord henry am so glad that [you]117-dorian gray have never done anything , never carved a statue , or painted a picture , or produced anything outside of [yourself]117-dorian gray ! Life has been [your]117-dorian gray art . [You]117-dorian gray have set [yourself]117-dorian gray to music . [Your]117-dorian gray days are [[your]117-dorian gray sonnets]3579-your sonnets . "[120-lord henry]

[Dorian]117-dorian gray rose up from the piano and passed [his]117-dorian gray hand through [his]117-dorian gray hair . " Yes , life has been exquisite , "[117-dorian gray] [he]117-dorian gray murmured , " but [I]117-dorian gray am not going to have the same life , [Harry]120-lord henry . " Why have [you]117-dorian gray stopped playing , [Dorian]3580-dorian ? Go back and give [me]117-dorian gray the nocturne over again . Let [us]3583-us go to [the club]2210-the club , then . It has been a charming evening , and [we]3583-us must end it charmingly . There is [some one at White s who wants immensely to know [you]117-dorian gray young [Lord Poole]354-lord poole , [[Bournemouth]355-bournemouth s eldest son]3586-bournemouth s eldest son]3585-some one at white s who wants immensely to know you young lord poole , bournemouth s eldest son . "[117-dorian gray]

" [I]117-dorian gray hope not , "[117-dorian gray] said [Dorian]117-dorian gray with a sad look in [his]117-dorian gray eyes . " But [I]117-dorian gray am tired to - night , [Harry]120-lord henry . " Do stay . [You]117-dorian gray have never played so well as to - night . There was something in [your]117-dorian gray touch that was wonderful . It had more expression than [I]117-dorian gray had ever heard from it before . "[117-dorian gray]

" [You]117-dorian gray can not change to [me]120-lord henry , [Dorian]3588-dorian , "[120-lord henry] said [Lord Henry]120-lord henry . " [You]117-dorian gray and [I]120-lord henry will always be [friends]1988-friends . "[120-lord henry]

" [[My]120-lord henry dear boy]2346-my dear boy , [you]120-lord henry are really beginning to moralize . [You]120-lord henry will soon be going about like [the converted]3592-the converted , and the revivalist , warning [people]1933-people against all the sins of which [you]120-lord henry have grown tired . [You]120-lord henry are much too delightful to do that . Besides , it is no use . [You]120-lord henry and [I]120-lord henry are what [we]3594-we are , and will be what [we]3594-we will be . As for being poisoned by a book , there is no such thing as that . Art has no influence upon action . It annihilates the desire to act . It is superbly sterile . The books that [the world]1908-the world calls immoral are books that show [the world]1908-the world [its]1908-the world own shame . That is all . But [we]3594-we won t discuss literature . Come round to - morrow . [I]120-lord henry am going to ride at eleven . [We]3594-we might go together , and [I]120-lord henry will take [you]120-lord henry to lunch afterwards with [Lady Branksome]356-lady branksome . " Must [I]117-dorian gray really come , [Harry]120-lord henry ? "[117-dorian gray]

" Very well . [I]117-dorian gray shall be here at eleven , "[117-dorian gray] said [Dorian]117-dorian gray . " Good night , [Harry]120-lord henry . "[117-dorian gray] As [he]117-dorian gray reached the door , [he]117-dorian gray hesitated for a moment , as if [he]117-dorian gray had something more to say . Then [he]117-dorian gray sighed and went out .

[CHAPTER XX]115-chapter xx .

It was a lovely night , so warm that [he]117-dorian gray threw [his]117-dorian gray coat over [his]117-dorian gray arm and did not even put [his]117-dorian gray silk scarf round [his]117-dorian gray throat . As [he]117-dorian gray strolled [home]2087-home , smoking [his]117-dorian gray cigarette , [two young men in evening dress]1844-two young men in evening dress passed [him]117-dorian gray . [He]117-dorian gray heard [one of [them]1844-two young men in evening dress]1845-one of them whisper to [the other]3065-the other , " That is [Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray . "[1845-one of them] [He]117-dorian gray remembered how pleased [he]117-dorian gray used to be when [he]117-dorian gray was pointed out , or stared at , or talked about . [He]117-dorian gray was tired of hearing [his]117-dorian gray own name now . Half the charm of [the little village]1847-the little village where [he]117-dorian gray had been so often lately was that [no one]2310-no one knew who [he]117-dorian gray was . [He]117-dorian gray had often told [the girl whom [he]117-dorian gray had lured to love [him]117-dorian gray]1849-the girl whom he had lured to love him that [he]117-dorian gray was poor , and [she]1849-the girl whom he had lured to love him had believed [him]117-dorian gray . [He]117-dorian gray had told [her]1849-the girl whom he had lured to love him once that [he]117-dorian gray was wicked , and [she]1849-the girl whom he had lured to love him had laughed at [him]117-dorian gray and answered that [wicked people]1850-wicked people were always very old and very ugly . What a laugh [she]1849-the girl whom he had lured to love him had ! just like a thrush singing . And how pretty [she]1849-the girl whom he had lured to love him had been in [her]1849-the girl whom he had lured to love him cotton dresses and [her]1849-the girl whom he had lured to love him large hats ! [She]1849-the girl whom he had lured to love him knew nothing , but [she]1849-the girl whom he had lured to love him had everything that [he]117-dorian gray had lost .

When [he]117-dorian gray reached [home]2087-home , [he]117-dorian gray found [[his]117-dorian gray servant]422-his servant waiting up for [him]117-dorian gray . [He]117-dorian gray sent [him]422-his servant to bed , and threw [himself]117-dorian gray down on the sofa in [the library]887-the library , and began to think over some of the things that [Lord Henry]120-lord henry had said to [him]117-dorian gray .

Was it really true that [one]381-one could never change ? [He]117-dorian gray felt a wild longing for the unstained purity of [his]117-dorian gray boyhood [his]1855-his rose - white boyhood , as [Lord Henry]120-lord henry had once called it . [He]117-dorian gray knew that [he]117-dorian gray had tarnished [himself]117-dorian gray , filled [his]117-dorian gray mind with corruption and given horror to [his]117-dorian gray fancy ; that [he]117-dorian gray had been an evil influence to [others]1931-others , and had experienced a terrible joy in being so ; and that of the lives that had crossed [his]117-dorian gray own , it had been the fairest and the most full of promise that [he]117-dorian gray had brought to shame . But was it all irretrievable ? Was there no hope for [him]117-dorian gray ?

Ah ! in what a monstrous moment of pride and passion [he]117-dorian gray had prayed that the portrait should bear the burden of [his]117-dorian gray days , and [he]117-dorian gray keep the unsullied splendour of eternal youth ! All [his]117-dorian gray failure had been due to that . Better for [him]117-dorian gray that each sin of [his]117-dorian gray life had brought its sure swift penalty along with it . There was purification in punishment . Not " Forgive [us]3600-us [our]3600-us sins "[364-man] but " Smite [us]3600-us for [our]3600-us iniquities "[364-man] should be the prayer of [man]364-man to [a most just God]1858-a most just god .

The curiously carved mirror that [Lord Henry]120-lord henry had given to [him]117-dorian gray , so many years ago now , was standing on the table , and the white - limbed Cupids laughed round it as of old . [He]117-dorian gray took it up , as [he]117-dorian gray had done on that night of horror when [he]117-dorian gray had first noted the change in the fatal picture , and with wild , tear - dimmed eyes looked into its polished shield . Once , [some one who had terribly loved [him]117-dorian gray]1859-some one who had terribly loved him had written to [him]117-dorian gray a mad letter , ending with these idolatrous words : " [The world]1908-the world is changed because [you]117-dorian gray are made of ivory and gold . The curves of [your]117-dorian gray lips rewrite history . "[1859-some one who had terribly loved him] The phrases came back to [his]117-dorian gray memory , and [he]117-dorian gray repeated them over and over to [himself]117-dorian gray . Then [he]117-dorian gray loathed [his]117-dorian gray own beauty , and flinging the mirror on the floor , crushed it into silver splinters beneath [his]117-dorian gray heel . It was [his]117-dorian gray beauty that had ruined [him]117-dorian gray , [his]117-dorian gray beauty and the youth that [he]117-dorian gray had prayed for . But for those two things , [his]117-dorian gray life might have been free from stain . [His]117-dorian gray beauty had been to [him]117-dorian gray but a mask , [his]117-dorian gray youth but a mockery . What was youth at best ? A green , an unripe time , a time of shallow moods , and sickly thoughts . Why had [he]117-dorian gray worn its livery ? [Youth]135-youth had spoiled [him]117-dorian gray .

It was better not to think of the past . Nothing could alter that . It was of [himself]117-dorian gray , and of [his]117-dorian gray own future , that [he]117-dorian gray had to think . [James Vane]183-jim was hidden in [a nameless grave in [Selby churchyard]16-selby]1860-a nameless grave in selby churchyard . [Alan Campbell]309-alan had shot [himself]309-alan one night in [[his]309-alan laboratory]1861-his laboratory , but had not revealed the secret that [he]309-alan had been forced to know . The excitement , such as it was , over [Basil Hallward]121-basil s disappearance would soon pass away . It was already waning . [He]117-dorian gray was perfectly safe [there]1904-there . Nor , indeed , was it the death of [Basil Hallward]121-basil that weighed most upon [his]117-dorian gray mind . It was the living death of [his]117-dorian gray own soul that troubled [him]117-dorian gray . [Basil]121-basil had painted the portrait that had marred [his]117-dorian gray life . [He]117-dorian gray could not forgive [him]117-dorian gray that . It was the portrait that had done everything . [Basil]121-basil had said things to [him]117-dorian gray that were unbearable , and that [he]117-dorian gray had yet borne with patience . The murder had been simply the madness of a moment . As for [Alan Campbell]309-alan , [his]309-alan suicide had been [his]309-alan own act . [He]309-alan had chosen to do it . It was nothing to [him]309-alan .

A new life ! That was what [he]309-alan wanted . That was what [he]309-alan was waiting for . Surely [he]309-alan had begun it already . [He]309-alan had spared one innocent thing , at any rate . [He]309-alan would never again tempt innocence . [He]309-alan would be good .

As [he]309-alan thought of [Hetty Merton]348-hetty , [he]309-alan began to wonder if the portrait in [the locked room]1118-the locked room had changed . Surely it was not still so horrible as it had been ? Perhaps if [his]309-alan life became pure , [he]309-alan would be able to expel every sign of evil passion from the face . Perhaps the signs of evil had already gone away . [He]309-alan would go and look .

[He]309-alan took the lamp from the table and crept [upstairs]676-upstairs . As [he]309-alan unbarred the door , a smile of joy flitted across [his]309-alan strangely young - looking face and lingered for a moment about [his]309-alan lips . Yes , [he]309-alan would be good , and the hideous thing that [he]309-alan had hidden away would no longer be a terror to [him]309-alan . [He]309-alan felt as if the load had been lifted from [him]309-alan already .

[He]309-alan went in quietly , locking the door behind [him]309-alan , as was [his]309-alan custom , and dragged the purple hanging from the portrait . A cry of pain and indignation broke from [him]309-alan . [He]309-alan could see no change , save that in the eyes there was a look of cunning and in the mouth the curved wrinkle of [the hypocrite]3081-the hypocrite . The thing was still loathsome more loathsome , if possible , than before and the scarlet dew that spotted the hand seemed brighter , and more like blood newly spilled . Then [he]309-alan trembled . Had it been merely vanity that had made [him]309-alan do [his]309-alan one good deed ? Or the desire for a new sensation , as [Lord Henry]120-lord henry had hinted , with [his]120-lord henry mocking laugh ? Or that passion to act a part that sometimes makes [us]1866-us do things finer than [we]1866-us are [ourselves]1866-us ? Or , perhaps , all these ? And why was the red stain larger than it had been ? It seemed to have crept like a horrible disease over the wrinkled fingers . There was blood on the painted feet , as though the thing had dripped blood even on the hand that had not held the knife . Confess ? Did it mean that [he]309-alan was to confess ? To give [himself]309-alan up and be put to death ? [He]309-alan laughed . [He]309-alan felt that the idea was monstrous . Besides , even if [he]309-alan did confess , who would believe [him]309-alan ? There was no trace of [the murdered man]1434-the murdered man anywhere . Everything belonging to [him]309-alan had been destroyed . [He]309-alan [himself]309-alan had burned what had been below - stairs . [The world]1908-the world would simply say that [he]309-alan was mad . [They]1908-the world would shut [him]309-alan up if [he]309-alan persisted in [his]309-alan story .... Yet it was [his]309-alan duty to confess , to suffer public shame , and to make public atonement . There was [a God who called upon [men]2041-men to tell [their]2041-men sins to earth as well as to heaven]1869-a god who called upon men to tell their sins to earth as well as to heaven . Nothing that [he]1869-a god who called upon men to tell their sins to earth as well as to heaven could do would cleanse [him]1869-a god who called upon men to tell their sins to earth as well as to heaven till [he]1869-a god who called upon men to tell their sins to earth as well as to heaven had told [his]1869-a god who called upon men to tell their sins to earth as well as to heaven own sin . [His]1869-a god who called upon men to tell their sins to earth as well as to heaven sin ? [He]309-alan shrugged [his]309-alan shoulders . The death of [Basil Hallward]121-basil seemed very little to [him]309-alan . [He]309-alan was thinking of [Hetty Merton]348-hetty . For it was an unjust mirror , this mirror of [his]309-alan soul that [he]309-alan was looking at . Vanity ? Curiosity ? Hypocrisy ? Had there been nothing more in [his]309-alan renunciation than that ? There had been something more . At least [he]309-alan thought so . But who could tell ? ... No . There had been nothing more . Through vanity [he]309-alan had spared [her]348-hetty . In hypocrisy [he]309-alan had worn the mask of goodness . For curiosity s sake [he]309-alan had tried the denial of self . [He]309-alan recognized that now .

But this murder was it to dog [him]309-alan all [his]309-alan life ? Was [he]309-alan always to be burdened by [his]309-alan past ? Was [he]309-alan really to confess ? Never . There was only one bit of evidence left against [him]309-alan . The picture itself that was evidence . [He]309-alan would destroy it . Why had [he]309-alan kept it so long ? Once it had given [him]309-alan pleasure to watch it changing and growing old . Of late [he]309-alan had felt no such pleasure . It had kept [him]309-alan awake at night . When [he]309-alan had been away , [he]309-alan had been filled with terror lest other eyes should look upon it . It had brought melancholy across [his]309-alan passions . [Its]1871-its mere memory had marred many moments of joy . It had been like conscience to [him]309-alan . Yes , it had been conscience . [He]309-alan would destroy it .

[He]309-alan looked round and saw the knife that had stabbed [Basil Hallward]121-basil . [He]309-alan had cleaned it many times , till there was no stain left upon it . It was bright , and glistened . As it had killed [the painter]389-the painter , so it would kill [the painter]389-the painter s work , and all that that meant . [It]1874-it would kill the past , and when that was dead , [he]309-alan would be free . It would kill this monstrous soul - life , and without its hideous warnings , [he]309-alan would be at peace . [He]309-alan seized the thing , and stabbed the picture with it .

There was a cry heard , and a crash . The cry was so horrible in its agony that [the frightened servants]1875-the frightened servants woke and crept out of [[their]1875-the frightened servants rooms]1876-their rooms . [Two gentlemen]1877-two gentlemen , who were passing in [the square below]1878-the square below , stopped and looked up at [the great house]1879-the great house . [They]1877-two gentlemen walked on till [they]1877-two gentlemen met [a policeman]1880-a policeman and brought [him]1880-a policeman back . [The man]2023-the man rang the bell several times , but there was no answer . Except for a light in one of the top windows , [the house]425-the house was all dark . After a time , [he]1880-a policeman went away and stood in [an adjoining portico]1883-an adjoining portico and watched .

" [Whose house]3602-whose house is that , [Constable]3603-constable ? "[1884-the elder of the two gentlemen] asked [the elder of [the two gentlemen]1885-the two gentlemen]1884-the elder of the two gentlemen .

" [Mr. Dorian Gray]117-dorian gray s , [sir]2063-sir , "[1429-the policeman] answered [the policeman]1429-the policeman .

[They]1877-two gentlemen looked at [each other]1942-each other , as [they]1877-two gentlemen walked away , and sneered . [One of [them]1877-two gentlemen]1845-one of them was [[Sir Henry Ashton]304-sir henry ashton s uncle]1889-sir henry ashton s uncle .

Inside , in [the servants part of [the house]425-the house]1890-the servants part of the house , [the half - clad domestics]1892-the half - clad domestics were talking in low whispers to [each other]1942-each other . [Old Mrs. Leaf]213-leaf was crying and wringing [her]213-leaf hands . [Francis]269-francis was as pale as death .

After about a quarter of an hour , [he]269-francis got [the coachman]1894-the coachman and [one of [the footmen]550-the footmen]1895-one of the footmen and crept [upstairs]676-upstairs . [They]1877-two gentlemen knocked , but there was no reply . [They]1877-two gentlemen called out . Everything was still . Finally , after vainly trying to force the door , [they]1877-two gentlemen got on the roof and dropped down on to [the balcony]834-the balcony . The windows yielded easily [their]1877-two gentlemen bolts were old .

When [they]1877-two gentlemen entered , [they]1877-two gentlemen found hanging upon the wall a splendid portrait of [[their]1877-two gentlemen master]1899-their master as [they]1877-two gentlemen had last seen [him]1899-their master , in all the wonder of [his]1899-their master exquisite youth and beauty . Lying on the floor was [a dead man]3153-a dead man , in evening dress , with a knife in [his]3153-a dead man heart . [He]3153-a dead man was withered , wrinkled , and loathsome of visage . It was not till [they]1877-two gentlemen had examined the rings that [they]1877-two gentlemen recognized who it was .

[[THE END]1901-the end]1901-the end
